I went to primary school at the age of 7, and left it at 13 after successfully passing the entrance examination to junior Middle School. It took me 3 years to finish the junior secondary education. I didn't do a good job at the entrance examination to senior Middle School and nearly lost the opportunity of being a student of the key school. Because of the failure, I studied much harder than before and finally managed to be an excellent student. After graduation in 1991, while I was 19 years old, I took part in the national university entrance examination. I felt worried and anxious while waiting for the results. At last, I was lucky enough to pass the examination and became an English major of Guangzhou Institute of Forieign [fm1,-] languages. The Sacred Tree Long long ago, there was a fig tree regarded as sacred at Thika, in Kenya. Shortly before Kenya gained her independence, it was seriously struck by lightning in a stormy night and began to wither rapidly. The news encouraged people very much, because it fulfilled the prophecy made by kibiru, a famous prophet of the kikuyu tribes. What's more, it was said in the prophecy that the death of the tree will bring life to [np6, -2] new country. Visitors with excitement from all parts of the country gathered around the sacred tree. At last, it decayed completely just by the day Kenya offically [fm1,-] became independent. A new country was born. Nowdays [fm1,-]. [sn9, s] Around [fm3, 1-] the place the tree stood [wd4, s] a high wall made by colonist still remained. It had been a symbol of opress [fm1,-] but now it can do nothing to the independent Kenya. The Record-Holder A boy made himself well-known in England by travelling 1600 miles while playing truant. In other words, he had set up a record for the thousands of boys who dream of evading school. He reached Perpignan on the French-Spanish border at last and sent back to England by the local authorities. His parents who were so worried met him at the harbour and saw their dear son returning with sick, cold and hungry look. As soon as they met, the parents hugged the child tightly bursting into tears.[sn8,s]The boy's schoolmates lined [vp1, 1-2] the roads to give the boy a hero's welcome. Cheering him to school. But the boy himself was afraid of being punished. He was right. The headmaster who were [vp3, 4-] so angry made him give a talk to the whole school about his experiences abroad. [sn8,s]Actually. [sn9, s] The [fm3, 1-] children were very pround [fm1,-] of their little hero. He Became [fm3, 1-] the admiration of everyone. The Watch While I was in Junior 3, in 1988, my grand-parents who had been living in Taiwan Since 1949 were allowed to come to mainland to visit their relatives. It was really an exciting news for my family, for our reunion.[sn8,s] As their yougest [fm1,-] grand-daughter. [sn9, s] I was given a gift which was a delicate watch. It was so elegant on the wrist, and furthermore, so expensive that I always wear it with the covering of the cuff. One day, at school, suddenly, I was astonished to find that the watch had disappeared. I looked around and went back to the places where I had been just now but found nothing at all. It seemed that I would never see my watch again. While thinking of that, I blamed myself for my carelessness. I just didn't want to believe that I had lost it. It was so important a present given by my dear grandparents. All the morning, I sat there listless, disappointed and sad. Suddenly, there was a boy who were [vp3, 3-] shouting with something sparkle [wd2, 1-] in his hand:" whose [fm3, 1-] watch?" I rushed to him and excited to find that it was just my watch![sn8,s] The rest of the day I was full of joy. Until I got home did I realize that I had forgotten to express my appreciation to the boy. Escape It was a dark night. A prisoner of war had just escaped from the camp. Working very rapidly and carefully in the darkness, he was soon dressed himself as a guard in a blue uniform. At this moment, shouting in the camp was heard and people there were thrown into confusion. The prisoner was still in the camp, calm and cautious. He wormed his way into the crowd and pretended to be in search for the "missing" prisoner. Of course there wouldn't be any results. It was believed that the man had left the camp. Several groups of guards rushed out in a lorry. The prisoner quickly joined them. They were carried into the countryside where there was a forest streching [fm1,-] for miles. They went into the forest and scattered. The prisoner, who was so lucky to meet this golden opportunity, ran away as quickly as he could and soon disappeared. The Thief When I was a primary school pupil, one afternoon, I went to the book shop with a friend, with a ten-yuan note in the pocket of my trousers. I always put my hand right on the pocket so that I would know the money was safe there. The book shop was full of people who were busy looking for their favorite books. It took us quite a long time to be close to the counter. My hands were busy, so it was impossible for me to take care of the money. Suddenly, Noticed someone approached me in a very different way. [sn2,s]I took a glance at the person and found that he was a schoolboy, a little older and taller than me. He appeared to be looking for books. But his eyes told me he was nervous. At this very moment, he began to walk slowly in another direction. An idea occurred to me that there might be something wrong. I felt my pocket at once but found nothing. I gave a cry and saw the boy running towards the gate. He must be the thief and no mistake! My friend rushed to him without hesitation and seized him by the collar. The thief was so frightened that a ten-yuan note clenched in his first fell off. When we picked up the mote, he rapidly ran away and disappeared. A false [fm3, 1-] Alarm At first, my wife did not recognize me. Being in a drowse, she was astonished to find such a "stranger" climbing up to her window. At the same time, she saw the policeman then immediately gave a loud cry: "Oh, Sir, help! The thief!" "Yes, madam,!" [sn8,s] The policeman quicken [vp6,s-] his steps towards me without hesitation. I was so flurried that I climbed much more slowly than I expected. At last, he seized my left foot and pulled me down the ladder. In fact, his action was so sudden that I fell off the ground, giving a cry because of the sharp pain. Recognizing my tone, my wife realized her mistake and came to us at once. The policeman was seizing my collar at that time, holding up his head, full of sense of pride, like a hero. But, he was disappointed to hear not appreciation but explaination [fm1,-], and apology, "Well, madam, I'm awfully sorry" he said. Before leaving, he stared at me and spoke in a low voice:" Go on cleaning your window, sir. You enjoy doing that at night."Feb 22 1993Dear Min,Haven't seen you for a long time. A man Boiled With Anger Cities I Have Visited Cities I have visited can be divided into two groups. One is for those cities featuring a modern color. The other is for those cities which are old-fashioned. Modern cities exposes [vp3, 1-] you to an environment full of advanced inventions of mankind. In cities like HongKong, Shenzhen, and Zhuhai, sky scrapers and huge buildings stand in great numbers. Streets are crowded with taxies, cars and double-decker [fm1,-]-buses, shops are with customers in smart dress and abundant commodities. In their most [aj3, 1-1] busiest business center, the sky seems to be densely covered by colorful, eye catching sign-boards overhead. You find the name of night clubs, of bands, of well-known companies on the boards. They remain shining until mid-night. Statues and parks are built to dot the city, flowers and trees are planted to enhame [fm1,-] the beauty. A touch of artifical [fm1,-] greatness fills the air. Such a city fresh [vp3, 1-] your eyes. Old-fashioned cities, such as Guilin and Xi'an, have less [np8, s-] high buildings and architectures of modern style. However, they have more historical sites and scenic spots that are not affected by modern man. The splendid palases [fm1,-], the beautiful mountains and waters, the mysterious caves are their attractions. Such natural beauties without polution [fm1,-] lead you to a state of comfort and romance. Such a city fresh [vp3, 1-] your mind. South China Scientific and Technological University (Abbv SESTU ), is as famous as the Guangzhou Institute of Foreign Languages (Abbv GIGL) in Guangzhou. However, in terms of scenery of the campus, they vary in many aspects.The SCSTU covers much larger areas that [fm1,-] GIFL. For the [wd3, 1-] reason, SCSTU impressed [vp6,s-] you as tremendous and grand. In contrast, GIFI appears elaborate and small. The path in SCSTU is wide enough for two vehicles to drive abreast. However, like a stream but exquisite like a poem, giving you a touch of romance. [sn2,s]Students on campus are kind of" scenery". More boys walking on the campus in SCSTU than these in GIFL. Girls in GIFL are of great numbers. They seem to be smarter and more attractive. SCSTU is just like a brother with broad shoulder and great strength, while GIFL is like a sister with slim feagure [fm1,-] and elegant temperament. In GIFL, English majors are required to have a course called Communicative English for Chinese Learners in their first and second year. It is a textbook arranged according to various topics, focusing on the improvement of students listening and speaking ability. To begin a new chapter, the teacher gives a brief introduction of the topic first. Then, he usually gives a dictation as the warmming-up [fm1,-] exercise. He reads to his students a short passage concerning about the topic for three times. The first and the third time at normal speed, the second time with pause. [sn2,s]Students are expected to note down every word exactly at the second reading. After that, the teacher asks the class to put on their earphones. Then he plays the tape. It is about some conversations or monologues spoken by native speakers. Students are asked to grasp the gist at first listening, write down some details the second. Finally, the teacher will [vp6,s-1]raises several questions for the class to answer. The following step will be reading training. Five or six [wd4, s] materials are printed in the book. The teacher's duty is to organize the class to look through all of them in limited time. If there are any difficult language problems involved, he is expected to explain. So far the students have got a lot of ideas of the topic. The first period of the class ends. During the second period, the teacher may speak as little as he can. His concentration shifts to the guiding of his students' using of the knowledge. In order to achieve such a purpose, he chooses a subject or describes a situation first, then divides the class into hold [wd5, 1-1]a discussion groups. Students are expected to prepare for a dialogue, an individual speech, a debate or an interpretation activity. When they are ready, the teacher asks some of them to give their presentation or performance. At that time, he is responsible for invigorating the atmosphere of the class. He welcomes the audience's comments and gives his own, too. Before he calls it a day, he assign [vp3, 1-] to the class a writing task, usually a letter to the friend concerning the subject matter. At last, class is over in a quite relaxing atmosphere.Boredom In the dictionary, "boredom" is defined as the state of being tired. The word's synonyms range from "tedium" to "monotony" to "depression". When you are put into a situation that everything in the life remains the same day after day, you experience the feeling called " boredom". Teachers repeat their same lecture again and again for years although students are different Housewives do the work of cleaning, washing and cooking without any variation, energetic young men are limited to a small social circle, seeing the same faces of their friends last year, this year and probably next year......After enthusiasm and novelty have withered, boredom make [vp3, 1-] its appearance. It brings with itself the germ of disappointment and melancholy. Poor people who suffer from this inflammation always look worried and gloomy. The sequelae [fm1,-] affects the patient continuously and seriously. They pace to and fro in their narrow bedrooms, they lie in bed wide awake, tossing about from time to time. Boredom put [vp3, 1-] us in low spirits, painful and eager for new things to come. Gradually, some of the patients get recovery because they have found something stimulating. Often it is something unfavarouble [fm1,-]to do, unpleasant to hear. [sn9, s] Such as gambling. The pleasure of earning money, or the indignation for lossing [fm1,-] money may lead people to crime. On the other hand, other patients have a "rebirth " because they have found some things that are meaningful. They might move to another city, get to know new companions *. Everything they do is to avoid dullness, and to re-capture the interesting side of life. Therefore we can say that, boredom, as a temporary mental illness, is the sign of people's future tuning and changing. Unlike loneliness, which cam be cured by enjoying company, boredom needs the patient to recove [fm1,-] in the way he selects, that is, to cure himself by himself. It is not necessarily concerned with others. An old friend may not help at all. One day, when I returned to my dormitory cheerfully, with a book in my hand, I hardly bumped into A, one of my roomates [fm1,-]. "You seem so happy ," she said, " Some romance story must have happened!' " Nothing at all, actually." I answered. Then she found my book "yours [fm3, -]?" she asked. I explained that I lent [wd3, 1-] it from B, a male friend of mine."What? Is that tall boy in the French Department?" She looked at me with a secretive smile. "Yes." I mustered." Surely it is him !" I t seemed that she suddenly see [vp6,s-] the light. She always suspected that there was [vp3, 1-] relations beyond friendship between he [pr4, 1-] [pr4,s-] and me. " Between a women and a man,": She cleared her voice, and continued, "borrowing and lending a book are not simple matters----""What do you mean, then?" Interrupter her with a puzzled expression on my face. [sn8,s]She narrowed her eyes into a smile, then changed into a serious tone, saying that in the famous novel The Besieged City written by Qian Zhongshu, the author remarked that person who was in love with the other usually took borrowing books as an excuse. In that case you had to return the book after all, then naturally would be more than one chance for you to approach your beloved one.In a flash I understood what she meant. " There is nothing between he [pr4, 1-2] and I!" I retorted.                                                      "Don't be silly. Little girl.' [sn9, s] She behaved like an expert in love affairs, tenderly patted on my shoulder, " I've known all about you two."My face redden [vp6,s-] with anger. The further I explained, the remoter the victory. Finally, what I could do was to pull her pig-tail slightly and left some words as " I am not going to talk about this subject with you."

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GDUFS>, <AGE ?>, <WAY ?>, <DIC ?>, <TYP 2>????Madam, Although my self experience has told me that women are very hard to deal with. I decide to give you a lesson so as you can keep silence! I can't bear any more. In the past, I led a calm life, no one distrurbed [fm1,-] me. But three months ago, you became my neighbor, since then on, all my life customs had [vp6,s-] to be rearranged. I have to sleep in the daytime and go to my office to work at night, you are actually an artist of noise! You sing bad songs before the window, turn in very loud sound, throw cans and boxes heavily to the floor, and made [vp6,s-] other strange noise which I have never heard before! All these I have beared [fm1,-], I know clearly how an excellent man should act in such a case. Not with standing your [wd7, -1] gilt [fm1,-] are too numerous to mention. Things became aggravated. Yesterday noon, you came back with a [np7, 1-] ugly baby,(God knows who is his father, you are an unmarried woman, right?) and all the afternoon the damned baby cried and cried, like a roaring horn, and the worst of it, you blew a trumpet. I didn't know you like blowing trumpet, otherwise I should have taught you how to blow. But your trumpet was obviously a noise-producer. Hell! I don't know how long can I live in such a noisy house. I considered of leaving here, but I have lived here so [wd4, 1-]years, I love everything here, except you and your baby. So regret to tell you, that you'd better leave here soon, otherwise I will cut off your telephone line, electricity and water supply stealthily, and a friend of mine, who is good at stealing, will visit your room frequently. Cities I have Visited Cities I have visited can generally be divided into two types, modern and traditional. Guangzhou, is one of the most modern city in China. There, skyscrapers can been [vp9, 1-] seen everywhere. All kinds of motocars [fm1,-] fill the wide road. Railway, express way, overhead highway, ocean liner and airlines make the transportation very convenient and efficient. Citizens there are rich than the inlanders [fm1,-], and their idea is also modern and open. Shaoxing, a medium sided [fm1,-] city in Zhejiang province, is a typical tranditional [fm1,-] Chinese city. It has no skyscaper [fm1,-], no overhead high way, not to mention expressway, the most speedy transportation railway is constanted [fm1,-] by japanes [fm1,-] before liberation. Tile-roofed buildings and sampans compose the feature of the city. Citizens there are not so open-sighted and mammonistic [fm1,-] as in the southern cities. Many of them and [fm1,-] still keeping there [fm1,-] long-lasted life style inherited from their ancestors. In fast, the distinction between modern cities and traditional cities is becoming more and more vague. Modern culture and traditional culture exist simultaneously in many cities. But all those cities have the same develop [wd2, 1-] trend, they are becoming more and more modern. Two Schools By far I have only studied in three schools: a primary school ,a middle school and a university. The latter two give me great impression, so now I will talk about these two schools Dan Middle school and GDFL. Dan Middle school is a famous school in my hometown, it has1, 200 students, desided [fm1,-] into 24 classes, each class has almost 50 students. It lies at the foot of a mountain called Dan mountain, there are trees and flowers on campus, some of them are very precious. There is even a [np7, 1-] orchard behind the school building, with loquat, purple, arrange [fm1,-] and some other fruit trees in it, all many greedy students. Compared with Dan Middle school, GUFL is much bigger and famous. It has more students and teachers, more classes, but each class has only 20---30 students. It also lies at the foot of a mountain, it also has many trees and flowers on campus, but you can't find a single fruit tree there. Neverthless [fm1,-], you can satisfy you [pr4, 1-] stomach in canteens, food stalls and restaurants, you can easily find them. Since GUFL is a foreign languages university, students and teachers come from every part of the world, you can hear a lot of languages and dialects spoken there, while in Dan Middle school, you can only hear home's dialect, and English. The disciplines in GUFL is much looser than in Dan Middle school, there you can smoke, can drink, can talk freely, can have love affairs. Students have much free and colorful lives. CECL is a course of English for Chinese learners, it has its distinction compared with other language courses. First of all, CECL pays high attention on listening and oral skills. There are many listening and oral skills. There are many listening and oral exercises in this course. So to have this course, each student prepares their [pr3, 1-] own earphone, the teacher plays the CECL tape through a recorder, students listen to it and do the exercises on the book. Then the teacher checks students' answer. If necessary, the tape will be played again. As to oral exercises, the teacher usually devides [fm1,-] the class into several groups, each was 2 or 4 students, then the teacher set [vp3,1-] the students talk about the topics in English, the teacher listens to some of them and sometimes takes part in a certain group talking. If the topic is controversial, the teacher will allow students again. [sn8,s] Reading and writing also compose a very important part of CECL. There are many reading meterials [fm1,-]in CECL books, after students read them, they will be asked to do exercises, such as answering questions, do alternative choice commenting, etc.[sn8,s] Sometimes the teacher will ask the students to write a [np7, 1-] essay on the topic in or out side class. In CECL, materials for studying is not limited inside CECL, the teacher often offer other English materials to the students, such as English newspapers, magazines, foreign movies and English radio programme, etc. That's the distinction of CECL. Masculinity is the quality or state of having the qualities suitable for a man. It contains two aspects external masculinity and internal masculinity. External masculinity is observable from appearance. People usually define external masculinity as follows: tall and bright eyes, walks like a gale and stands like a pine. So within that defination [fm1,-], those who have poor eye sights, short or thin bodies, milky skins should be absolutely ruled  at  from the troops of [fm2, -1]he-men. [sn8,s]However, nowadays people consider internal masculinity more than external masculinity, especially those who have been ruled out from external [fm1, -1] mascular [fm2, -1]he-men. They define real [fm2, -1]he-man as that, a man with strong will and great endurance, he has his own ideal and struggle hard continuously for it, he will not weep when failed, never bend before others or difficulties, he may be thin and feeble in body, but his spirit is made of iron and steel. That is the internal masculinity, is it more difficult to achieve than external masculinity! It was 4 o'clock now, I reckoned uncle Wang should be at home at this time, so I picket up the phone and dialed his home. "Hello," a clear voice emerged. I knew it was uncle Wang's elder daughter. "Hello, this is Zhang Qing. I want to speak to uncle Wang, is he there? "Yes, wait a minute, please." After a few seconds. [sn2,s] The phone was picked again at the other end. "Hello, is that Zhang Qing?" "Yes, uncle Wang. I have something to tell you ." I answered hesitatingly. "Say it please." "Yesterday you ask me to post the packets at Huale Post office. I got there. The postman told me that there was no small-sized packet-box which we need, and he suggested me waiting [wd4, s] a few days. So I didn't post the packet yesterday." "Why, I have just post [vp9, 3-] the same size packet there last Wednesday!" "Yes, I know. But the postman said they had just used out that kind of packet-box." "OK, I think we'd better wait [wd4, s] a few days, You know that post office charges the lowest service free compared with others." "I know it, uncle Wang. So I will wait [wd4, s]a few days and try again on Wednesday." "OK, so, anything else?" "Nothing. Good-bye" "Good-bye!' I finished the call. When I was old enough to know what is teacher, I was told that it meant "poor". From a distant relative who is a teacher living in Guangzhou, what remained in my little mind was his poor housing condition and eating little meat at dinner. Once his son----- [sn9,s] an only child, was seriously ill, the poor father could do nothing because he had no enough money at hand. Later the boy was recovered, but the whole family was in debt, for a long time. The idea of being a teacher distressed me deeply. Not long ago, I went to see the relative again. He was retired while he loves teaching, so he acted as a part-time teacher. Actually I knew he still needed money. He told me something happened when he left Beijing during the journey on a train. After having visited his son, a teacher, in Beijing, for one week, the old father came home, along with him a 30-year old small black old suitcase, somewhat like school bag. At the beginning of the trip, it was peaceful. But one deep night, no one knew when, one section of the train where my relative stayed was robbed. Maybe due to fewer passengers than other sections, and there were no policemen, the passengers had to take out money, necklaces, etc. My poor kind relative tried his best to find out something valuable when the robbers faced him. He murmured, " I only have the tomorrow-breakfast-fee and the ticket-fee." Well ...n [wd7, 1-1] othing? "Er You know, I am a teacher, a " One of the robbers heard the last word, without awaiting the whole sentence "a retired one." He declared like a trump with despair, " Take care of your worn bag, old gentleman, I don't rob you. Teachers are still too poor to be robbed nowadays! Boys, go!" He waved his arm to other robbers and came at the rest passengers. Therefore, in the whole section, all the passengers were left few things except my old relative. When others "congratulated" him, his feeling coupled luck and sadness. Dear Mr. [wd6, -1]A and Mrs. A, I'm now writing to complain about the noises coming down from your house. In general, being a new neighbor of you I feel quite all right but for the noises. Almost every early morning since you came to live upstairs, Mrs. A sang [vp6,s-]songs from 5:30 to 6: 30. I form a habit of getting up late because I study till 11:30 at night. Mrs. A is a good singer but her voice is too loud, when she sings just a few meters above me.[sn8,s] I've tried earphones and I try to go on sleeping but it doesn't work. Now I get up at 5: 30am, and do morning reading with sleepy head and body. I know that you, Mr. A and Mrs. A, like pork very much. From 1:45pm to 2:00pm, 3 days per week, I hear the noises of chopping pork Mrs. A bought in the morning. At that time, unfortunately I am preparing my lessons in the afternoon. I can't concentrate my attention in reading with sounds made my [fm1,-] the chopping block and chopping knife. For these 2 weeks, you have Dance Competition to prepare. I'd like to see your dance but I will appreciate if you turn the radio a bit down. Besides that, would you not dance at other time but not from 9: 30pm to11:30pm? The steps are too heavy to stop the thrilling of my ceiling. As you know, the walls and ceiling are insulated badly. Last night, I saw something falling down from the ceiling, not dust. I have a bit worried about my safety and that of the house. By the way, I have a very very important exam next week and I am now busy in reviewing. Therefore I am not able to enjoy the dance and jazz music. Would Mr. A and Mrs. A have a little mercy on me? I look forward to hearing from you soon. Three games I've been playing are good for health, both in body and in mind. First of all, the game in summer is what I love most. And I love swimming. Summer seems a bit long here, including a 2-monthes summer holiday. The weather is so hot that I nearly want to cool myself in the pool all day long. In order to keep fit and a clear mind in study in spite of the boiling temperature, I have to take the swimming pool as the best place. Secondly, I like to play badminton in autumn. At the end of December, I usually have to prepare for exams, therefore, I have less time in playing. I often keep myself at home, as hard-working as a beaver. Mother sometimes drive me out of my " self-made prison " to rest. Then I ask friends to the badminton play-ground, enjoying autumn sun and autumn breeze. My tireness [fm1,-] dies away soon after the game. Finally, chess is played in spring and winter. Spring is ranny [wd7, 1-] season till we greet summer. That indicates less time for outdoor games to me. While winter is too cold to have sweat all-over my back and face. That's the reason that invite friends to play chess in winter holiday and in spring from time to time. Though chess seems to rob my brain some energy, it gives me rest as the badminton does. Since most of the time find failure in chess, I do not like to as much as I like badminton.[sn8,s]Games make my life fill with laughter, friendship and health. They will accompany me in all my life. I have been to two different restaurants which have difference various in environments, inner-restaurant settings, guests and waiters or waitresses. But they all bring me comfortable feelings. Restaurant A lies in the suburb and it is small in size. While Restaurant B is in the center of the city and it is large. Restaurant B is designed in the middle of a park. Restaurant A is somewhat like a classical restaurant. Oil paintings decorate the white wall, together with four soft lights pink. In contrast to A, B is simple. It has greenish walls, with four big windows without glass. From the windows, you can look directly into the park around you. Children playing, laughing, and jumping make it a bit noisy. However, A is obviously more peaceful. Restaurant A is near several [fm3, -1]Foreigners' houses, therefore, they always come there to enjoy dinners together. Usually half foreigners and half Chinese have dinner there. But it's no [wd2, 1-] so with Restaurant B. Almost all the customers are Chinese. Some kind of convinence [fm1,-] it brings is that whoever comes there can enjoy the food and the scenery. Restaurant A has five waiters or waitresses behind the counter and so the customers buy their food and sit down to enjoy it. Nevertheless, B has ten waitresses hurrying here and there, taking plates of dishes. Customers should first select courses from the menu and sit down to wait for them, drinking tea. After dinner, the waitress will come and you have your bill paid. For the previous whole two years, I had learned CECL-----Communicative English for Chinese Learners. This course is divided into eight text-books. And each kind of text-book is composed of teacher's text-book and student's text-book which we have in hand. Therefore in general, there are 16 books of CECL. The content is obviously large-scale. Let's take the unit " Environment "as an example. A hard-working student will first have a thorough survey of the lists of new words or phrases. Sometimes, the kind-hearted teacher gives them to us. It's not an easy work for me to prepare the hundreds of words useful in one unit. For the whole weeks of learning this unit, I found myself big-headed and heave-hearted, but still confidential [wd2, 1-] to catch 1/4 of the new words into my mind temporarily. The first 2 classes were tiresome. There were three tasks for us to do. First we had intensive reading. That's, we tried to find the answers from an article about 3 thousands words. It was a comment on Environment Pollution. We all were busy in looking through the article and at the some time finding the answers. After answering to questions, we did the vocabulary exercises. We had to look through the article again. The words were immense-scale, I think of owning four eyes or more. [sn8,s] It happened that the second task was in the second class. We had the listening. It was a long long article . Two persons were discussing the prevention of pollution . After it, the gap fillings and questions were waiting for us. We should finish them according to the tape after listening for one time. All the words should be done with a highly concentrated head. The rest time was to discuss the issue in the previous article about pollution. The teacher asked us to give our own opinions on the final paragraph, where the author gave his own opinion. Some discussed it with their partners without problems. Some discussed another " topic " excitedly. At the moment, some of us were sleepy. Therefore, we kept talking, talking and talking, and kept our eyes open, open and open. Then, some pairs would receive the respectful inspiration of the teacher. Others brought out their long long breath. The pair tried to hide their voices and, of course, tried to give a very brief answer---- no more than 3 sentences, 15 words. Finally, we hoped for the mercy bell. Some students might not agree with me, for they owned the teacher's book which contains all the answers in the student's book. BoredomIn my opinion, boredom has three meanings. One of them in the dictionary is : A sense of being tired and uninterested by being dull or [fm1, -1] tendious. To illustrate it I am to give you example. Once I came to visit a friend who newly worked in a kindergarten. It happened that she was telling a story full of feelings to the small ones. I over-heard one child near the door said," We hear the story 9 times." The other one corrected him," 10 times, I bet." And two of them gave a long breath. At first, the children showed calmness and patience. Four sentences later, they couldn't sit any longer and they seemed uneasy. The poor teacher didn't notice it and went on and on. In the middle of the story-telling, a child or two seemed that they wanted very much to interrupt my friend. I knew they could not, for they were thought it was impolite to do so. Some of them even had their [wd6, -1]eyebrows frowned their eyebrows. Then they talked to each other in low voices. Then in louder voices. Later, my poor friends noticed the noisy class and realized that it was an oldest story. When a person can't find anything to do, it is boredom who visits him. [sn8,s]N [fm1,-1]one Sunday morning, when I was awake, no one is found in the room. I felt lonely and it turned out to be boring. I washed my face and brushed my teeth slowly, like a snail. Then I tried to find something to eat but only got half a bowl of cookies. I gorged on them. Then I should read something and discovered that I should first listened to the music. And so I turned on radio, walk-man and TV. I was absent-minded throughout the whole morning. I sang "Country- road' sometime and danced for a while. Later I drank a cup of tea and a glass of milk and a bowl of fruit juice. Finally at 12:00pm . I slept. Boredom is a bad thing like the words said by Bertrand Russell. "Boredom is a vital problem for the moralist since at least half the sins of mankind are caused by fear of it." But it is something that none of us can resist. One thing happened when I was a 4-year-old girl which is impressed deep in my mind. At 6:00pm on one summer day in the country-side, I came home from the kinder-garden. Twelve minutes' walk made me so thirsty that I rush to the small store not far away from my house. A gentle-lady who was no more than 60 greeted me." Lovely girl, what can I do for you?" she smiled to me. "Would you please sell me the biggest ice stick" I replied quickly and politely, wiping my wet face. Then the old lady kindly asked me whether I took money or not. I said confidentially, "Yes, I have many money. You see." I reached into my pocket and hurried out a big coin which was marked "5 cent." At that time I didn't know even the cheapest ice stick cost 10 cent. I merely found out that the price in the counter was marked 0.1yuan. It seems that 5 was much more than 1 yuan. I caustiously [fm1,-] put the coin on the counter which was nearly as high as me. "Oh " the granny whispered, staring at the coin. It made no sense to me and I was dying of thirst I anxiously looked at the granny. She first took a glimpse at me and smiled. She hurried out a big wooden box covered with 2 towels. I looked at the crystal-like precious ice stick handed to me. "The biggest one for you. Eat as quick [wd2, 1-] as you can. It milt easily." She softly told me. I reached out hands and accepted it eagerly. " Thank you " I wanted to go. "Wait, wait, child. Here's your change." The granny called me back. My "Change'----1 cent. I happily took the shinning coin and with are more thanks to her, [sn8,s]I came home, enjoying the ice. I caught sine [wd7, 1-] words behind. " only for a little lovely and thirsty girl.."

Your sincerely Classes I Have Attended Class makes you smile or class lets you sleep are two types of classes I have attended. The first kind of class always has a teacher of midium [fm1,-]age or just a bit older. He or she must has rich teaching experience and more important, willing to understand what the students are thinking about. The teacher never says bad words to the students. On the other hand, he or she seldom praise a student. He or she just tells the students what they will face to and helps them to resolute [wd3, 1-] all kinds of problem. The teach [wd2, 1-] need not interrupt the class by some cheap jokes, however, he or she just show students a mysterial [fm1,-]world which is worth knowing. Then the student [np6, 1-] will naturally find it's interesting to follow the teacher. A class is passed while you think it is too short. The teachers give students second kind of class must be in their 40's or 50's or a bit younger. They do want to teach the students some useful knowledge and more or less they are kind teacher. They also have rich experience but to us [wd2, 1-] surprise this is often worse than lack of experience. This experience always lead to unchangable [fm1,-] dullness. I have attended some this kind of classes and all the teachers effort is to bump their knowledge into your head. They may be work. To hard that they bump too much things into my head and I feel it turns too heavy to raise. [sn8,s]So it falls down into dark emptyness [fm1,-] of dream. Thanks God that most classes I have attended are not those sleepy classes. And thanks God that I will have class to attend. During the years I stayed in the secondary school, I have been to two schools. One is the 26th Secondary School, my junior middle school, and the other one is The First Secondary School where I passed three years as a senior middle school student. My life in these two schools are quite different. The 26th and the First are all not too big, each has about 1,000 students. However, The First is more beautiful and more convenient than The 26th. In The First, there are three four flow buildings as students' class room, a six flore [fm1,-1] loboratry, a hall and a liberary [fm1,-]. But The 26th has no hall nor liberary [fm1,-], and its loboratry [fm1,-] is much smaller than The First's which consists of only 7 rooms. We can just do some simple exercises in The 26th. There is also a small park in The First, students can sit under the trees or by the flowers during the break while in The 26th it is difficult to find out a tree. The teaching method in the two schools are [vp3,5-] different, too. The 26th's teachers always give students some added lessons. It seems that they will teach, too things for the students to remember. They also give a lot of homework to the students. I have to burn my night oil quite often to finish it. On the contrary, teachers in The First would rather let the students learn knowledge by their own will. They never let the homework crush down the students. However, they allow students not to hand it in if the students think they know to do it correctly. The 26th only concentrate on the students' study. The teacher there don't [vp3,3-] encourage students to take part [vp2, s] sports. Sometimes they even forbit [fm1,-] students playing basketball ---the only thing we can do after school --- for the fear of that we may spent too less time on study. But when I in The First, teachers always remind us to go out the classroom and do some physical exercises. There are various tournaments been held each semester. Before the beginning of a CECL course, students must prepair [fm1,-] their tape recorder well. They should make it can work when need.[sn8,s] Then students should get out their CECL books and waiting for their teacher. The teacher is the director of a CECL course , students should follow their teacher's order and do what their teacher asks them to do. Usually the class begins with a passage in the textbook. Students read that passage and after finishing it answer the teacher's question. For example, there is maybe a short passage about basketball full of information about how to play it or its development history. The questions may be "How to play basket [fm1, -1] bad" or " When does basketball take place?" Students should answer question [np6, 1-] according to their understanding of the text. Next thing students will meet may be a short conversation. Teacher plays the tape and students try to catch as many as possible words they heared [fm1,-1] , remerbering them and understanding them. Sometimes it is need for student [np6, 1-] to write down what the [fm1,-1] heared. [sn8,s] Sometimes they should fill in the blank [np6, 1-] in their textbook. Sometimes they just listen to the tap and then discuss its content with their classmates, trying to express their opion [fm1,-] in English. Then, there may be another passage asked for [wd5, 1-] students to read or another conversation to listen. The class is mainly containing with these two things. During the practice of using English, Time flies very fast and a class may end seeming quite soon. [sn8,s] A friend may not be a handsome boy or beautiful girl who you admire so much that you want to be noticed by him or by her. A friend may not be the person who walks beside you to your home, telling you that Tom's bick [fm1,-] has lost and Marry smiled to Jack this morning and there is no homework tonight. A friend may not be the fellow sitting in frond of giving you a cigarette, saying "bottoms up" with you and laughing stupidly. A friend may be a red cloud hanging under the sinking sun along the western mountains. A friend may be the letter flying down on your desk, making you smile when you feel too boring to live any longer. A friend is the people who you want to see and cry to him when your girl friend or boy friend says bye-bye to you. When you walk along the quiet road in the night just by yourself, a friend is the face appears in your mind and smiles to you. In your diary, a friend is that " You" you talk to with your pen. Some day, a friend turns to be the reason to asure [fm1,-] you that this world has something worth remembering. Another day, a friend is the words safe or sincere or fathe [wd7, 1-] or believe. And, a friend is the person you smile to before and will smile to whenever you saw [vp6, s-] him or her. And a friend is the warm smile in your heart forever and ever. A sharp ring broke my heavy dream. I picked up the phone and said " Hello, who is that?" "Hi, guy. Do you know what's wrong with you." "Yes," I said. "I should not follow Qing to that dark room and drink three bottles of wine. But Qing is the prime culprit. You'd better arrest him." Qing said a four letter word at the other end and laughed a bit. Then he said," Will you come tonight ? We find something extremely fan." "I don't know," I answered." Let me have a look ."It was already 4pm. Sun shine went through the curtain into my room and my bed. But I could not find my calendar. I remembered I had being put it on the table but there were only some clothes. [sn8,s]"What date is today?" I asked Qing on phone. "A good day," He answered." Come on. You never care about date. You gave [wd3, 1-] a lot of time. Come and," he stopped a little bit then continued in a lower vioce [fm1,-] full of attraction, " here must have some friends you want to see." He was right . I told him that I really wanted to go but in somewhere deep in my mind a vioce [fm1,-] kept telling me that I would do an important thing that day. "What is it." I didn't know. I looked around hoping see something which can remind me. Several empty bottles at the corner, clothes on the table and floor, a book named Waste City near the door, and dazzling sunlight, those are all. I couldn't remember what I would do." Are you sure?" "I think so." "OK. You have forgotten it, haven't you ?" Then forget it forever. Come on, we are waiting for you." I heard the happy laugh and shout they made through the phone and hesitaded [fm1,-]a little while and said " Well, I think I will be in yours soon." "Fine!" he shouted and some body followed him shouting, "See you." I put down the phone, bend sown [fm1,-] to pick up my trousers. When I was dressing myself, I turned to the big minor in the wardrobe and suddenly saw a red paper cutting character on it. It was the Double Happiness. Then I found this character on my door and even the sideboard of my bed. I remembered that I would marry a girl, my wife, tonight. 

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GDUFS>, <AGE ?>, <WAY ?>, <DIC ?>, <TYP 2>"??It is a high class club at the top of the hill. On the platform, there are several square tables which are covered with white table-clothes with exquisite lace. Every table has an delicate crystal vase with freshred [fm1,-] rose in the middle. In the glow of the setting sun, at a quiet corner a young lady and a gentleman are having dinner face to face beside a table from which they can overlook the whole city. They are talking in low voice smiling, and enjoying the gentle breeze and the beautiful scenery. Before the lady, on the right side of the table is a bundle of fresh lily. Beside the flower is a silver plate of beefsteak with silver knife and silver folk on the right and left on it. Left above the plate is a half glass of juice. The things before the gentleman are hardly the same except a cup of coffee instead of the juice. Between them is a basket of fruit with a bottle of sealed champane [fm1,-] in it. Suddenly, the gentleman picks out a ring from his pocket, asking the lady with a charming smile:" Will you marry me?" Go in the room, the first impression is the opposite wall. [sn8,s]The upper part of the wooden wall is covered disorderly by pieces of paper pictures and posters. In the middle, there is a poster : a man and a woman, both in suits of Bachelor clothes holding their certificates, are standing arm in arm on the top of the globe, with line of words on the bottom. On the right side, an advertisement, which was clipped to the shape of the pattern, covers part of the post---- A big bottle of Coca Cola is standing on the left of a Santa Clause who is smiling enjoyfully with also a bottle of Coca Cola in hand. A cut-out paper-board is stuck additionally on the lower part of the two pictures. The wall below is of two completely different sights. The left part is dirty, made up of pieces of board, and showing its original wood color, while the right part is clean, bright with white wall-paper on it. A long stick broom is placed up side down against the wall in the left corner. On the wooden floor, in the middle of the room, there is a shabby, worn-out carpet whose color is fading. A rocking arm-chair made of rattan stand between the carpet and the wall. The back of the chair, which is leaning against the white wall, is high and exquisitely designed. And it seems to be the most comfortable thing in the room. It's a typical western little town of America. Two stories low buildings stand along both sides of the street. Some horses are walking around in distance. On the broad street, a tall and well-built policeman (a badge of cop pinning on his left chest) is walking ahead. He is also dressing in an entirely western-American style, not very fashionable, but smart. There is a black hat on his head. On his string body, there are a while shirt with a bow-tie on the collar and a waistcoat. A badge of cop is on left chest while the watch chain is hanging on the right of the waist. He is wearing a pair of leather shoes and two leather belts at waist. On the lower belt, there is a gun-package. He is not young any more and about 45 yeas old and sent forth the charming of a mature man all over. Age has left some signs on his face. No countenance appears on his experienced, hard face. He is staring firmly ahead, lips close tightly, fist cleach [fm1,-]. His stops are so calm that it seems her [fm1,-] can deal with any kind of chellange [fm1,-] of the criminals without fear. There are a man and two girls in front of the door beside the street. They seem to be father and daughters. The man, wearing a pair of glasses, is about 30 years old. Although he is tall and thin, his face is covered with sad cloud at the moment. The little girl, which is about 2 years old and seems to be the younger sister, is riding on her father's shoulders. Nothing cheerful can be seen on her little tight face. Instead, she seems to be able to break into tears at any moment. The elder one, only 4 years old at most, presses her body close to the door with hands clenching on it. The strong wind from anywhere has tangled their hair. The solid double iron door has separated them from the inside world. They are so weak in the wind and have not any aggressiveness. But despite the coldness, they are still standing there so firmly. Nothing can disturb them. Nothing can prevent them. The three pairs of eager eyes are concentrated and they ate trying their best to see through the unfeeling door to find the person they want behind it, although nothing might be seen. They are so silent, so quiet. But we can really hear the cry from deep in their heart: "Give me back my wife!" "Give us back our mother." "Give us a complete family!" At 6pm, I turn on the radio on time. Listening to the news on VOA, I am used to take a pen in one hand to write down some unknown words according to it [pr4, 1-] pronunciation and consult the dictionary afterwards. In the other hand, there is always an apple or an orange. After listening for half an hour, I go to take a bath---- with cold water. I have kept the habit for more than 4 years, although in winter great courage is really needed. Besides it can make people healthy, it become more necessary now ---- we moved from the ground to the second floor the term, a far way from the place where hot water is supplied. After that, of course it is time to wash clothes .It is a dull and monotonous process. To make it more interesting. [sn2,s] I always take a walk-man with me and even sing loudly. This period is also regarded a relaxation preparatory to the study. [sn8,s]From7:30 , it is 2 hours' fixed time to study. At about 9:30, I am called out , either to practice oral English or to take my tuitor [fm1,-] job. There [fm1,-]two things are quite different. Having free talk in English with a wise person can both improve my speaking English and enrich my knowledge. And I quite enjoy walking around the campus at night. While to teach a not so clever guy is an unpleasant and dull job. But I have to keep it. I need some extra money to complement my expense. Being back to the domitory [fm1,-], I spend a few minuts [fm1,-] having chat, reading magazines on [fm1,-] eating something if I am hungry. At the exact time of 11pm, lights go off turn on the Walkman, go into the dreams accompanying with music.. [sn8,s]Before midnight, the train entered Hunan province and stopped at a small station. A group of people which were dressed like peasants dashed into the carriage. The man walking in the front was about 40 years old. He was wearing a straw hat, a dirty shirt with several holes on it, a green army trousers and a pair of Liberation Brand cloth shoes .His back was bent by the full cloth bag on his shoulder. Sweat could be seen on his bronze-color face.He walked [wd3, -1]cross the carriage quickly and gave a careful check of the place under each seat. As he found each place had been occupied, he was quite disappointed and turned back. Finding a most convenient place, he unloaded the bag and untied it . He had got a big palm with thick callus and short big fingers. The blood ressels [fm1,-1] pretruded [fm1,-]dearly [fm1,-] on the back of the hand. At last, he took out a little square strool [fm1,-] and sat on it, satisfied , watching other people squeezing here and there to settle down. The stuffed carriage was so hot, he had to [wd7, -1]sweep away . The sweat on his forehead with towel now and then. [sn8,s] Looking around the people sitting side by side to he [pr4, 1-] and hesitating for a while, he took off his shire [fm1,-] which was all wet with sweat. A terrible mixture smell of tobacco and sweat [fm1, -1] game out .He gave a apologize smile to the people , showing his yellowish teeth. As the crowd calmed down, the train moved, he hold his bag tightly in arms and fell asleep. At exact 9am ----the regular time to start work in the morning, I stepped into the office . As usual, I was the first arrival. It was a big state-owned institution. Because of the good working condition and payment , I made great effort and at last find a position as common office worker here, as one of the few university graduates. I sat on my desk which was arranged in conner [fm1,-] and took out an English book to read. Although there was nothing significant for me to do since I came, still I think if I wanted to do my work successfully [sn9, s]. I must enrich my knowledge. Fifteen minutes later, my colleague [np6, 1-] reached one by another. Men firstly enjoyed a cup of coffee or tea, reading newspaper. Some women took out their mirror and began to make up. Some were discussing the TV programmes showed the night before and the handsome actors excitedly. Some were just making joke with each other. The whole office was in a [wd3, -1] noise. I had to put down my book. "Boss is coming " somebody cried. The people calmed down at once and took out their work, pretending to be busy. The boss, a severe old man more than 50 years old, walked into his room, with no expression on his face. Later, he went out, gave his segretary [fm1,-]a pile of documents, ordered:" Type it! " And went back. Passing through several hands, the documents reached my desk. Though it was not my duty, I had no reason to complain---- I was a new come here. Office moved on in its usual orbit slowly. I spent the rest of the day in typing, sleeping , staring blankly and reading a lot of newspaper [np6, 1-] . But I was more tired in mind than having done a hard work. I comforted myself :"Tomorrow may be a better day !"Dear Sir, I have been considering for a long time before I write to you . But I have to say that the noise you make brings me a lot of unconvenience [fm1,-]in my daily life. I am also a music lover as you are. But I suggest weather [fm1,-] you can lower the sound of your recorder. Since I am a writer. I have to stay at home all day, contriving plots and writing them down to earn a living. A quiet condition is very important to me. And I think it is not good for your recorder to be operating all day long. Your children must be fond of sports very much. I often hear them running here and there and jumping on the floor just above my head . It makes me quite nervous, for I surpect [fm1,-1] wether [fm1,-] the floor is strong enough. Out-door activities will be better for them. I think the TV programmes in deep night must be quite interesting and I hear your laughter now and then . But most people would be tired at 12pm after a day's work. They need rest to refresh themselves to be ready for the next day's work. And a quiet environment is good for your children too. Whenever you want to quarrel with your wife , please firstly consider wether [fm1,-] it is the right time and your poor neighbor downstairs. I will be very glad if your attention can be drawn on these problems. And I look forward to the disppearance [fm1,-] of the noise. Yours sincerely,

It is celebrated on the fifteenth day in lunar August.	On the Mide [fm1,-]-Autumn festival [fm3, 1-], people eat mooncakes and many kinds of fruits. The mooncake is the [wd7, -1] significance of that day. The Mide [fm1,-]-Autumn Festival is one of the important day [np6, 4-] for families to reunite. On that day , the members of a family will be together to celebrate the festival. Of course, they will have a big meal. In the rural areas such as in my hometown [sn9, s]. People will eat chicken or other poultries' meat to celebrate the festival.	It is believed that the moon on the mide [fm1,-]-autumn's night is the brightest and [aj3, -1] roundest. So it is a custom that people admire the moon on that night. With some mooncakes, some fruits, cups of tea, [sn6, s]together with families or some friends , admiring the moon is really a happy thing. Admiring the moon, we usually think of the families and friends who are far away from us and we will hope [vp1, 1-] them god luck at the same time.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, 	"???o	We have some "double-day" festivals, [sn9, s] the most famous one is the Dragon Boat Festival, which is on the fifth of the fifth lunar month. People make or buy some kind of pyrimid [fm1,-]-shaped dumplings which stuffed with glutinous , bacon, peanuts, and yolks. This is called zongzi. There are two types of it [sn9, s] sweet and savoury [fm1,-]. It's up to you to choose your own taste.	The dragon [fm3, 1-1] boat Festival is a traditional holiday for commemorating the great proitic [fm1,-] poet Qu Yuan who lived in ancient times. It's said that Qu Yuan suicided [vp2,-] in the river on the fifth of the fifth lunar month. So, [sn9, s] a special custom handed down from ancient times is still continuing in the area where Qu Yuan lived. On the day, people throw some zongzi into the river to feed the fish so that protect Qu Yuan's body. [sn8,s] This custom is not popular. In most places of China, people likely consider it as a good time to taste the delicious zongzi and watch the Dragon Boat races.

[sn8,s] According to the lunar calendar, Chinese celebrate it on 15th, Aug, when the bright moon is believed in its fullest form. It has been an old idea that a full moon in August means one's missing of his hometown. [sn8,s]So this festival is always connected [wd3, 1-] with motherland, birthplace and family. Like other festivals, Mid-Autumn Festival comes to be a happy occasion. Moon-cakes (which stand for the reunion of a family because of the round shape) and various kinds of fruits are served. People like to sit in the open [wd4, s], eating, sings [sn6, s and talking the beautiful tale of the beautiful day. That store [fm1,-]tells a graceful fairy named Chang E [fm1,-]once stole her husband, Hou Yi's medicine and flied to the moon and became a fairy. Anyway, she is not happy, for she has no company with her except a little rabbit. People say at [pp2,-2]the night, you can see [wd4,s-]lady walking in the bright moon. So admiring the moon becomes the most important progam [fm1,-]during the whole night. When mention the Mid-Autumn Festival, we can't skip over one famous Song [wd7,1-1]Poem written by Sushi, the great poet in Chinese culture history. His said wish you long-live and watch our moon, [sn8,s]even we're not together'. That's the significance of the romantic Chinese festival.

The Pure Brightness Festival	The Pure Brightness Festival (in Chinese [sn9, s]Qingming), is normally celebrated on April, 5th. On this occasion, people go to sweep their ancestors' greeves [fm1,-]. They would bring various food to forfathers [fm1,-], such as roast little pigs, fruits, rice, boiled chicken, wine and so forth. And they also clean the weeds around the greeves [fm1,-], burn insences [fm1,-] before the "face" [wd7, 1-] of their ancestors. After giving respects to them, the whole group share the food, this is a wonderful moment.	On the other hand, the Pure Brightness Festival marks the beginning of ploughing [wd7, 1-] in the countryside. So it has double significances [np5, 1-] to Chinese people. It is payed [fm1,-] much attention to every year.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, 	??*1/4		Double Fifth Festival   In the table of the Chinese festivals, there is a very imporant [fm1,-]festival--the Double Fifth Festival. It is a festival to remember the tragic death of the famous Chinese poet--Quyuan. It is said that Quyuan, who loved his country very much, had make [fm1,-] many plans of reform to strengthen his motherland., but was ignored by the governors. In despair, he jumped into a river and many people tried to rescue him with boats but was in vain. In ord [fm1,-] to remember this famous poet, people decided to hold some celebrations that day from then on. The main activities are eating Zozing [fm2, 1-]( a kind of food made of sticky rice with some meat in the middle ) and boat racing, which means to give some food to the poet and to rescue him. Thus the customer [wd3, 1-] came into being.   Double Fifth Festival is celebrated on 5th, May. On that day, all the people in my hometown will wrap Zozing [fm2, 1-] and eat them for dinner instead of rice. And on the day the rivers in my hometown is exceptionally full. So most of the men will go [fm2, -1] boatracing. Usually there is a match early in the morning, [sn9, s] they'll all be ready in a boat in the same clothes for one team. When the race begins, all the people in boat or on riverside will cry at the top of their voices, " One, two, three!" The scene is very exciting. Then in the end, the team which wins will be given a reward.   As time goes on, this custom is still continuing. [sn8,s] But all the things they do now are just to make fun rather than to rescue Quyuan.

While admiring the moon, people like to eat a tradictional [fm1,-] Chinese food--mooncake. Usually mooncake is round-shaped. In this traditional festival, people observe the Moon Goddess and appreciate the lovely scence [fm1,-] of "beautiful flowers and rounded [wd7, 1-] moon." On the night of the festival, all members of the family sit together to appreciate the moon, eating mooncakes and drinking cups of tea. The people [wd3, 1-], who are away form [fm1,-] their families, would miss their families much more than usual. They hope the family can be around as well as the moon.   In the Mid-Autumn Festival, some parts of Chinese would like to play firecrakers [fm1,-] to enjoy themselves. For example, Duan Wu Festival, also call [ vp4, s-] dragonboat [fm3, 1-] Festival or double [fm3, 1-1] fifth Day, is originally a day to commemerate [fm1,-] Quyuan, a patriot.   Lagend [fm1,-] says that 2 century [np3, 1-] before Christmas Mr Qu drawned [fm1,-] himself in Milup [fm2, 1-] river when his reform [wd7, 1-1]constitution was ignored by the empor [fm1,-]. People love [vp6,s-] him and tried to find his body but in vain. Then they [vp6, -1] throw Zongzi (rice wrapped in bamboo leaves) into the river so that the fish not to eat Quyuan. [sn8,s] As time went by, it became a custom.   Now on [wd4, s] 5th of the 5th month of luner [fm1,-] calendar, we eat Zongzi and have dragon boat competition. Gongs and drumps [fm1,-] are used in the competition and people gather around on the banks to cheer for their own team. To thank for [wd5, 1-] the god, they burn the branches and run around their down [wd7, 1-1]lifting them. they [fm3, 1-] sing and dance together. Because the fire brought the good luck to them, they want to the fire will bring the good luck to them every year. [sn8,s]So they celebrate this holiday every year.   They also pile some branches and burn them. All people sing and dance together around the fire. They're so happy.

Latern [fm1,-] Festival	Following the Spring Festival, the Chinese New Year, there comes the second largest festival in China which is called Latern [fm1,-] Festival.	It's on the 15th of the first month in Chinese calendar. It is said that this festival appeared in the early Hang Digest [wd3, 1-] in the history and people celebrate it manly [wd7, 1-] for the latern [fm1,-].	Because it's near the Chinese New Year, people also dressed [vp6,s-] in new clothes, and in high spirits. And there are many things for people to play, to see, or to hear [sn9, s]etc.	Firecracker and latern [fm1,-] are the symbol [wd3,s-] of the festival. In that day, everybody hold [vp3, 1-] a latern [fm1,-] to play , and at last hang [vp3, 1-] it outside the door. That means, more laterns [fm1,-] can bring you better luck in the year.	The most [wd5, 1-]largest celebration is the performance. When the performance begin [vp3, 1-], everybody would [vp6,s-] go out to see it, especially, [sn9, s] the performance of dancing like the lion. 3 or 4 people dressed like some lions, and with the voice of the drum, [sn8,s]the lions jump, or shake heads, or roll up [sn9, s]etc. And what's more, some people dressed [vp6,s-] up as gods or spirits [sn9, s]etc, to join in the performance. 	And in that day, you can also play the game, such as guessing the question on the latern [fm1,-] etc. If you can guess it out, you can [vp9, s-] receive a present.	And A dumpling is the symbol of that festival, too. Family eat them together to celebrate the reunitation [fm2, 1-].

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>,???to			Dragon Boat Festival   Dragon Boat Festival is a Chinese traditional festival, which is observed in [wd3, 1-] the fifth of the fifth lunar month. So it is also called "The Double Fifth Holiday". This festival is well believed that is in honor of a great patriotic man in history Chuyan [fm1,-]. [sn8,s]He dropped himself in the river and someone rowed a boat to find him but in vain. So people make Zonzi [fm1,-] throwing into river for him. [sn8, s]Now, in [wd3, 1-] this festival, people always eat Zonzi [fm1,-], that is glutinous rice dumplings, and have boat races. In my hometown, we usually make Zonzi ourselves. It is shaped like a cone or some others [wd3, 1-] as you like. All of them are made together in bunches. And in the park where there is a lake, we used [vp6,s-] to have a boat race which is just a minor race for fun. Or in the river there used [vp6,s-] to be boat races. The latter is more exciting. But nowadays, no one will manage to hold a boat race. Someone [pr1, 1-] just stay at home eating Zonzi [fm1,-] or go to work as usual. Because it is not an really [wd2, 1-] holiday, schools and factories or other departments [wd3, 1-] don't close for this festival. With times go on, [sn8,s]the Dragon Boat Festival becomes more and more a convention of eating Zonzi [fm1,-] and boating than commemerating [fm1,-1] Chuyan. It's regarded as a more common day except that the children are happy to get lots of food to eat.

The Dragon Boat Festival comes in the 5th day of the 5th lunar month. People in china celebrate this festival in commemoration of Quyuan, a great patriotic peot [fm1,-]who drowned himself in the river Miluo long long ago. There is a custom of eating and exchanging glutinous rice dumplings on that day. In some placed [fm1,-], people used [vp6,s-] to throw dumplings into rivers. [sn8,s]	Another special custom is racing dragon boat, which usually takes place in South China, especially in where I live--Guangdong Province. It is said that people race dragon boats to save Qu Yuan. However, I think nowadays, it is more a public entertainment for fun than its traditional mission of saving the great poet.	The traditional significance of the Dragon Boat Festival has gradually been lost in modern times. People simply have it as a good chance to enjoy themselves without honoring Qu Yuan.

But in fact, we didn't use a mop to sweep the grave dust [sn9, s] put down the food in front of the comb [wd3,s-] burried [wd3, 1-]incense, let off firecrackers. Pure Brightness' celebration often occurs in pleasant weather with bright sunshine, glassy blue sky and fregrant [fm1,-] breeze blowing over the face . So it is extremely good for people to have a country walk or many other outdoors activities.	In the past, a lot of big families, often combined with three generations [sn8, s], wearing their best clothes, went to some country field for grave-sweeping. After that, they sat down on the grass to have their lunch in the open air. The food often consisted of wheat-buns, bacon, fruits and local wine. The Mid-autumn [fm3, 1-] Festival	The fifteenth day of the eighth lunar month is mid-autumn [fm3, 1-1] festival, a traditional Chinese festival.	It's said that on that night, the moon is the most roundest [aj3, 1-] and shinest [wd3, 1-] throughout the year. So our ancestor set aside [wd3, 1-] this day to admire the moon. And because the moon on that night is so round, it also indicate that the whole family can reunion. So, usually, it becomes a custom that all the members in a family should gather together that night no matter how busy they are or wherever they are.	On that night, we eats many fruits and delicious food. The most indepensable [fm1,-] food is moon-cake (a round sweet cake with elyolks [fm1,-] or something else inside). Actually, it isn't something very delicious to some people, but if there isn't any moon-cake in [pp1, 1-] that day, it just turns out that we aren't spending the mid-autumn [fm3, 1-1] festival any more. [sn1,s]So you see how important it is !	Of course, admiring the moon [cc3,-2]is another thing we must do. Sitting by the window, eating some fruits we like, we look into the dark sky and the shining moon and occasionally say a few words to each other, [sn9, s] what [fm3, 1-] a peaceful picture and wonderful night! [sn8,s]

It's set aside [wd3, 1-] to honour a great poet in Chinese history, Qu Yuang, who drowned into a river on the fifth day of the fifth lunar month for being ignored by the empiror. [fm1,-] So it was a sad festival at that time, [sn9, s]but nowadays, it's a more happy festival than a sad one. And Zongzi is often used to [vp1, 1-1] send to relatives and friends.	Boating [fm2, 1-] is another way to celebrate. It's held only in the areas where have rivers. Anyway, it's an exciting and interesting game, of which the victory can only won by the co-operation of the boating members.	Many festivals in China have been commercialized but Dragon Boat Festival is not the case. You can still feel the love from your relatives and friends and needn't spend much money.	So Dragon [fm3, 1-] boat Festival is a meaningful festival.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, ???1/4		Dragon Boat Festival	Dragon Boat Festival is observed on the fifth of the fifth lunar month. It is a large festival.	This festival was founded [wd3, 1-] to give the honor to a poet named Quyan [fm1,-] in the ancient time. He was a country lover. On the fifth of the fifth lunar month in some year he threw into [wd7, 1-] a river.	Nowadays, people still remember the poet. They make Jongzi [fm1,-] on the Dragon Boat Festival. In some local places, people will even throw the Jongzi [fm1,-]into the river. That means, the fish and prawns can have something to eat, so they won't eat Quyan's body.	The most exciting thing on this day is the boat race. When the festival comes, the orginizer [fm1,-] will call on some strong young men and divide them into 4 to 5 group, and then have a dragon [wd4, 1-1] race on [pp1, 1-1] the river. Many people go to the river side and watch the race. The [fm1,-] will applause or let out a cry or do something else to show their happiness. [sn8,s]That makes the activity funnier [aj3, 1-] and more exciting.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, ??1/2?	Lantern Festival is a traditional festival in China. It is celebrated on the fifteenth day of the first lunar month. There are a lot of "Lantern gatherings" all over the country that day, and people do different kinds of things to welcome the coming new year and to say goodbye to the last year.	In my hometown, celebrating Lantern festival is very interesting and exciting, especially for [pp1, 1-1] children. Early in the morning, children get up, wearing their new spring clothes. They look forward to the coming of the evening and prepare for the "movement", [sn8,s]making appointment with each other and examing [fm1,-] their own lanterns. Their parents are busy preparing a wonderful meal for the day.	When the evening comes, the whole family will set [fm1,-] togather[fm1,-] to have a good dinner. There are many dishes, including Yuang [fm1,-] Xiao, a kind of Chinese dumping, which is a symbol of reunion. After that, people to out to have a good look at the lantern gathering [sn8,s]. Children carry their own lantern and march down the town togather [fm1,-], singing and playing. It's like a kind of parade. 	At the end of it, people will burn [wd3, 1-1] the lanterns. [sn8,s]They think doing this can get rid of bad luck of the last year, and have good luck in the new year.

Mid- autumn [fm3, 1-] Festival	Mid-autumn [fm3, 1-1] festival falls on the night of the 15th of the 8th lunar month [sn9, s], [fm3, -1] it's very popular in China. It's not certain when it started, but it's handed down from generation to generation for reunion of family. [sn8,s]	On that night, the moon is in the brightest and fullest form [sn9, s], [fm3, -1] the family all sit together outside their [pr3, 1-] house to admire the full moon if available. In the meantime, people eat fruits and moon cake [np6, 1-], a kind of round cake made of egg yolk, peanut, etc [fm1,-] as filling. [fm3, 1-] the round shape symbolized [vp6,s-] reunion. Hanging up paper lanterns is another character, the lantern is also round that is also the symbol of reunion. [sn8,s]	In some areas, little boys and girls go out with lanterns with candles in for fun after having moon cake. [np6, 2-] [sn8,s]

Usually we will move the desk and table out of [np6, -1] house to the balcony where we can admire the beauty of [np6, -1] full moon. on [fm3, 1-] the table there are tea, moon-cake [np6, 1-] and the [wd5, s-] other food. We chat and chat and the joyfull [fm1,-] laughter will fill the house.	With the economic development, the way we express our happiness has changed. Mid- autumn [fm3, 1-] Festival	Mid-autumn [fm3, 1-] Festival is celebrated on [wd4, 1-3] 15th of the eighth lunar month. It's a Chinese traditional festival which no one can tell when it was first celebrated. This festival symbolized [vp6,s-] the reunite of the family members. On that day, people gather together to celebrate this great event [wd7, 1-].	On that day, people eat moon-cake [np6, 3-] which is a significant [wd7, 1-]of this festival. In our home town, there's a fire-crackers setting each year. It is provided by the government. At [pp1, 1-] that night, people all climb to the highest building or some buildings nearby [wd2, 1-] the setting place [wd6, 1-] to see this fire-crackers setting [wd6, 1-]. 	Though this festival is a symbol of reunite, nowadays, not all the people can enjoy it. Because some of them are far away from home, and they don't think it necessary to go home. They just telephone their family to say some good wishes for the family [wd6, 1-]. More and more people, especially the youth, are enjoying this way of celebration.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, ??3/43/4	Mid-Autumn Festival is a traditional Chinese Festival. It falls on the 15th day of the 8th lunar month. In ancient times, people celebrated [wd4, 1-] in honor of the season of harvest. But nowadays, we concider [fm1,-] it as a day for us to re-unite.	The dinner of that day will be as good as the dinner in Spring Festival, because all the relatives will almost [ad1, 1-]be together. After dinner, it is dark and the moon has already come up. We'll place tables and chairs on the veranda or a platform, so that we can admire the moon which is concidered [fm1,-] to be the fullest and brightest during the year. On the table, we often place some fruits, peanuts, chestnuts and moon cakes. Moon cake is a kind of sweet cake with a round shape. [fm3, -1] it is symbolic [wd2, 1-] of reunion. On the other hand, lanterns are as a symbol as mooncakes. [sn8,s] [fm3, -1]children used to hang up a paper lantern outside the door or even carry it going around and playing. Nowadays, they use the electrified [wd3, 1-] lantern which can't be blown off by wind or something [wd4, 1-].	Since people are all happy to see their faraway relatives and friends who haven't seen for a long time, [sn7,s]adults often chat and eat and laugh all night, while children are also too exciting to sleep at the normal sleeping time. So it is a happy festival and also an important festival [wd6, 1-]for both adults and children.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, "??To			Splashing Day	There are many festivals in China except the important ones, such as Spring Festival, [wd7, -1] New York, National Day. Traditional festivals are also celebrated by people. Splashing Day is just one of this [wd3, 1-].	Splashing Day is usually observed by Dai minority, which begins on April 14th and lasts 3 days. In those days, girls put on their long colorful skirt [np6, s-] and make up well and fellows are in their new clothes too. Certainly every body dresses himself sell [fm1,-]. Then, they come to the street with a basin or bottle in [wd4, 1-1] hand. Som [fm1,-]dip a seris [fm1,-] of leaves into water and splash it to others. Sometimes, they are so happy that they just pour the whole basin of water on you and make you all in wet. But you won't feel embarrased [fm1,-]. For the more water you receive, the more respect you get.	After a happy period of time, people get together and enjoy their special meal--gluttnous [fm1,-]rice cooked in bamboo is the main dish. It smells good and taste sticky.	It's really an interesting festival. You can not only enjoy yourself, but also taste the traditional local food. And maybe, you can find a longlife friend by splashing water. [sn8,s]

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, oD???		The Gragon [fm1,-]-boat [fm3, 1-] Festival	I'd like to tell you something about our traditional Chinese festival--the Gragon [fm1,-]-boat [fm3, 1-] Festival. Because it's very interesting, [sn9, 1-] people do a lot of things to observe it.	This festival was set [wd3, 1-1] aside to commemorate a great poemit [fm1,-] Qu Yuan. He died on lunar April, 5th, so we celebrate on this day. It originated in the south of China. After Qu Yuan jumped into the Mi Luo river, the local people were afraid that the creature in the river would eat him, so they made a kind of dumpling to throw into the river and said, "Please don't eat Qu Yuan, eat the food we made." This kind of dumpling is the Zongzi we call now. It's very famous and delicious. It is pyramid-shaped dumpling made of gutinurs [fm1,-]. But in fact, there are all kinds of different [wd5,4-] Zonzi [fm1,-]all over the country. When the festival comes, people will make Zonzi [fm1,-]in their family [wd3, 1-].	The other thing we'll do during the festival is the dragon boat race. People from different place [np6, 2-1] of the country will come to Guangzhou and race [wd4, 1-]in the Zhujiang River. This game is now popular not only in China, but also in the world. Nowadays, some forieners [fm1,-] come to join our dragon-boat team or [wd7, 1-1]race.	I live in Guangzhou, and my hometown is Shun De whose team is the best dragon-boat team in China. So, every year I will go to the bank of Zhu jiang River to watch it.
