<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP 2>, ??		The Lantern Festival	The Lantern Festival, which is also known as Yuan Xiao Jie, is an important traditional Chinese festival. It is said that the ancient Chinese observed the festival to pray for good harvest in the coming year. Nowadays, it becomes a holiday for family reunion and people just enjoy themselves on the day. Most similar with people in other parts of China, people in Zhejiang province observe this festival in an exciting way.	Lion dances and lanterns are the most important symbols of the festival, when the dark of Jan. 15th of Chinese lunar calender [fm1,-] comes, every house lights their lanterns and highly [wd2, 1-] hangs them in the front of the door. Then people in groups go to see the lion dances, which played by the young man. The lions are made of colourful silks and they're supposed to catch a big red ball lifted by a tall young man.	People also eat Tang yuan on this festival. Tang yuan is a kind of dumpling made of gloutinous [fm1,-]rice with sweet fillings. As you can guess, Tang yuan sombolizes [fm1,-] good luck for the whole family. Another program of the festival is gussing [fm1,-] rieddors [fm1,-] sticking on the lanterns. If you can get the right answer, you are supposed to be the intellegent and lucky one.	Firecrackers' sound can be heard throughout the night. They seem to imply the bright future of the prosperous area and the endless happiness among those people.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP ?>, D ?												Class 5																    English Department Guangdong University of Foreign Studies Guangzhou, China Dear Lily,	Learning your brother's present situation, I'd like to give you some idea of Chinese school leavers' situation in nowadays.	In the past, all the school and college leavers in China were automatically allocated jobs by the goverment [fm1,-]. But it is not exactly the case now. Most of us, except those who major in education, are supposed to find jobs by ourselves. The schools are only responsible for recommending you to some work units and it is up to the work units to decide whether we are employed or not. We ourselves [sn9, s]unlike in those days when students were bound to follow the schools' distribution order [wd5, 1-] to the appoited [sn9, s] work unit, are also free to choose the job as we like. A work relation can be established only when both sides, the employer and the employee [sn9, s] are satisfied with each other. The compitition [fm1,-] is very sharp in China. It is also not easy to find a job in the job market. However, as college students, we are assured that if we study hard and really grasp the useful skills , finding a job is no problem.Don't be so worried about your brother's job. Let's hope for the best.                           Yours faithful,                               Leslie

Usually young people don't have problem in finding a job when they leaves [vp3, 1-] school or college as long as they get the certification. Thus it's not so difficult to find a job especially in GuangDong, where all kinds of joint-ventures, companies and firms exist. For such people, there is undoubtable [fm2, 1-] to be some struggle ahead. As to the choice of jobs, it falls in to 2 catalogues [wd3, 1-]. For the so-called "heated-field" majors, such as trade, interpretation, computer, etc, there is a great range of jobs for them; while for the "cold-field" majors, such as biology, chemistry, the manpower is either in short supply or can't find a good job, which is rather strange. <ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP ?>, o?D??                        July, 9, 1997 Dear Mary,	I am very sorry to know that your brother have difficulty to [sn8,s]find a job. But don't worry about [sn8,s] too much. Things will be all right soon.	As far as I know, young people in China also have problems finding work. It is not true that the school and college leavers are all automatically allocated jobs by the government. That was an old practice. Nowadays, most of the college leavers also have to find the jobs by themselves and the college will help [wd5, 1-1]to give some suggestions. All these changes are due to the paying tuition system. So the college leaver has his own choice about the job. But in some normal school [np3, 1-3] and agricultural school, they still have to accept the job assigned by the government. Since the development of the society, it needs more high skill [sn8,s]personnel and management. So people do not have high education have great trouble to find the job, especially in the well-developed place [np6, s-]. On the other hand, even if you have received high education, the company will take the experiences into great consideration. The college leavers without pratical [fm1,-] skill or experiences will also be rejected by the job market. Another markable [fm2, 1-] problem is that the college leavers gather to the well-develop [wd4, s] to find jobs and are unwilling to go to some poorer places. That makes unbalance for the job market. I think, on the whole, the situation of employment for young people in China is not much better that than [wd1, s]of Britain. 	I hope your brother can find a good job soon and both of you can enjoy the Christmas. I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.																	Yours,                               Helen

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP ?>, ???t															July, 9, 1997Dear Mary,	Glad to hear from you. I would like to answer the questions concerning jobs in your letter first.	Generally speaking, compared to Britain, the employment situation in China is much better. According to recent data in China Daily, the unemployment rate among young people is only about 3% in China. Most of the young people have many job opportunities available. 	Well, in the past, all college graduates were allocated jobs automatically by the government in China. However, things have changed a lot now. When college students graduate, usually their colleges will offer some job opportunities to them and recommend some excellent graduates to a certain profitable companies as well. But the choice lies in the graduates themselves. They have free will to choose whatever companies to enter. Besides the offering by their colleges, the graduates can also go to the job markets on talent services in the society. There are lots and [wd5, 1-1]lots of such services in many cities in China, especially along coastal cities. All graduates have various choices there. 	Of course, for some people it seems the future is not as promising as before. Therefore, most young people regard it more challenging and interesting to find jobs themselves through competition. 	Well, above is some of my understanding of the employment situation in China. Hope it has answered your questions. 	With best wishes. 																																			Yours sincerely,                               Joanna Zhou

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP ?>, 1/2"?"a																July, 9,1997Dear Ann,	Generally speaking, to find a job after graduation in China seems comparatively easy than in Britain owning [fm1,-] to the distribution system. Based on this distribution system, it is true that Chinese school and college leavers are all automatically allocated jobs by the government. Although this system can solve the problem of serious unemployments [np5, 1-] , it brings about other problems at the same time. As you mentioned in your letter, under this uninflexisible [fm2, 1-] system, people have less [np8, 1-] choice about the jobs they do. Sometimes it is the reason for inefficiency on some positions because of people's lack of interest in their distributed jobs. In other words, people lose the spirit which can encourge [fm1,-] them to make great achievements on their [np6, -1] position.	In order to overcome the weakness of this system and solve the problem of low efficiency, some reforms are carrying out. For instance, nowadays most of the graduates can have more opportunities on the job market according to the "Double-Choice Principle". That is to say, graduates not only can find their favourite jobs freely on the job market by their own, but also can consider to accept the job which their school or government offer [vp3, 1-]. In this way, both needs are met.	As a result, the problems leave [sn8,s] to ourselves. As long as we qualify ourselves [sn8,s] compatitive [fm1,-] enough at university, we have less [np8, 1-] difficulties in finding a satisfatory [fm1,-] job.

Most of them are retrained so that they can be comprehensive [wd7, 1-] to another work. These reforms have brought about great changes in students' lives. They do not need to worry [vp1,1-] whether they will be allocated for [wd5, 1-] a [np7, 1-] unsatisfatory [fm1,-] job [wd4, s]not. On the other hand, they have to face the job market and be chosen by it. So they have to work hard and try their best to learn more skills. Otherwise, they will not be able to find a job.	The reforms have also changed the society. The companies and enterprises feel more [aj3, 1-1]free to choose their employees. More and more "job market" advertisements can be seen on newspapers. However, it's not easy to find a job at all, especially for the graduates. Experience, as you said, becomes very important. Unlike the leavers under the old system, the graduates under the new one can choose the jobs on their will without paying any fee to the college. For example, the graduated students may be reluctantant [fm1,-] to apply for the job he was allocated to, and the company's side [sn8,s] may also get the unnecessary labour. The individuals have the freedom to choose their bosses and the companies can find the suitable persons by themselves. Many job markets came into being. It is now quite common for the school leavers, or even university graduates to hunt for jobs for a long time. Some of them are not necessarily having difficulty in finding jobs; they are just waiting for better ones. But after all, this way of job hunting is much more competitive than the formar [fm1,-]one, so it is much more difficult for us to find a job, especially in some hot fields, like in the bank and foreign trade companies, the compition [fm1,-] is very serious. The manager of the companies can arrange a [np7, 1-] interview between them. Both of them have right to choose.	Now, Hongkong has reverted [wd3, 1-] to China. It will provide a job market for students who graduate later. It will ease the intense situation.															Yours sincerely,																	Molly

Nowadays, graduates are not likely allocated jobs by the government as they were in the past. Most of them prefer to hunt jobs through other channels. For example, they will probably manage to find jobs by applying for a post in companies or, in other cases, through recommendations of friends and relatives. As for those who want to gain experience before embarking on the society, they usually look for part-time jobs either on vocation or during school period thus [sn8,s]make things much easier. In general, nobody would get a job without any difficulty for [sn8,s]the heated competition among the college leavers. The one who is able to defeat his opponents should inevitably own advanced knowledge. Otherwise he will fail.

<ST 5>, <SEX ?>, <Y ?>, <SCH GIFL>, <AGE ?>, <WAY 1>, <DIC 2>, <TYP ?>, "? ?Dear Jane, 											7,9,1997	I'm glad to hear from you. 	As you have mentioned about the unemployment situation in China, I'm afraid I haven't any available statistics at hand for you, but, as far as I know, Chinese unemployment situation is as grim as [sn4, s] Britain.	In China, there are several elements [sn8,s] lead to unemployment . One of them is the economic recession. More and more factories and industries couldn't [vp6,s-] earn enough money for running . Consequently, they have no way to do but close down themselves. Another one is the technology development. because [fm3, 1-] of the invention and development of computers , more and more automatic work can be done by machines. In addition, computers are much more efficient than workforce. On [pp1, 1-] this condition, more and more people begin to lose their jobs and have to find a new one. Certification of the applicants is also an important element. The higher educational level you have, the easylier [fm1,-] you could [vp6,s-] find a comfortable job. On [pp1, 1-] that case, certification is more important than experience, [sn9, s] Maybe there is a slight different between China and Britain at the point. 	What I have mentioned above is the answers to your questions. I hope you would [sn8,s]satisfy with them. Look forward to hearing form you soon.													yours [fm3, 1-] failthly [fm1,-], Chesy

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 22><WAY 1><DIC ><TYP 1>
 Patriotism      Patriotism means the love of one's country.  It makes one ready to sacrifice his life for his country, and to do many other deeds which can bring benefits to his people.  It makes a country strong and her history glorious.  It also improves a man's character and secures for him widespread fame.     To love our country means the fulfilment of one's  [pr1,8-] duty and obligations.  To maintain the stability and unity of our country, one [pr1,9-]  should work hard so as to make her strong and rich, support her government, obey her laws, pay taxes -- this is to be a real Chinese patriot.     If the people of a country are not patriotic, the country must be very weak.  History tells us how some countries of ancient times were, owing to lack of patriotism, conquered by other peoples and how the people of the conquered countries were made slaves under the yoke of thier [fm1,-]  victorious masters.

<ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                               Means of Transporotation [fm1,-] in Guangzhou          Guangzhou is one of the most developed cities in China.  To a city as highly-developed and commercialised as Guangzhou, transportation is most important.  To most people's joy, transportation in Guangzhou is not bad.     Among the various means of transportation in Guangzhou, the most common one is the bicycle.  Bicycles play an important role in the life [np5,-3]  of the Cantonese.  It is estimated that millions of bicycles are in use in Guangzhou, forming a magnificent picture. A lot of people go to work by bicycle.  alternatively, some people make use of buses, which are also an important means of transportation. [sn7,7-]   Countless buses, like huge insects, crawl on the wide roads in Guangzhou, providing its citizens with great conveniences [np5,5-] .  It is more convenient to take a taxi, though, [sn9,-]  it is more costly.  There are numerous taxi companies in Guangzhou; they do their contribution [vp2,2-1]  to the city's transportation.  Recently, the underground has been built in Guangzhou, this undoubtedly enhance the citizens' conveniences greatly. [sn1,s]  There are also other means of transportation, such as motorcycles and tricycles. They, too, with other means of transportation, make Guangzhou a more attractive and admirable city.   Although there are various means of transportation in Guangzhou, this [pr1,9-]  is not enough.  Other modernised and advanced means of transportation should still be introduced to Guangzhou. Thus, Guangzhou can live up to its title -- a Modernised [fm3,-]  International [fm3,-]  City [fm3,-] .

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC ><TYP 1>                             Study Problems    Students are constantly encounting [fm1,-]  study problems.  today I am going to focus on one point -- how to adjust one's motion to study and learn efficiently.     As a student, I share the common attitude towards study with most fellows.  I find study boring on the whole.  Sometimes I am too lazy to touch the books; sometimes I am in depression [pr3, 4-3]  and just want to sit and do nothing; sometimes such attractive things as wonderful TV programs or going shopping are of greater lure to me.  However, if I let these personal factors bother me and take mastery of me [sn9,-]  I will absolutely learn nothing at all.  Therefore, it is necessary and vital to find a good solution.  I find that a person need [vp3,2-]  some relaxation periodically. When in depression, just stop to relax the mind completely by listening to the music, seeing a movie or having other entertainment.  After that, draw up a new plan and devote to [vp2,1-3]  a new task.  If bothered by things like wanting to go shopping instead of study, make sure to finish the work required as quickly as possible and properly as well, then grant yourself freedom as a [np7,-1]  incentive. [sn8,s] I always find it [pr1,-8]  effective when I am studying under an encouragement.  Otherwise, if I keep studying regardless of my emotions, it proves to be futile.        As to this same study problem, solutions varies [vp3,1-]  from person to person.  The most important thing is to adjust oneself to study effectivley [fm1,-] .

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 22><WAY 1><DIC ><TYP 1>                                                                              Study Problems       As an English major, I have found that we have to face a lot of  study problems.  These problems exit [wd3,2-]  in every aspects [np5,1-]  of studies, especially in listening and speaking.     We can not understand what speakers say while listening, mainly because we can not follow the speakers.  Since our vocabulary is limited, we have to guess the meaning [np5,-3]  of some words, and this takes time.  At the meanwhile [pp2,2-] , the speakers, usually native speakers, are [wd5,5-2]  generally speak at a normal speed, which seems a bit fast to non-native speakers.  Thus, we may neglect [wd3,2-6]  some main points in the lecture. Therefore, we will not catch the meaning of the speaker.  We can not follow the speakers also because we do not understand the ascents [fm1,-] , which cause [vp3,1-6]  the same word sounds [vp4,5-2]  almost different.  Speaking problems occur also because of our small vocabulary.  We often use words repeatedly, which makes our conversation dull and simple.  We can not express exactly  and clearly what we think, since we seldom practise and are too shy to speak.  After class, we hardly speak English in our daily life.  Being afraid of making mistakes and being laughed at are also the troubles.     If we can not solve the speaking and listening problems, we may have a hard time in further studies.  In my opoin [fm1,-] , speaking and listening should be put on the same level with writing and reading.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                                       Study Problems      Study problems is [vp3,2-]  a very big topic, including much [cc4,-]content. But here, I just only discuss [vp6,3-]it from two points: study what and how to study.    As students of university, what should we study?  Of course, we should study our textbooks at[wd4,-] above all.  In  order to make a living and build our country, we must have some skills and maste [fm1,-]  some major knowledge [cc3,3-] .  We learn all of these [pr1,7-]  from textbooks.  But that is not enough.  We should broaden our horizons in many different directions [wd3,-] , so we must read all kinds of books, such as the [np7,9-1]  novels, the [np7,10-2]  scientific books, newspapers, and so on. Thus we'll become a wit person [cc1,-1] , but not a bookswarm [fm1,-] .   Then, the second question: how to study.  To[wd3,-] the major knowledge, we can listen to the teacher in the class and study it in our spare-time [fm2,-] .  We have no problems about studying textbooks.  But how to learn the other knowledge [cc3,3-] ? In my pinion [fm1,-] , first, we should know what kind of knowledge we are interested in most, and then, we can  read the books about it or learn from the others who are good at it.  Or we feel what kind of knowledge we lack and then learn it more.[sn8,s]     In a word, studying is one's own business.  We should learn knowledge [cc3,1-]  as much as we can and as active [ad2,11-3]  as we can.  Knowledge is not limited, and we should study, study and study until we die.    

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                            Study Problems     Having been a student for about 14 years, I have encountered all kinds of problems in studying.  Among those problems, I think there are mainly three important problems [wd6,s-] .     First, how to master what we have learned. [sn8,s] The purpose of us students to come to the school is to abtain [fm1,-]  knowledge, so it's important to master the knowledge [cc3,2-] .  Even [cj1,-7]  we read through the text-book several times, listen to the teacher attentively, take all kinds of exams, sometimes we still learn nothing.  For example, I learned chemistry for 3 years and I passed all the exams in middle school, I can't remember a thing about it now.  While [wd3,-s]  I learned to count when I was three, I still can count.  I think the reason of the different results of my learning lie [vp3,9-]  in whether I master the skill. When I learned chemistry, I didn't master it, I just memorized it. [sn1,s]     Second, how to use what we have learned. [sn8,s]  Using [wd3,-5]  is more important than studying.  As a forieg [fm1,-]  language student, the most essential thing for me is to use my second  language to communicate with others.  There are many people can read difficult essays in English but can't write or speak themselves [wd5,3-2]  in English. [sn8,s]   If we can't use what we learn, studying is meaningless.  I think the only way to use our knowledge is to practice it in daily life.    Third, the least important one but necessary for a student, how to get high marks. [sn8,s] Though high marks do not stand for our ability, they do give us more chance [np6,1-]  when we having [vp4,2-2]  an interview and showing our certifications [wd3,2-] .     I think to get high marks, we need to digest the textbook thoroughly and do more relevant exercise [np6,3-] .       Though these three study problems are quite different, but [cj1,8-4]  they have some connection.  If we want to get high marks, we need to digest what we learned [vp4,13-] ; and it will help us to master the essence of the knowledge [cc3,5-] ; [sn9,-] therefore, we can use our knowledge more easily and freely.

< ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC ><TYP 1>                                  Patriotism     Patriotism, a kind of feeling, shows [cc2,5-5]  one's love to his nation.  A patriotic person will do anything for his motherland, even to die. In the history of our nation, there are numerous patriotic persons, such as Yuefei, Zhen cheng gong and Li zhe qu. The general meaning of patriotism is the same, however, the definition of it in different eras varies.     In acient [fm1,-]  China, the definition of patriotism was to devote oneself to the emperor and to the fudal [fm1,-]  society. You can compare what Yuefei had done with what Li zhe qu had done. Even though they fought against the foreign invaders and they defended our nation, their aim was to maintain the fudal [fm1,-]  society. On the other hand, the patriotism of the revolutionary period is quite different. The patriotic persons armed themselves and fought against foreign invaders, strifing [wd2,-4]  with the antirevolutionary army. What they have done was to liberate the working class, to liberate our whole nation, not for a man, but for every Chinese. The definition of patriotism had been developed and advanced.     Now we've been [vp6,2-7]  in the new era of socialist construction, therefore the definition of patriotism is different from others. To make our country better and stronger is the exact definition of patriotism at [pp2,-2]  present  time.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                            Study Problems      "What about the result of your final exam?" Often, parents would ask such question when they try to show their care to their children's study. However, they don't, actually, understand those study problems lying before [wd3,4-2] their children, so they don't know how to care or help them efficiently. The four problems listed as following [pr1,1-]  may be helpful to such parents.    Firstly, as the old saying goes: "Interest is the best teacher." ,lack of interests [np5,2-4]  is the biggest problem. [sn1,s] Usually, that children get low marks in school is not only due to children themselves or teachers, but also parents.[sn8,s] Because, they failed to help to [wd5,1-1]  form their child's interests in their childhood [sn2,s-] .  Secondly, lack of aims also is [wd1,4-3]  a big problem, which leads to the third problem -- lack of persistance [fm1,-] . To set up an aim can stimulate children's desire to study, and to keep the aim will make them persist to [wd3,-]  the study. finally [fm3,-], lack of practice may be the last but not the least problem. Practice should be an important part of study, but often be [vp8,10-3]  neglected by people. For example, to learn English needs lots of practice, Nowadays, most parents realize the importance of English and try to teach their children at their early age [np5,3-] . They encourage their son or daughter to remember lots of words but forget to lead them [pr1,13-]  to use them. All these problems retard [vp1,3-6]  children from good results in study.     In a word, if parents have learned these study problems of their children, and try to care [vp1,-13]  more "What's the problem you recently met with?" than the marks and results, they will be more welcomed and helpful to their children.

<ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 2>                       Reforms in My Hometown     On a shiny [wd3,2-2]  Sunday morning, I took a trip back to my hometown with my parents.  There were so many things that made this trip a most pleasant one: the beautiful country scene, the soft [cc4,-1]  sunlight, the refreshing wind, and most of all, the dramatic reforms in my hometown.     My family house greatly surprised me by transforming itself from a shabby and grimmy [fm1,-]  "hut" into a two-floor, air-conditioned house, glistening under the sun.  On entering the spacious sitting-room, I was surrounded by warm greetings, happy laughters, and the exciting news about the reforms in the hometown.  Own [pp2,-s] to the good policies from the Communist Paty, my family bought the two little hills at the back of the house, and planted mango trees there.  "It's a lot of labour involved", said my grandfather, as his weathered face cracked a big smile, but it's well worth it!" "The little hills where I played when I was a little kid?"  my face lighted up and I ran out of the house to the hills.  The two little hills, once barren and full of rocks were covered by a carpet of mango trees, with heavy, yellow mangos dotted [vp5,4-6]  in a sea of green trees, I was excited and became move [vp5,5-]  so when grandfather told me that they newly [wd3,3-6]  had tap water in the hometown, a new power plant was built and the construction of 2 first-class inter-province highways was underway [fm2,-] . [sn1,s]    "What a great reform?"  I chanted, and believed this was just the beginning, as I saw a banch [fm1,-]  of kids, dressed neatly in uniforms, flooded [vp5,11-4]  into a modern school.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                 Modernization in China   Now China is still a developing country, and our country's great goal is to become a developed socialism [wd2,-1]  country. In order that the goal can become realie [fm1,-] , modernization in our country is very necessary.   Modernization includes many aspects, such as the modernization of agriculture, the modernization of industry and so on. The most apparent feature of the modernization of agriculture and industry is the increase of the number of their products. Therefore, the goods in markets become more and more, and people's various needs can also be met well.  People can live a steady life, so that our country has good atomasphare [fm1,-]  for development. To increase the number of products, we must make full use of our resources. In our country [sn9,-]  most resources are spread [wd3,3-1]  everywhere, including remote areas and some areas that [pr5,s-]  the trasportation [fm1,-]  is convenient. In order to use the rich resources in the remote areas, we must build many new roads and adopt many advanced traffic tools [wd3,1-] . These should mainly depend on our own forces, which request [wd2,9-]  that we should pay more attention to our education. In recent years, we have made great progress on this aspect.  With the development of modernzation [fm1,-] , some problems arise. Pollution is the most serious one among all those problems. Pollution includes air pollution and water pollution, which makes people live in a worse and worse enviorment [fm1,-] ,because of various pollution [np6,1-], people suffer from some strange diseases. [sn1,s]Now we have found some ways to solve the pollution problems, for example, the authority bans that factories let their useless water flow into  [np7, 2-3] sea or [np7,4-1]  river. Now our country's socientists [fm1,-]  have found many new methods and gradually all of them will be practised.   In a word, modernization plays a very important role in our building [np7,-2]  socialism [wd2, -1]  country. We must take the right steps to develop [cc3,-1]  modernization and make our country stronger and stronger.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                    Study problems      As English majors, we inevitably encounter many problems in our study. Though we have learned English for almost 8 years, we find ourselves come across so many new words in our reading.  Most importantly, when we are writing, we will surprise [vp7,2-] to find that only a few words we can use frequently. Such problems are the common ones.   It seems that we have no choice but to practice more when we learn more. The problem here is that when we read we seem to be familiar with the words, but actually, we don't know what they really mean in the context, sometimes. "Look up in the dictionary," the teacher tell [vp3,2-1]  us. Is it good to us? While we write, we forget the words  [wd3,-2] correct spelling. Check in your dictionary."  All these problems result from our poor fundamental knowledge. It is necessary to read plenty of books to avoid  those embarrassments.  Books especially those concise, simplicated [fm1,-]  books benefit us of our sense of language.     Here a very easily misunderstanding [wd3,1-1]  way to learn English should be avoided. That is, to memorize the complicated, long, words on a large scale, before we have learned the common words well. It's not surprised [vp5,2-5]  that a student can't translate a simple text from English to Chinese well even though he has lots of "big" words in his mind. The most important thing we have to do is to read more and practise more.

I regret to say that the great amount of noise coming from upstairs, where you are living, has caused much discomfort and inconvenience to my routine life. I feel sure you must be a very diligent musician for I could hear you practising clarinet at 6 ery [fm1,-] morning without fail. I usually go around the city and gather materials, [sn9,-]  for writing in the afternoons. And I suppose you have a good nap during that period of time. When I come back from outside, sit down at my desk and begin to plot my story, there always seem [vp3,2-7]  to be a party going on upstairs. First there are pots, pans and kettles clashing against each other. Then there is an heated and loud conversation accompanied with the chiking [fm1,-]  of knives and forks. You and your friends seem to be very good singers for I find the Italian opera you performed is extremely well [ad2,7-] , especially the soprano part. I am sure you are great dancers too since the steps of the tap dance goes perfect with the rhythm of jazz music. If only I were participating instead of just listening. The truth is, under these circumstances not to mention those frequent screams and laughters, I can never concerntrate [fm1,-] on my work. Not until 12 o'clock, when all the sounds finally fade, could I find a peaceful time to deal with my work. But, what a pity, my mind has been so much exhausted and my brain begs for a rest. As [pp2,-1] the result, I have hardly write [vp9,3-4]  more than two paragraph [np6,1-]  during the whole week. At this rate, I am afraid I will never see the publication of my book. Could you and your friend please make len [fm1,-]  noice [fm1,-]  or have the party somewhere else? Your attention and cooperation will be very much appreciated. Friends I Have Had Two types of friends, the extrovert and the introvert, have played and [wd3,2-3]  exceedingly important role in my life hrough [fm1,-] the years. All of them have some influence on me and help me achieve a better understanding on life and its problems. I love t [fm1,-]  play with my extrovert friends because their open personality always seems to have a magic effect on me. They are frank. Their straightforward words [sn2,-s] . Please me rather than embarrass me for I prefer people telling me how they feel freely so that I won't feel being left out. They are vigorous. Together with them, I find numerous energetic activities to do and never get tired of them. We go picknicking [fm1,-], play tennis, visit amusment [fm1,-] park etc. Even just sitting down doesn't make us idle. We nudge, tickle each other and burst into uncontrollable laughter. Most importantly, they are the source of my gaiety. As long as they are around me, I know nothing but endless happiness.  For instance, once I did a bad job in a match [wd3,7-1]  exam and was depressed for a whole morning. One of my extrovert friends noticed and came over. He kept telling jokes and making faces and playing small tricks until the sad fog in my eyes turned into happy tears. However, my love for the extrovert friends doesn't mean I have less passion for my introvert friends, for they always give me a sense of safeness and reliability. Whenever I get into trouble, I resort to them, confide [vp2,-1] to them and have things done with the help of them. Besides being my counselors [fm1,-], they are also the best view-broaders [fm1,-] of mine since their ideas are almost always profound, comprehensive and far-reaching. Once one of them suddenly talked about the Indians' life circle theory, which not only broadened my view but also made me realized [vp5,2-]  another ysterious [fm1,-] aspect of human being. After all, both types of friends of mine also share something in common, such as generosity, kindness and consideration. I am grateful to them for their friendship, their trust and above all, the feeling of being important they grant to me. Two Schools I had entered I spent my adolescent years in two middle schools. One is No. 15 middle school, an ordinary junior middle school. Another is Guilin middle [fm3,-]  school [fm3,-] ,a key senior middle school. Both schools occupy a similar area of land [wd4,-] enroll students of almost the same number. However, the impression I have got from these two schools differs a great deal. First of all, their environments are quite different. There is an earth path leading into No.15 middle school, which is located on a dusty field bared of trees. Opposite to the school is chemical factory. Thick yellow ill-smelled smoke often carried into classrooms by wind. What impressed me most is a deep green pond covered with duckweeds and garbage. It is said once there was a child drowned in it. however [fm3,-] , Guilin middle [fm3,-]  school [fm3,-]  is a pleasant-looking school located in the center of downtown. It is accessible by a broad road lined with tall trees and wall newspaper [np6,1-3]  on both sides. The teaching buildings are farther inside, away from the noise of traffic. There is also a pond, but smaller and decorated with rockery [wd3,-s]  and fountain. Secondly, Their constructions are also in a great contrast. In No.15 iddle [fm3,-]  school [fm3,-] , the teaching buildings and the teacher' [sn9,1-1] s domitories are only divided by a narrow path. Both constructions look shabby and need rennovation. Laborotries [fm1,-]  are mixed among classrooms, all equiped with old desks carved with indistinguishable pictures and obscene words and tottering chairs. On the contrary, The [fm3,-]  teaching area and living area in Guilin middle [fm3,-]  school [fm3,-]  are clearly cut by a boader [fm1,-] of wall. It has an independent five- storey lab building and an auditorium. Most of the desks and chairs are new and the broken one [np6,2-2]  are mended at the beginning of each term. During the three years when I studied there, I often saw that some of the buildings were under rennovation. Thirdly, the looks of teachers and students and their relationship in these two schools are absolutely not the same. In No.15 middle school, the teachers always look stern and arroyed. [fm1,-]  The students are mischievious [fm1,-] and hate study. The teachers always try to discipline the students with strict rules and the students always try to escape from them. The atmosphere in classrooms is passive and rigid and stiff. On the other hand, he relationship between teachers and students can almost be alled [fm1,-] friendly. The teaches always encourage the students to teach themselves and most of the students are willing to learn. Therefore, an academic atmosphere is developed. Having been able to study in these two vastly different schools, I realize how important a school [sn9,-]  its enviroment [fm1,-] , facilities and atmosphere, it [wd7,-s]  to a student's well-being. CECL (Communicative English for Chinese Learners) is the chief course for the first and second year English majors in Guang zhou University of Foreign Languages. CECL is composed of many independent units, each dealing of [pp1,1-3]  a practical topic, such as "Festivals and Celebrations", "Enviroment [fm1,-] " "Education' etc. The following is a typical example of how a CECL unit is taught. We usually start with a warming-up exercise which could be a few questions concerning daily life or personal experience, a few blacks [wd3,2-3]  to fill in, or a brief discussion. Then, we are required to read a couple of written materials and to enhance our comprehension by answering questions and doing multiple choices. Afterwards, the teacher will ask us to put on our earphones and play us some tape-recording. We need to do some exercises while listening to see how well we could comprehend and how much we could remember. In CECL textbook, there is a special activity called " interaction". The textbook provides a certain "setting" for the students to "act". Usually four or five students form a group and each one will play a part. All groups perform the same mini-play at the same time, according to the instructions given both by the text-book and by the teacher. After that, the teacher may choose one group to perform before the class. At the end of each unit, we are required to hand in a piece of writing on a certain topic. The above said is usual practice of learning a CECL unit. Femininity Nowadays men often accuse women of lacking in femininity? What do they mean by femininity? Most probably, men tend to concern femininity with long hair, graceful dress [sn9,-]timid expression and coy behaviour. So no wonder the image of contemporary women not only disappoint them but seares [fm1,-] them to half death. Now there is not much difference in the appearance of men and women. Many women cut their hair short, wear men's shirts and trousers, and even smoke or drink heavily. However, what men hate most is the way today's women act. Ever since WWII, women have achieves [vp9,2-2]  great success through the Liberation Movement. They have taken up many important posts which used to be occupied by men only. They have made distinguished accomplishment in many fields which used to be only the men's dominion. They can acquire as much knowledge as men do. And sometimes they act even bolder [wd2,3-]  than men. These changes give men a feeling of insecurity and being deprived of hat they ought to have. Nevertheless, as far as I am concerned, the traditional oncept of femininity must be changed as time goes by. For women, there is more than being a good wife and mother. They need a areer [fm1,-] and an independent life of their own. Sometimes they have to be tough in order to win in competitions. But surely they are not encouraged to go to extremely [wd2,2-] . They are still women. Their femininity remains. What have to be rejected on them [sn2,-s] . Gentle but not weak, capable but not dominating, lovely but not flirtatious, strong but not overwhelming---- that is what a contemporary woman is expect  [vp9,7-2]  to be. When I worked as a temporary interpreter in the 14th China's Export Commodity Fair, a lot of interesting things happened around me through communicating with buyers coming from all over the world. One night, at about 12 o'clock, when we were ready to close the exhibition on the ground floor in Dong Fang Hotel, a foreigner walked in. "Hello," he said with a big smile, " I'd like to have a look at your items. I wish I were not too late." We told him that it was not late at all and assured [vp1,-4]  him out best ervice. [fm1,-] This Cyprian was in his middle fourties [fm1,-] . But he acted like a boy. He got [wd4,2-3]  with our boss immediately, despite the language barrier. After inquiring the prices for hundreds of items, he said he was hungry. So we made several bowls of instant noodles and ate together with him. The inquiries and quotations went on and on. t 3 o'clock, our boss was very tired. He went to [wd5,1-1]  upstairs to rest and left the Cyprian to his son. Certainly the Cyprian was not satisfied. Next morning, the Cyprian reappeared. The first thing he did was to get the boss. Then he asked me to interprete [fm1,-] every word he said to the boss. " This man who are supposed to be my friend,' he said intoningly [fm1,-], seizing the boss's arms, " left me to my own devices last night. I am very angry. Tell him that." Everybody knew that he was joking. But we still said some comforting words. In a second, he was cheerful again. "I'm going to the fair now. I'll be here tonight. And you [sn9,-] " he patted the boss's should [fm1,-] , " you must be right here waiting for me." Then he turned to us. " see [fm3,-]  you at 12 o'clock sharp." He threw that at us happily and walked away. I made a face behind him and said to the boss, "you [fm3,-] 'd better get some sleep now, boss." The boss nodded speechlessly, not knowing whether to laugh or to cry.

CECL is a teaching material designed and edited by experts and professions [wd3,-s]  by [wd5,0-4]  the experts and professions of GUFL and used exclusively by the English major [np6,2-2]  of GUFL. It is the abbreviation of Communicative English for Chinese Learners, whose aim is to provide [vp1,-5]  us the foundamental [fm1,-]  communicative skills. The CECL books include many units, each concerning itself with one certain type of specific topic such as Environment [fm3,-] . [sn9,-]  Chinese Food [fm3,-]  and sports [sn9,-]  etc. The whole set of 8 CECL books cover almost all the aspects we may come across in the society, and we are required to finish the course within the first two years. That is to say, we learn one book for half a term.Before every unit, we get a word list containing some new words and the important phrases and expressions appearing in the unit, which we are asked to look up in the dictionary and to be familiar with in advance. Usually, we are recommended not to prepare for the text. In class, we are not confined to one activity like grammar, listening or writing, but none of them are ruled out. We may begin with listening [wd4,-s]  a tap [wd3,-s]  and answering the questions, and then we step into the grammer [fm1,-] or the interplaying role on some as realistic question as what [,0-10]  is the preset [wd3,3-4]  situation of Chinese sports about. This discussion between every two or four students is always the most attractive for the participants. The teacher encourages us to speak out freely. It doesn't matter whither [fm1,-]  your opinion is right or not with the presupposition that you can make your argument consistent. Sometimes the teacher would like to divide the class into a [wd5,3-1]  groups to have an interesting debate. Reviewing is very essential for CECL. Besides the words and phrases, we are also encouraged to read some beautiful paragraphs, and if possible, to recite them. As to the exam for CECL, we have questions as various as dictionary [wd3,-s]  of a short paragraph, listening, writing. [sn9,-]  Translating [fm3,-]  and comprehensive reading, which are finished within about 3 hours. In general, CECL is a comprehensive course. Friend As for the terms [wd3,-s]  of friend, the dictionary has many definitions, one of which is that A [fm3,-]  friend is a person who shares the same feeling of natural liking and understanding, the same interest, etc. Yes, the girl sitting beside me is my friend because we are both crazy about Big Beat, sharing the common sense [wd3,3-5]  on Hei Bao Tang Dynasty [sn9,-]  etc. On the other hand, we have long been familiar with the old saying, [sn9,-]  a friend indeed is a friend in need. This sounds indisputable. I knew a true story. A pair of lovers, while crossing a forest in their trip, come [vp6,-s]  across a bear. They didn't think of themselves but struggled together with the bear. Though they were badly hurt, they were all alive, [sn9,-]  they are real friends. For me, the term friend always reminds me of my dairy book. Definitely, I look at it as my friend, a can-not-speaking [fm2, -]  friend. Whenever I meet with sorrow or frustration or the alike [wd3,9-] , the thought of it will inevitably come upon my mind. The result is that I get relieved. Thus, I come to the conclusion that a friend is actually a companion, which would be with you in need. A hundred [wd3,-s]  who just quarrelled with his wife at home called the young man next to him in a bar a friend because he knew the young man failed in getting an attractive girl as his girl-friend and they shared their experience. Equally, a hunter can cherish his faithful hound as his best friend because it accompanied him all long [wd5,1-1]  time, not only pursuing the hare and pheasant, but "hearing" him and communicating with him. I hurried to call my old classmate in Inquiring Office of the CSAC for one student ticket. Your student card has been lost." Her calm voice plunged into eager one. She said that the day before, her fellow had given the card to her, when she was asked to the waiting room. And when she came back, she found the card in the counter disappear [vp3,1-]. " I'm so shameful for that." Her self-blame [fm2,-]  voice came from the other side. " I had JUST [fm3,-]  put it on the counter and it was not there." she added. " That doesn't matter," I had to comfort her. "In that case, would you buy me an ordinary ticket?" "Not [wd3,-s] ," she interpreted  [wd3,-s]  me, " listen to me, Qiu. Here are [vp3, -s]  one ticket. It will be OK if you pay yuan [wd1,-]168 for it." " Not [wd3,-s] , [sn9,-]  it's unfair..." I understood her meaning. " Not [wd3,-s] , [sn9,-]  don't say it again, [sn9,-] if you regard me as your friend, would you be so kindly be let me make up a little of [pp1,4-2]  my fault[sn8,s-]?" Though I expained [fm1,-]  that she didn't mean to lose the card and it's too much for her to do so, she just insisted on her apology and the half payment of the ticket. At last, I gave up. This, to some degree, is an embarrassing experience for me.

HOW CECL IS TAUGHT CECL ( Communicative English for Chinese Learners) is a main English course used in several foreign anguages [fm1,-] schools such as GUFL. If you're a starter, here I can give you a brief introduction how it's taught. First, we should know that CECL is taught unit by unit. It covers a wide range including FOOD AND DRINK, TOURISM, HISTORY, ENTERTAINMENT and RELIGION, etc. We cannot think that we learn it in depth, the same as the teaching. After preparing for it ahead of time, you study the unit. In the 2 hours, reading is usually done above all because it can help you understand the unit better so that you can come to discuss it and grasp what the book tends to teach you. Following the teaching, there are always some [fm1,-] uestions concerning with the context for you to answer. Usually they're multiple choices or true or false choices. In order to help you understand the unit better, the teacher always offers the students some topics to discuss. Through the practice, both then [fm1,-]  oral English and their understanding about [pp1,2-2]  the unit will be improved. Next are some listening practices. You listen to the tape and write down the exact words in your text-book so that you can learn to use the useful words or phrases that are new to you. Some party [wd3,-s] of the tape were recorded by the foreign experts. You'll again have chance to imitate the pure English or American pronunciation. Diction [wd3,-s]  is often added by the teacher so that your listening and your spelling of the new worlds [wd3,5-4]  can make much progress. At last, writing is headed. But it's seldom done in class. The teacher often demands you to do it after class and hand it in later. Generally, CECL lays stress on the four skills: listening, speaking, reading, and writing.  Cities I Have Visited. The cities I have visited can be divided into three kinds: industial [fm1,-] cities, tourist cities and evoloping [fm1,-] cities. First, the industrial cities I have been to, such as Beijing and Guangzhou are famous for their advanced economy and the advanced [fm1,-] iving standard of the people. The income of these cities mainly comes from their industrial products. In Beijing and Guangzhou, you can find markets everywhere. In the markets, almost all things connecting to the life car [wd3,-s]  be seen and bought. Once you have money, you can easily buy the thing you need. However the prices of something would be higher than those in other cities. Also the industrial cities are usually well organized, especially for Beijing. teracota [fm1,-] is very famous and has attracted many travellers all over the world. Guilin's waters and mountain also help the city to make a lot of money. A Friend is a person who shares the same feelings of natural liking and understanding, the same interests, etc. It can be divided into two: close friends and common friends. A close riend [fm1,-] can share many thoughts with you, even his/her ecrets [fm1,-]. In addition, they have the same or similar feeling on sth [fm1,-]. When your friend was sad or uncomfortable, you had no reason to be happy man. You should feel sad or uncomfortable too and more or ss [fm1,-], release your friend's sadness. But that's impossible for a common friend to do--- they even don't know when you're sad and hen you're happy. They just past [wd2,2-2]  their greetings while meeting with you. That's quite different from what a close friend shows. In addition, you see a friend more regularly or often than some one [fm2,-]  else, so that you have more time to exchange your feelings and you [pr4,5-3]  points of view, especially when you are close friends. so [fm3,-]  people we also can meet regularly or quite often, but they might not be our friends. [sn8,s]For example, we meet some of our teachers almost everyday, but not all of them can be our friends. Sometimes we even hate them. In this case we meet to have classes, not for the purpose of making friends. "A friend in need is a friend indeed." Those who cannot help you solve your problems aren't called " A FRIEND." A real friend will try his best to help you --- this kind of help is based on faithfulness, not on money or some other benefits. Generally, a friend will always support you and fight with the difficulties and your opponents together with you. But if necessary, he will fairly point out your mistakes to help you improve and make more progress. A real good friend can share bed with you without fearing that you will kill or hurt him at the [wd5,3-1]  midnight. One day I chatted with my close friend Denise in the institute. We sat side by side on a bench. Suddenly, she cried in joy " Look! Cat!" Then a loudly [fm1,-]  yellow cat with brown stripes on its body was seem [wd3,-s]  jumping down from the roof of a store beside us. " How fat and lovely it is!" Denise said, with her eyes twinkling. " Yes," I was surprised " Do you like cats too?" I thought that normally girls would like dogs better than cats. " Certainly, I loved them when I was still a little girl. We even fed a cat which resembles [vp6,-s]  that cat in appearance at that time, so that [wd5,s-]  it recalled [wd3,-s]  me of my cat when I saw that cat just now." She became more and more excited. " I know. But you haven't concerned [wd3,-s]  about your cat before. How is it now?" She turned her face and said in sadness: " She has been dead." " I'm sorry ... Because of illness?" I asked. " Maybe, [sn9,-]  She didn't eat anything although I fed her with much delicious food. And we had to see her growing thiner [fm1,-] and thiner [fm1,-]. Later, she got dead." Denise said in a nearly trembly [wd2,3-1]  voice. I know the mood that she was in. " So that you even didn't knew [vp9,3-]  hat she died of, right?" Denise slightly nodded her head. " She has gone." I noticed that she was staring at the cat which had the similar appearance of hers, and now ran away. No doubt, she was referring to it. " It's a pity that we don't wave [wd3,-s]  veterinnarians [fm1,-]  here." I continued." Yes. And I wish I were, but. .." she stopped and sighed. " Life is life. There is something we cannot espect [fm1,-] ," I was trying to comfort her." I asked [wd3,-s]  to feed 4 cats altogether [wd3,-s] . I loved them more and more, and, spent most of my spare time playing with them.But they were lost or killed by others. I hate the people who treat my cats so cruel [wd2,6-] ! You seem to be comparatively lucky, right?" " Yes," Denise sighed again and said. " Why can't the animals be treated as equally as us human-beings?" " Ha ha." I laughed, " That seems not possible yet. But let's wish that some day in the future it will come true. Well, I have something to do now. See you next time." " See you". Then we left. Describing A Person: When the sun was shining in the middle of the sky [sn2,-s] . Gary looper [fm3,-] , an American cop, appeared on the street again. Under the yellowish setting of the late nineteen [np9,2-1]  century constructions, his black uniform was very eye-catching. The shing [fm1,-]  silver medal was hung on the left of his waiste-coat [fm1,-], indicating his identity. Now and then he put his right hand upon the pistol tied on the belt. The gun was so heavy together with big hand that the belt sloped to the right a little. But at the moment he seemed totally unaware of the weight on his waist, heading to the police office. Under the smart velvet hat was his clear- cut feature: keen eyes, dark eye brows, straight nose and the firm and dignified jaw. His age was not a secret, for everal [fm1,-] white hair behind his ears and the wrinkles at the corner of his eyes revealed it. he looked serious. His eyebrow frowned and his mouth tightly shut. He had a well-built figure and a straight back, from which one could conclude he had used to be a handsome young man and popular among the community. Even though today his youth had faded with years, his popularity remained, not because of his apperance but because of his trust-worthiness. His pace was always steady and his hands mere [fm1,-]  always powerfully moving with rythmn [fm1,-] while he walked. His typical walking style had been so will-known [fm1,-]  that whenever the residents spoted [fm2,-]  a man with long leg walking in this way, even 50 feet away, they could assume that: [sn9,-]  Gary Cooper was coming. Nov. 8th. An early morning, a father with his two little girls has arrived at the gate of the hospital, waiting to visit his wife who has just given birth to a boy. It is still early; the locked iron with wire screen looks like a stern guard, resolved o separate the hospital and the outside world. A scarlet number 27 is printed on the wall, contrasting the grey pavement. In the chill [wd2,2-1]  breeze, the thickly-dressed family are all looking inside the hospital earnestly. A lovely girl, about two years old, is sitting on his father's shoulders. Her chabby [fm1,-] face is resting comfortably on her father's head. Her little hands are dragging the collar of her father's flannel overcoat. The father, like his little girls, looks wistful, firmly holding the girls little leg, with his sinecry big hands. Another little irl [fm1,-] is in red otted [fm1,-] blouse and short- skirt. Her hair looks like a mess of cabbage. Her hands are grasping the cold iron bar; it seems as if she wanted to squeeze her little head through the gate. Prossibly [fm1,-]  lack of the mother's care, they all look casually dressed, especially ten [wd7,-s]  father--- his mudelled [fm1,-] hair, his flare trousers creased, his shoes dusty. Describing What People Do I am one of those who are never able to sleep like a log, so I can tell exactly at what time the lights are turned on every morning. The biological clock in my body works so well that by the time the lights are on, that is at six o'clock, I have been turning over on the bed, fully aware the light will be on at any time in the next fifteen minutes. When jthe [fm1,-]  light turns on, I first try to hide in the shadow of the musquito-net [fm1,-], shunning the sudden bright light. But soon I find the white light just keeps peneatrating [fm1,-] my eye-lids; I suddenly opened my eyes, face the luminous ray, deeply inhaled the cool air and rise up. Putting aside the warm quilt, I get out of the bed [wd4,-s]  begin to put an [fm1,-]  the clothes on the chair, which I have usually prepared the last [wd3,-s]  night. At about 6:20, dressed, I take cup, tooth-brush, ooth-paste [fm1,-], towel and basin to the washing-room. Usually at this moment most girls are still struggling on their beds to get up, so I am always the first one to get there. The process usually begins with the meticulous teeth-brushing [fm1,-], because having suffered from some teeth disease, I am very conscious of teeth hygiene. Ten minutes later, going back to any room, I take out some necessary instruments and sterilizing liquid to wash my content-lens [fm1,-] . This requires even more meticulation [fm1,-]. I first remove the lid from the sterilized bottle, take out the fragile lenses and put them on my left palm. Then pour several drops of sterilizing liquid on them and use my right forefinger to gently rub the lenses. When they are dried up, I carefully put them into my eyes, as if I was holding a precious diamond on my finger-tips. During this time, my breakfast, a cup of yogurt sent [vp7,4-3]  onto my table; the loud speaker [fm2,-]  outside is broadcasting the news on central [fm3,-]  People's Broadcasting station [fm3,-] . At 6:45, I quickly comb my hair, pick up the necessary materials for the corses [fm1,-]  on that day and go out for morning reading at 7 o'clock. The above is just what I usually do in the morning of Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday. For the nest [fm1,-] weekdays when morning exercises is required, that is another story.

So we went. ( You see, it is quite fantastic for we [pr4,-s]  having [vp5,6-6]  the festival in a remote strange valley instead of our own home). There we had no store and no cooking utilizers [wd3,1-]  so we ate in the dining room. Furthermore, there was no enough room so my sister  and I had to sleep in the hotel. But regardless [wd4,-3]  all these uncomforts [fm2,-]  we were together again. It was really an emotional shock when I saw my dearest father at the first sight. How thin he was! He had to work ten hours a day. each [fm3,-]  day his return from work was my happiest moment. At night we went to dancing ball or watched TV together, chatting. At [pp1,-6]  the Eve of the Spring Festival,we had a big dinner and waited excitedly for the ring of the New Years bell. That memory will last forever. And how about your experience of the festival? A Campaign Should Be launched [fm3,-]  Against Smoking The term of smoking's [np4,-] death is coming [wd7,-s] . Because people have [vp6,-s]  being realized, [sn9,-] what disadvantages they will be placed if they continue to let smoking go it' [np4,3-2] s own way. The first disadvantage, everyone knows, is the destruction smoking brings to our health. Though nowadays technology has been developed to make smoking more harmless, but what people can do is only to reduce the harm, not kill it [, -s] [cc3,4-1]  . the [fm3,-]  second drawback is the financial problem. Smoking wastes so much money that it tends to become a main cause of family fighting. Sometimes people divorce just because they cannot stand their spauses [fm1,-] ' smoking. The last shortcoming, but not the least mportant [fm1,-] one, is that we are used by some evil [cc6,-]capital [wd2,2-1]countries. Such as   American [wd2,-s] [sn4,-s], it has realized the disadvangtage [fm1,-] of smoking itself, and in it's [pr4,1-2] own country smoking is not popular anymore. So it turns it's [pr4,-1]  market from America to Asia, especially to china [fm3,-] . Haven't you noticed that the ads for " Marboroll [fm1,-]" [fm1,-]has become a familiar sights [np6,2-]  all over our country? [wd4,-2]  United States just want to make money, [sn9,-]  they wouldn't care about our health and our lives. I don't [wd4,-s]  we are stupid enough to spend money on smoking in return for poor health. We don't want to represent [cc3,4-6]  the history of 150 years ago, do we? So in short, for the sake of our own health, our nation's prosperity and our nation's self- respect, a campaign should be launched against smoking. The rumbles of the thunders filled strength in all the hearts of the people in Nairobi. People felt that something unusual would happen soon. Suddenly a sword-like -lightening struck the fig tree. People were shook [vp5,-s]  be [fm1,-]  the great image. The next day people found the tree began [vp1,3-2]  to wither. The news spread quickly from Nairobe to every part of Kenya. The whole country was threaten [vp7,4-5]  to a flood of excitement. Kibiru's prophecy proved to be true. In the following days visitors from all parts of Kenya came to cheer the withering of the sacred tree. All people were permeated with an excitement atmosphere. They were waiting for another storm hopefully. The mystical moment came at last. By the day Keya officially [aj1,-2]  became independent, the tree had decayed completely. Yes, the tree was dead, but it gave it's [pr4,2-4]  life to a new country. Every day there were many people stood [vp5,4-6]  in front of the remained high wall to revere the great sacred tree. In a dark night a prisoner of war managed [vp5,-5]  escaping from his barred camp and killing [vp5,7-2]  his guard. After hiding the body he dressed himself the guard. After hiding the body he dressed himself the guard's uniform quickly and coolly. Then he marched out of the camp up and down with a rifle over his shoulder like a guard. The prisoner was assigned in team No.1. Filled with armed soldiers and guards, four lorries rushed into the darkness. The prisoner soon disappeared without notice and never came back. I never find anything valuable by chance, however, I often lose things. The most favourable [wd3,2-5]  thing I've ever lost was a blue frock. It was hung in the shop window and I was attracted by it at the [wd5,1-2]  first sight. I decided to buy it. The next four months I led a hard life because I saved every penny and had no ice cream at all. But now, I had it! You can imagine how excited I was when I put it on in front of the mirror. But I found it was a little dirty because it had been hung for so long a time. I washed it carefully and hung it in the yard to dry. Classes I have Attended      There are two kinds of classes I have attended: Useful and useless. No matter they are useful or useless, I have to attend them throughout the terms.   Almost [wd4,-s]  of the classes I have attended are very useful. I am very interested in these classes and pay great attention to them. I come to these classes 5 minutes before the class begin and eave them 10 minutes after the classes are over, asking questions to the teachers. During the classes, I take down every word of the teacher. I have my eyes on the teachers throughout the classes. I have never missed any homework of these classes. In these classes ,I learn how to write an English address for my neighbour, I learn how to talk with a foreigner on the train.   The rest of the classes I have attended are completely useless.   I have never been in time for these classes. More often than not , I leave these classes 15 minutes before the teachers leave.    During these classes, I either play my " game boy", or make plans for inviting my girlfriend, Mimy, to Kara OK. I neither listen to the teachers nor take notes. I even do not known [vp9,4-3]  the teachers 'names when the school year comes to an end. Actually, I got nothing from these classes.   These are the classes I have attended, I hope all the classes I attend will be useful in the future. CECL is a now [wd3,1-1]  approach developed by GIFL for Chinese learners of English to develop their communication ability. This class usually consists of listening, reading, talking, writing activities, So you need to get your textbook, vacaburary [fm1,-] list, earphone, pen and of course, your partner ready before attending your class.    First of all, you should preview the vocaburary [fm1,-] list because there's no time for you to learn the new words in class. The class usually begins by doing some listening activitis [fm2,-] . This time you just listen to the tape played by the teacher and do the exercises in the book. . After that, you should be prepared to answer the teacher's questions. Then omes [fm1,-] the reading activity, which is usually some fast-reading materials, Again, year [wd3,-8]  will have to do a lot of exercises, such as summary of a text, gap-filling, comprehensive questions. What follows reading is usually the writing task, [sn9,-]  you are often required to write a short paragraph or something else , [sn9,-] The most interesting thing of the class is the talking activity, in which the class usually ends. In this activity, you should form either in pairs, or in groups, The topics are usually given in the book. Sometimes you have debates besides discussions with your classmates. Quite often you  will finish your class in great exhaustion and of course, you will learn a lot in this class. When a person has too much of something, he will certainly have the feeling of boredom, no matter how interesting the thing he first feel is, [sn9,-]  when there is othing [fm1,-] for one to do, this same feeling will certainly come up. There will certaintly be more parties ahead for me to ttend. I will also be supposed to behave properly. I wish there would e some new kinds of parties different from those I have tended nd I could feel happier and comfortable in them.             Two Different Schools   Guangzhou University of Foreign Languages (GUFL) and Linan University are surely of two different types as far as their environment. [sn9,-]  Academic [fm3,-]  atmosphere and entertainment activities [sn9,-]  etc are concerned.    Locating [vp5,-s]  at the foot of Baiyun Mountain , GUFL enjoys a autiful and tasteful [cc4,-1]  environment, Which [fm3,-]  allows its people to work and study in a peaceful way. One can be free of the noise and excitement downtown, breatheing [fm2,-]  the pure and fresh air here and taking  a rest on the meadows or in the shadows of the trees.    As to INU. [sn9,-]  Which [fm3,-]  lies nearly at the center of the city, the noise and the polluted air from the busy traffic nearby and the [wd5,-3]  several large markets and shops surrounding it does [vp3,-s]  make people on the campus suffer a lot. Moreover, the four main gates of INU are usually open to the outside world, which makes people outside always go in for a sightseeing or merely for a rest. So the school is now becoming more and more like a public park.     The academic atmosphere in INU seems to be more active than that in GUFL. Various kinds of lectures , discussions or debates are held in INU almost every week, focusing on international trade and finance issues [sn9,-]  stock market problems and social phenomena [sn9,-]  etc. Students take active part in these ctivities and bring their talents and knowledge from textbooks into full play. However. People in GUFL seem to be indifferent in such activities which will actually benefit them a lot. Occasionally you can have a public lecture or sth else, but most students are not very interested in it and the attendants [wd3,-s]  are always less active.     GUFL is proud of its colorful  entertainment activities which include singing contest. [sn9,-]  Dancing [fm3,-]  performance and poem reciting [sn9,-]  etc. Every season we have various activities to add colors to our life. All these activities are organized by the school and are all successful. In INU the situation is a bit different. Owing to its large scale, every department is responsible for its own mattes [fm1,-] . So you can only find some small scale entertainment activities held by each department. They thus don't cause any sensation. There are only few activities which are organized by the school and can round off.   CUFL and INU may have many things in common as an university. But they really differ in the above aspects.      How to learn the CECL Course     The full name of CECL is Communicative English for Chinese Learners. It is a course for English majors and is taken as a practice in GUFL.    This course emphasizes [vp1,-6]  more on training the student's ability of listening comprehension and spoken English and it also includes certain  amount of exercises for writing and reading. The whole textbook is divided into about forty units, each dealing with a topic of life, culture, history, geography science, medicine [sn9,-]  and [wd5,-s]  etc. In using this textbook, students will be instructed to do the reading. [sn9,-]  Listening [fm3,-] [sn9,-]   writing and speaking practice. All these exercises are concerned about [wd3,-] the topic of the unit. For example [sn9,-]  if the unit is about Cuisine [fm3,-] . [sn9,-]  You [fm3,-]  will need to read several passages about, say,the various styles of cuisine, the making of certain Chinese dishes, the proper [cc4,2-5]  wrong of using western table wares [sn9,-]  etc. Having gone through the passages, students will be instructed to some do exercises, say, writing down some points of the idea embodies [vp5,7-3]  in the passages. For the listening comprehension exercises, students will be required to listen to a dialogue or something else about how the foreigners feel about Chinese food or the process of cooking a Chinese dish [sn9,-]  etc. Students will then need to grasp the main ideas and write them down or to use the information they have heard  to fill in blanks or charts.     The most  active step in learning this course is the oral practice. Students will be  encouraged to discuss certain topics about the unit between them, Sometimes with the help and organization of the teacher, the students will have an animated debate. Through these oral practice [np6,2-] , the students will be able to not only practise their  spoken English, but also express their own ideas upon the  topic. Having finished the unit, the students will  usually be asked to write an essay or composition about  the topic they have dealt with, writing down their feelings  or impressions.     Before the teaching of each unit, students will be given a word [wd5,1-5]  list of the new words and phrases to help  them. A pair of earphones is also provided for each student for their listening exercises.    CECL does have many advantages in training students' comprehensive ability. It helps to broaden the students' knowledge as well. However, a lot of improvements are still needed to make it bettor [fm1,-]  serve the purpose of teaching English majors [sn9,-]               Friend     The dictionary has varied explanations for the word " friend " ranging from " person one knows and likes "to" helper  to " supporter " [sn9,-]  No matter how different [wd2,-s]  people view " a  friend" as [sn9,-]  surely there is one thing in common, [sn9,-]  a friend should be a person who is familiar with you and you two do enjoy a relationship.     When you are lonely and depressed, you may need a friend to be with you, for you need someone who is patient enough to listen to you and to propitiate your  sorrow or anger. A friend is a person who knows you well and is inclined to share your misfortune when you are in trouble. The friendship may make you believe that at least there are your friends in the world who will care about you and you may talk [wd3,-s]  to for help. Sometimes you may merely feel like to talk to someone to have our happiness shared by more people. Again you need your friends to be with you. You may have a good time together and this hilarity will surely drive away your loneliness. Some people may think that a friend is  a person who can  give help and support. But I would like to claim that a friend is a person whom you need not to wear disguise before. You may tell him or her your secret and he or she will keep it for you. When you suffer frustration in job, life and love [sn9,-]  etc. You may go to find your relief and pleasure in friendship. [sn9,-]  For [fm3,-]  your friends will assure you that they will always stand by you and be ready to help . A friend is a person whom you may go for help without the least hesitation and ceremony. A friends [np6,1-]  is a person who will do all the needed things for you without being asked for or paid for. I can not imagine what my life will be if I fail to find any friend but only emimies [fm1,-]  and hypocrites. My frends [fm1,-]  are part of my life.

[sn2,0-15] Since the tourist industry is flourishing in recent years, and more people are involved in it. Many young people are holding jobs as tourist guides. Like other occupations, the job of a guide has its own advantages and drawbacks so it is hard to say it is good or bad. Sometimes it can be very attractive and profitable, [sn9,-] Sometimes it will be rather unpleasant. A friend of mine who is working for CITs  [fm1,-] GuangZhou branch as a torist [fm1,-] guide, often has many stories about her job to tell. I remember that was a sunny spring day. She called on me [fm1,-] nexpectedly at my dormitory [fm1,-]. When I first saw her, I almost couldn't recognize her. She was rather thin, campared [fm1,-] with the  [wd7,7-5] precious time I had seen her, she seemed to have lost 5kg weight. [fm2,-] Her face was  [aj3,3-4] darker and full of weariness. " I am gong to die." She said with little energy as soon as she saw me. And then she began  [fm1,-] hr endless and angry complaint about her new job. She said with great dislike [sn9,-]  "Everyday I have to get up very early, sometimes there is even no time to finish [wd4,7-1]  breakfast. And then I have a group of people  [fm1,-]  [vp5,6-1] fellow me wherever I go, which makes me feel like a fool. Then you have to answer all kinds of silly questions raised by dozens of them. It is very boring. I have to repeat the same story hundreds of times and even so, still there are some foolish fellows who can not make clear and keep asking without an end. Usually, I can't have lunch in time which causes serious problems in my stomach. So, I advise you: Do not take up the job as a tourist guide, or you'll regret!" Knowing so much disadvantages of the job, I almost made up my mind that tourist  [np6,1-4] guide was the worst job in the world. Then I asked her: "How about changing, [sn9,-]   [pr4,3-1] you job and try to find another one?" "No, I won't [sn9,-] " she refused me without hesitation. "You know, though the job is rather tiring, it is really a money-making one. You get a lot of  [np6,5-4] tip if you are Lucky." Her answer confused me. Sometimes I just can't understand why people do things which they don't like. Is money so important? Maybe, I'll understand it in some future day. Gary Cooper was the kind of man who you will never forget once you see him. Even in a crowd of people you can have no trouble in pointing him out at once both because of his enormous height and a scarcely-seen stern face. He was in his late 30's and looked physically strong and mentally keen, advancing with big and rapid strides  [fm1,-] n the street where only a few numbers of people were wandering. One of his long  [np6,4-3] hand was swinging forcefully, accompanying [fm1,-] the movement of his legs, while the other hand seemed never to be moved away from the pistol hung on his loin. He was always watchful like  [np7, 1-3] a excellent hunting dog and prepared to draw upon the gun to deal with any unexpected attack at any time. He was wearing a smart white shirt and a pair of black trousers. A high quality black leather waistcoat was suitably covered on. He was wearing a belt round his waist in a casual way and a  [wd7,1-5] packet watch shining  [fm1,-] n the  [fm1,-] un. He had a long and ough [fm1,-] face with clear edges and corners. That kind of roughness was only owned by those who had experienced innumerable dangers nd [fm1,-] trauma. His nose was extremely long and straight which made you immediately associate with the one made of plaster stone. His mouth was held tightly and the corners of the mouth bent downward cynically. Although the brim of his hat had almost [fm1,-] elipsed his eyes, you could feel two columns of cold lights projected from them which would made everybody shiver with fear. His eyes was fierce and full of determination. There was always a slice of sneer hanging on his face where some kind of murderous intent was hiding behind. He was forging ahead with a face as cold as ice.
