So much do they impress me that I would rather keep them as part of the everlasting memory. ne [fm1,-] friend of mine and I were graduates from two different iddle schools. As for the principles of teaching, they form a sharp contrast. In classes most of her teachers show distinct likes to excellent students and dislikes to " bad" students. They lways [fm1,-] ask the former ones questions with smile and then can't help praising them while seldom pay attention to the latter ones even if those students get the right answer, which always frustrates the backward students. in [fm3,-]  contrast, most of my teachers treat students equally. There exists no pride and prejudice. Every student has an equal chance in no matter raising questions r expressing his own opinion freely. No matter from whom, each question will be answered seriously and each solution, if it is convincing, will be accepted. This principle motivates students and makes them more competitive. After class, excellent students receive more chances than others in improving abilities. No matter whether they have the talent in the aspect, teachers like to see their "preference" in the competition's list and push them on, train them and let them take part in various contents and require them to bring back honours. All these chances scarcely fall on other ordinary students who eventually come to be bored of all these tricks. But in my school, chances can fall on any student who interests [wd2,3-3]  in some aspect and turn him into a competitor under the same competitive rule. One student may join any interest group he likes even though he is not a "good" student. For the ability is considered the most important factor, not a high mark in routine study instead. In my friend's school, the principle of teaching can cultivate several talented persons while in my school, it can forster [fm1,-] a group. CECL aims at training students' comprehensive skills, including listening, reading, speaking and writing. It seems to have methods rich enough in motivating students, but it may fail if students don't cooperate. In a word, how to learn CECL mainly means how to cooperate actively with the teacher. Before ttending [fm1,-] the class, prepare the text by consulting dictionaries for key new words listed by the teacher beforehand, and skimming the text through so as to make a general impression about [pp1,4-2]  its content and composition. When having a CECL class, a student has to know how to learn by himself. The teacher plays no doubt a certain role, but his main task is to act as an observer, or an instructor, at the very most, who can not replace the student himself and finish the process of cognition for him. So the student himself is the main body in how to learn CECL. More flexibility, more vigorous creativity and more initiative are required. To raise questions in mind and manage to solve it after reading is much better than glancing the material through and sitting back and waiting for the teacher's explanation. Theoretically, we train our communicative skill in class mainly by getting through with large quantities of exercises involving the truest native materials. However, this doesn't mean that we should focus on their grammar, phonetics or word-formation, etc. People apply to [wd5,1-8]  the communicative skill to the exchange of information. On the contrary, we can strengthen our communicative skill by obtaining and passing information to form the understanding between two parts. In addition, a student in CECL is required to have the most natural manner. It can mostly be explained as focusing on fluency rather than on accuracy. Once a student is confined to the principle of accuracy, he can never express himself clearly and communicative smoothly. The process of courting accuracy is a long and hard process of deep thought. Even if he was able to reach that goal, he would probably have lost his fluency for decades. That is why we stress fluency nstead [fm1,-] of accuracy and we are sure our emphasis does accelerate he process in improving accuracy. The words above are some of my own experience and I hope they can give you a clearer impression on how to learn CECL. "A friend is a person one knows and likes, but who is not a elation." Says a dictionary, but my views of 'friend" have more variety. In my childhood, a friend is my little partner skillful in rubber band skipping. However, before I knew how to skip the rubber band, I had long approved of my elder sister's being my friend--- when I was driven back from kindergarten every weekend, the first sight of her, standing under a tall banyan and waving her hand excitedly to me beside the road, always injected a feeling of pain into my innocent heart, like an unexpected gale sweeping across a tranquil wheat field. I had been missing her so much! After I graduated from junior school and separated from my best friend, I once had an impulse to write to her, telling her about my new school life and new classmates. She is the first person I can think of when I am in the mood for pouring out my heart. When a passenger-by offers to care about you, your happiness and health in the place of your parents when they can not accompany you on your arduous trip, you come across a friend. He is the voluntary helper who willingly installs [cc3,-5]  his spare-time on your car breaking down on the way. A friend is a sharer while a sharer is not certain to be a friend. If I have the only-left chocolate in my pocket, I would like to cut it into halves and chew satisfyingly with the same [wd7,2-2]  hungry friend. I will never share the sweetness with an enemy who is greedy and violent. When one needs a friend, it [,0-3]  is no need to search him up and down. If you are not too arrogant, you will likely find him among the noisy crowd because he is the one stands by you and supports you.   hen one is enjoying friendship, he is probably the happiest person in the world. Friendship is often sweeter than marriage because it has freedom and you are always yourself that no one can change. Henry Adams says, " Friendship needs ... a community of thought." When you communicate with a person and find that word sometimes seems redundant, he is the friend you are looking forward to, because at that moment you are " one soul abiding in two bodies". To me, a friend always brings a feeling which comforts me. Thus I can't help thanking God's generosity for arranging the date between my friend and I occasionally which has bestowed a splendid colour on my life's trip. In such cities, we receive visual and taste [sn6,2-1]  pleasure. The architecture, the gardens, ancient relics on display, the amazing water and mountains ... all keep you delightful [wd3,2-]  and curious all the time, and the street snacks, such as pancacks [fm1,-], small steam buns in Huang zhou [fm2,-] , rice noodles in Gui lin [fm2,-] ... all make your mouth watering. But it is also the iggest [fm1,-] tourist city. I remember there is a restaurants in my hometown quite resembling the one in [wd3,-2]  our campus, as the layouts are concerned. Firstly, the one [wd4,2-2]  my hometown is a two-story building with large windows. Similarly the one on our campus--- let's call it campus restaurant--- has two stories and large windows of dark glasses. Neither of them use both stories for money- profiting purpose. The home-restaurant, as well as the campus-restaurant has its count-desk on the second floor, while the floor serves as a canteen, where the staff go and have a reasonable- price meal, using tickets instead of cash. Both restaurants have many rectangular tables on the first floor so that the staff can sit. The firsat [fm1,-]  floor serves for the welfare of people. Secondly, when you enter the second floor of either restaurant, you will immediately recall the other one, because they have almost the same design. The home-restaurant has kitchen in the left- front part. Similarly, the campus restaurant has it there oo [fm1,-]. The home- restaurant looks as orderly as the campus one due to the concentric- circle- shape placed tables. Because the walls of both restaurants are almost devoved [fm1,-]  by the windows, such [wd4,-6]  kind of arrangement for the tables can enable most of the customers to have a good view of the outside scenery. Have a cup of tea in either restaurant, and you'll feel the same pleasure. CECL CLASS CECL ( Communicative English for English Learners) needs some prepare [wd2,3-] . Before the class begins, you should have already gone over the list for new words and expression for the subject to be dealt with in class, for example, education, health, cusine [fm1,-], religion, etc. Thus you have a general idea on the subject. Class begins with warming-up exercises, which includes listening, direction [wd3,-s]  or a short report to the teacher of what happened yesterday. Then reading follows ---- In [fm3,-]  the CECL book, many articles are included for one subject. Some and [fm1,-]  for intensive reading and some are just for skimming or skinning [fm1,-] -you read the articles which the teacher points out and think about it while reading. When all students finish the articles, they are devided [wd5,2-2]  into several groups to discuss on [wd5, 1-2]  the articles they just read or anything about the subject you're dealing with for today's CECL class. One student will be responsible to report to the whole class the conclusion of their group's discussion, and there will be argument and seven debate [np6,1-] between the groups. The teacher will stop the students at proper moment and the class settle down for listening. Listening materials are closely related to the previous discussion; everyone is supposed to listen carefully and get the gist the first time and specific details the second time. If necessary, a third time listening is done to get better comprehension. After listening is some more reading. Such articles may be more profound and gramatical [fm1,-] explaination [fm1, -]  by the teacher is expected. The class may end in some more discussion, some more interesting materials or some writing. Writing is still on the dealt subject, giving students' opinions or experiences. Usually 2 or 3 classes we needed for one subject, [sn9,-] [sn8,s]call one unit. CECL is based on a subject- division system. Boredom Men having [vp4,-s]  been suffering boredom ever since they learnt to think. It causes mischief and destrustion and it is socially very expensive. he dictionary has dicribed [fm1,-]  "boredom" as "state of feeling tired by being dull or tedious" which emphsize [fm1,-] [wd4,-3]   the objective elements and its influence upon people. While Esteller, [sn9,-]  Ramey defines it as "a grossly underestimated malady". This definition seems giving [vp5,3-5]  us a more subjective picture of a bored man, i. e. boredom is considered a disease which manipulates a person's action, internally. But in my point of view, " Boredom" means " Emptiness in mind". If one has got thoughts, nothing could bore him, whethor [fm1,-]  internally or externally, while emptiness produces no hope, no desire to act or change, so it inevitablly [fm1,-] leads to boredom. The famous paorter [fm1,-]  Vangue had spent years in a lonely island Tahiti, painting. He painted and painted, living a simply [wd2,2-1]  life. But not only didn't he feel bored, but also he was vigorous and contemplative all the time. That's what a [np7,-2]empty man cannot understand or cannot do. Friends Friends are great treasure to me, whether they are older than me, of me [pr4,1-2]  same age or much younger than me. They bring me into a world full of color, showing me the unknown and accompaning [fm1,-] me to taste the happiness and bitterness. Though not many older friends I have made, they play rather an important role in my life. Those wonderful people, who have experienced so much happiness and suffering, usually like to give me advice bout how to deal with my life. Their soothing remarks are so convincing that they help me over come the difficulties again and again. Like the breeze in the garden [wd4,6-1]  autumn, they make me feel so comfortable. hough [fm1,-] not so experienced as the old, those friends of my same age are great pleasure to me. They offer company whenever and wherever I am. We go to see Vivien Lee. We discuss love and death. We are worried about the corruption. My beloved friends are sunshine in my life. Apart from those mentioned above, I also have some friends who are much younger than me. They may not understand what I am thinking of, but their innocent eyes tell me how to love the nature and the world. Playing with them reminds me of something I have nearly forgotten: the beauty of the grass leaves, the games played between the chickens and the sympathetic heart one should not throw away. Those are my friends. They are an unalienable part of my life. I will not change them for anything. CECL (Communicative English for Chinese Learners) class is quite different from the traditional English class. It involves the 4 basic skills --- listening, speaking, reading and writing in the same class. And it is an effective way to arouse the initiatives of the students and it shows a new picture of learning a language. Compared with the traditional reading class, CECL requires fewer preparations. A CECL book is divided into several units and each unit deals with a certain topic such as food, health, economy, envionment [fm1,-] . Thus each unit has a limited and special vocabulary connected with that topic, which is given to you before the class. So looking up in the dictionary and remembering the words are the main tasks in your preparations. After that, it would be much better if you can get some relevant materials for background knowledge. But remember that you do not have to read the text before hand [fm2,-]  unless the teacher asks you to do [wd5,-s] . Having a CECL class means you have no time to think of or do other irrelevant things. Maybe during a traditional class you are now and then bored by the dats [fm1,-]  of birth and death of Hemingway, or the so-called romantic story about  or the styles of Henry James which are told by the teachers standing on the platform. But in a CECL class, you are two [fm1,-]  busy to feel bored. Before the class is started [vp7,4-] , you have to have everything prepared: book, exercises book, pen, dictionary and earphone. Then during the following time, you are engaged in listening to the tape in which the differences of food are discussed, in giving a brief speech to your classmates about how to cook a fish, or in reading a passage dealing with the translation of a manu [fm1,-] . You are occupied by so many activities that you find the class is [wd5,-s]  unexpectedly short. The most mportant [fm1,-] thing is that you really know something about food and master skills which may be employed in future. After class, it seems that CECL leaves you little to review, [sn9,-]  on the contrary, it leaves you much time to do a lot of self-studying to make up for what you can not learn in the course. On the whole, CECL uses various means to cultivate your interest in what you are learning and it provides you with novelty and pleasure in studying. What is boredom? When you wake up in [wd3,-3]  a Sunday morning and go across the room to turn on the TV and then have nothing else to do, you know it. When a friend calls on you the third time this week and keeps telling you his tedious wife and his cat, you taste it. when [fm3,-]  you go to work at 9:00 a.m. and come home at 5:00 p.m. day after day, you feel it. So, boredom is a feeling almost eryone [fm1,-] will experience now and then. It is the state of feeling tired and uninterested by something dull. You hate it but it seems impossible, or difficult to get rid of it. boredom [fm3,-]  is something choked in your throat but you can not force it out, which makes you very uncomfortable. Once you encounter boredom, you are apt to have no strength in you and want to be lazy. The world around you is grey and something you respect and have struggled for becomes meaningless. You move a chair to the door and sit down and stare at the sky, waiting for the end of the day, of the moon, of the year. If this is the case for you, you are very fortunate. Boredom sometimes causes people to resort to drug and violence. They hope that the bills [wd3,-s]  could help them out and make them feel high. And since boredom is something you can not speak out, some people find that hitting somebody or something is a way to relieve which [pr5,-s]  is likely to bring catastrohpic [fm1,-] results. But what should we do with boredom? I think occupying yourself with something in which you are interested is one of the answer [np6,3-]  to cultivate some interests like collecting stamps, reading, raising animals and flowers is wholesome to men. Whenever you feel Mr. Boredom is coming, take up your favorite book or throw yourself in your collection of various small stones to counter him, which is to be of, at least, a little use. An other [fm2,-]  way is to find some time for yourself to go away from the routine to gasp [wd3,-3]  some fresh air. It is a technique of living. And there is a last thing I would like to advise: considering it is so hard for yourself to get rid of the boredom brought by Mr. Smith's repeating stories, try not to bring boredom to others. <ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 18><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                         Please think over the details of the three evidences of the prosecutor.  Perhaps some puzzles would be up to you.[sn8,s]     Now let's analyze the three evidences [np6,-] more carefully and logically.    First, the testimony of the old man who lived just under the room where the murder took place. [sn2,s]  He said at ten minutes after twelve he heard loud noises sound [vp4,4-3]  like a fight and heard the kid said to his father, "I'm a  going to kill you."  Stop here.  Do you really think the boy would shout a thing like that so the whole neighbourhood could hear?  This is the first puzzle.  Then the old man said a second later he heard a body falling.  In 15 seconds he got out of bed, ran to the door and opened the door just seeing [vp5,14-5]  the kid beating it downstairs.  How could the old man who walks with two canes run? And how could he finish all the things -- get out of bed, run to the door, open the door only in 15 seconds?  This  is the second puzzle.    Second, the evidence of the woman across the street. [sn2,s]  She said she tossed and turned for over an hour, unable to sleep.  Finally she turned toward the window at about twelve ten.  As she looked out, she saw the boy stab his father.  The woman wears glasses.  She wouldn't wear her glasses in bed, would she? And the lights through the passing train went out a second later, [sn9,-]  It is sure she couldn't have had time to put on her glasses.  How could she see clearly?  Third puzzle.    Last, the cute little  switch knife with which the father was killed.  We could get many knives just the same as it in [wd4,1-3]  little junk shop around the corner from the boy's house.[sn,s].   Let's think over the whole business about the stab wound and how it was made.  The downward angle of it.  The boy is five feet eight inches tall.  His father was six two .  That's a difference of six inches.  It's very hard to stab down into the chest of someone who's taller than you are.  And one [wd3,-s]  who has ever had any experience with switch knives never have stabbed [vp6,s-]  downward.  He wouldn't  have made the kind of wound that killed his father.  It's the fourth puzzle.    Innocent until proven guilty. [sn2,s-]   How could you use such evidences with so many puzzles to prove [wd4,2-1]  guilty?  Never.  So the boy is innocent.

Or the gunfire, or a savage laughter, [pr1,7-0] they arouse my imagination and I'm really living in a might  mare [fm1,-] [fm2,-]. Could you be so kind enough[wd5,2-] to spend a little more time at home and tell your kids to make less noise? I'll be very grateful if I can spend a day quietly. Yours, CLASSES I HAVE ATTENDED[sn9,-] Three kinds of classes I have attended make my way of taking classes changing from time to time. [sn8,s]There is a kind of  [np9,5-2] teachers who like to read what's on the text books. [pr1,10-1] He is too prudent to have his own opinion. When I attend [pr1,12-1]their classes, all I have to do is to take notice of where the teacher is reading and make a mark there. No note is necessary even though teachers [wd7,1-1] chink [fn2,-]oppositely. Also the whole class is rather  uiet[fm1,-]. All the students lower their heads, seemingly attentive to something. Some are reading novels, some are writing letters, some are even listening to walk  man[fm2,-], leaving the teacher by the platform practising [vp5,1-0] read-aloud. But another kind of class,not like the [wd7,1-2] fore said one, makes us dictating all the time. [sn8,s] The teacher finds some materials that we'll never find, then, read one sentence  by sentence to us. [sn8,s]We are kept writing like machines, occasionaly [fm1,-] [fm1,-][vp4,7-4] look up at the teacher with a begging expression, "Could you please slow down your reading?" Time  eems [fm1,-] to never pass normally in such kinds of classes. Of course, not all the classes I've attended are like that.  [vp1,0-20] There are still  [fm1,-] ome teachers both follow the text book and have their own opinions and most of all, let  us have time to  [vp4,5-2] think, to exchange ideas at class. Usually the atmosphere is warm.  [fm1,-] ome [fm2,-] times I take note of the information not in the text book, sometimes follow the teacher's instruction to think [sn8,s], to develop my opinion. Only at that time,[sn9,-] can I feel the art of teaching and experience the happiness of learning. This has been my impression on the classes I've attended in this institute and I wish I'll always have that last kind. TWO SCHOOLS [sn9,-] The first impress[fm1,-] on [pr5,2-6] that schools A and B give you are different stepping into school A,[sn8,s]you'll see a small garden with roses, camellias, cannas and other colorful flowers . But there's only a bituminous road between the schoolB's, [sn9,-]gate and the main teaching building -the 10-storey chemical Building. [fm1,-]long each side of the road is a line of Chinese parasols. The chemical Building is obviously newly built. From the board on the gate of the building, you can see it's onated [fm1,-]in 1992 by a well- off patriotic overseas Chinese[sn9,-] While over the garden, the main building in A--the English teaching building, was built 50 years ago, Some windows are broken, too. As you go further, you'll find that,  as a college, A is much smaller in size than B which is a university. Only two or three more teaching buildings are scattered around the main building of A, containing all the classrooms and offices for 4 departments. While in B, a single physics Department has 35-storey  [np1,2-3] buildings as regwlar[fm1,-] classrooms and a T-storey laboratory building. About 10 minutes' walk will be enough for you to get a general idea of A's layout. However, you can hardly make B's layout clear  if you have no bike and are not willing to spend at least half an hour. Another notable thing you may easily find is that there are much more girls in A than in B.  that [fm3,-] mainly  [sn2, 2-3] due to  [np9,2-2] that fact that A  [sn2,2-4] in a college of  languages and B is  [np3,2-1] science university. Both boys and girls choose what interests them  as their majors. In A, girls wearing beautiful clothes are walking on the campus practising oral English or, with a radio in hand [sn9,-] , listening to VOA'S special English. But it's a totally different picture in B--in dormitories, books everywhere, dirty clothes thrown on beds and socks under beds,  boys are sitting quietly at the desks, working on piles of assignments the professors have just assigned. [sn1,s]   Not like other major English courses like College English or Comprehensive English, CECL course is more vivid and effective for students' first  [np1,0-4] two years of basic training in colleges. Traditionally, students are faced with a long text with numerous new words and grammers [fm1,-]and they have to prepare a lot before the new  lesson: look up the new words  on[wd3,-] the dictionary, preview the text and so on. Words [sn9,-]  phrases and grammer[fm1,-] are the centre of their study. But   for CECL, there is  a specific topic for each unit, such as family,  to wris [fm1,-]and sport . Gcturally [fm1,-], there are few long passages or  [np6,4-2] text in CECL, but more listening ,speaking and writing exercises. So, to take a CECL class, students do not necessarily preview the text. The only thing they would do is to get their earphones ready . When the lesson begins, some simple questions related to the central topic are raised by  the teacher and [sn8,-s] comes a small warm  [fm2,-] up discussion .Usually there is an  [cc4,1-1] according [wd3,-]record by [np7,-]foreign expent [fm1,-]  or the same topic  [np6,0-5] student then listen to the tape, sometime take notes, to see how's the conversation going[sn8,s]. fter [fm1,-]  [fm3,-] that, the teacher helps  the student go through some specific terms for the unit. In sports, there will be the names of various sport games, rules, etc. For Tourism, there will be  [np7,3-5] the introduction of famous scenic spots in China and abroad.  In every unit, there are activities for students to act and talk. They are devided [fm1,-]into several groups and try [vp6,s-] their best to present vividly some situational dialogues to the whole class. Thus, in CECL class, the atmosphere is always warm and exciting. There are almost 20 practical topics in CECL,  [wd3,8-3] concerning a wide range. [sn8,s] It's not listening lesson, neither oral English lesson nor writing lesson. But equally more of  [pr1,4-3] these are ruled out. Students are the centre of the lesson [wd3,-] in [fm2,-] stead of the teacher, which, few other courses can have this as a characteristic.[sn8,s] A Friend[sn9,-] A friend is who, when you have been painstakingly travelled along your river of life and want some  support , appears  like a paddle of a boat. A friend is the breeze in summer and the bright sunshine in winter. He pats on your shoulder to give you strength and a sign of under   standing [fm2,-]when you lose a match .Passing you a towel or a rink, " [fm3,-] one cannot  always be the champion [sn9,-]  don't [fm3,-] let yourself  [fm1,-] own!" [sn9,-]  he says slowly but firmly. He understands  [,2-12] when you   part with your girl- friend much better than your parents do ."How about a wrestling, we two?"  He finds a way  for you to blow off your steam. He   shorts [fm1,-]your ears when you've lying lazily on bed a whole day, "Hey ,guy, enough rest ! you have got to work now! Do not be a lagy [fm1,-]bone!" Sometimes, he is a patient brother,[sn9,-] in other time, he is a good guy to play with , and he could be one [wd3,-]instructor as serious as an old grandpa . A friend shares your sorrows and happiness. Also, he needs your comfort when in bad mosd [fm1,-]and invites you to enjoy his happiness. He may have some shortcomings, as  on [fm1,-] one is perfect . But you know him and understand him just as he always treats you appreciate your.[sn8,s] As time passes by, maybe you have charged a lot and so has he. Maybe you two are far away from each other. But a friend, who really deserves the word "friend" ,will never be far away. He is always on [wd3,-] your mind and he always  gives  you  courage and confidence. A friend is a priceless treasure. Returning books During the break, I went hurriedly to return some Chinese books. But when I got there, no assistants could been [fm1,-] seen. Suddenly, I heard an angry voice," These cheats! Such rotted gourd  worth  $2 per jin! " With these words , a head rose from below the counter.     Then another, "you have got to stand it  !" the latter and younger one tried to soothe the elder assistant , " Nowad [fm1, -] ay, people are crazy for money! They can do anything for that !" And she then started to complain how she had been cheated once. "Excuse me," I hesitatly[fm1,-] asked, "May I return the books now?" They stopped, turning to me. It seemed as if a volcano would erupt. "Pass it to me!" the younger lady came to me, checking the books," you made  these  marks?" she asked me coldly, lifting her eyebrows." You are doomed!" I said to myself.      "   well[fm3,-], No, when I started reading I found the wants [wd7,-] already there."" Why didn't you  fell  [fm1,-]us when you borrow it ? It  [wd7,1-2] want be you !" She raised her voice. I made   no answer -I could only admit it was a good lesson. I had thought the assistants must have made all the  checkings[fm1,-] and I had been in a hurry   when I borrowed it . At the very moment, the elder  lady joined the younger one. "Another scribbler?  FIWE! [fm1,-] " Two  [wd3,3-3] man  for  each place. How many has she got? One ...Three... Six ...!! [sn9,s] That's $ 1. 2!" No sooner had I caught what she said them a fine fill was in front of me. Skillful assistant! And I spent $1.2 buying a good lesson..

Yours sincerely Three kinds of friends enter my life, tinge it with colours and add its richness: the close friends, the nodding friends and the good-weather [wd7,-1] friends. They give me their hand when I am in bad time, listen patiently to the troubles I pour out to them, and  some how [fm2,-]remove it magically . To stay with them is happy because I can wear my heart[cc3,2-] on the sleeve and need not keep myself to myself. Straight  [wd3,-]for word remarks even [np6,3-2] criticism are welcomed. They are unlikely to make offences for we  know that such frankness is true and sincere. We share the secrets, rapture and sorrow. No regret for departure, but  [sn2,6-5] is willing to meet next ime [fm1,-].   They often bring laughter and fun to my life, and even a "Hello" in the street makes my heart light. To those good-weather [wd7,-1] friends, I dislike them. Because I know they can flatter me to the top of the sky when I am in luck, and they can also shovel me on the ground and pique my dignity. They are [wd7,2-3] adows [fm1,-]in the sun and will disappear into this air as soon as darkness befalls. I have been in two middle schools to receive my secondary education. One is the Attached Middle School of GUFL, the other is Guangzhou No.2 Middle School. No.2 Middle School is a key school in Guangzhou, there fore [fm2,-] in comparison to the former one, it is more  [aj3,3-3] strict in many aspects. In addition, the strictness of NO.2 Middle School is lustrated  [fm1,-] in its daily-life. Although it is not a boarding school. [sn9,-] the leaders are very much oncerned [fm1,-]with students' appearance and behaviour. Students are forbidden to coear [fm1,-]ornaments, boys are not allowed to have long hair, long fingernails  [vp3,2-1] is unbearable. There are often sudden checks on this. Further more [fm2,-], students are required to wear uniform at least 3   ays [fm1,-]a week. Even in [wd7,2-2] oozen[fm1,-] winter mornings, girls have to wear their uniform of western-style dresses. Those who violate the rules would be criticized openly. This phenomenon however has never happened in the Attached School. Students are free to wear colourful clothes, and have small ornaments to add [cc6,-]up their beauty. This is away vigorates [wd7,3-2] the campus.[sn8,s] CECL, the full name of which is Communicative English for Chinese Learner [np6,5-6]  is a set of comprehersive [fm1,-]textbooks. It covers such knowledge as greeting people, job, food , sports, tourism, economy, and so on ,  [wd4,3-4] each aspect as a unit. In each unit, there includes the training of listening , reading, oral English writing and role play .  [fm1,-] ne characteristic of CECL is its large amount of new words. Therefore, before the start of a new unit , he teacher will ive [fm1,-] each student a list of the new words of the unit . Students may look up the words in the dictionary and get themselves familiar with the meanings and us ages. Futher [fm1,-]preparation depends on the tasks which will be done in class. Listening exercises, which , often is the first part in a unit , need no preparations. Before the exercise begins, the teacher will give several minutes for the students to look through the instructions as well as the questions. Then they may listen to the tape twice and do the task (either fill in some blanks or answer questions ) at the same time. After that, the teacher will give the answers and analyse the tcpscrips[fm1,-]. Then comes the second exercise, reading [sn9,-]  usually, students are required to read the articles before class, look up some words , and have a rough idea of the  out line  [fm2,-]of the articles. In  [np6,1-3] the class the teacher  [fm1,-] ill explain some language points and draw students' attention to some useful words and expressions. When the students have  [vp4,4-3] make clear of the contents exercise be done[sn8,s], which help the students to a better understanding. Since the articles in a certain unit are all selected to introduce the topic from different angles, it is important that the students have mastered the essence of it. Group discussion appears in a unit frequently. It provides good  [np6,3-3] opportunity for the students to prictice [fm1,-]their spoken English. The topics discussed are closely concerned with the unit. Students are encouraged to express their ideas freely. And by listening to others  opinion [fm1,-] [np6,5-2] , they have a deeper impression about the text.  Role play is another kind of practice. It calls for the students to take part in the play without teachers intervention. [pr3,14-3] They are the writers as well as actors. They use what they have learned from the unit and try to make the play as vivid and real as possible.  General[wd2,0-1] speaking, CECL is an unique course in which  [np6,0-2] teacher and students play equal roles. [sn9,-] Students volutarily [fm1,-] take part in the activities and  there fore [fm2,-] master the knowledge more effectively . There is no doubt that our life is colorful . But it does not exclude boredom, an in dispensible [fm2,-]  element without [pr5,3-10] whose contrast [wd7,3-9]  life would no longer appears so interesting and wonderful . What is boredom then? It is a dull, uninteresting tedious feeling people have when they have nothing to do or are not interested in doing the things at hand. Students often suffer from boredom, when they lose their earings [fm1,-] or have no interests in study. Hollowness and impatience often occupy their  [np6,1-1] heart and has  [np7, 1-1] a effect on their further studies. Hobby and different hings[fm1,-] they take up [sn8,s]. Attending class may be dull , because some of the knowledge is losing its attraction, and the way in which some teacher lecture [vp3,2-3] bores the listeners. Students in our class all agree that The Construction of Socialism is boring, not at all because we have anti-government idea or we dislike the idea. The teacher will simply stand at the platform, reading at the top of his voice the sentences which we can find in the text book [fm2,-]. What use does his lecture have while we have eyes to read the textbook ourselves?" How boreing[fm1,-] it is!" is the concensus [fm1,-]  we get after each class. Boredom is a company not only to students but also to those who work and don't work. It seems   contra[fm2,-] dictary at the first sight. But if we know that monotony and repetition are often the featlres [wd7,3-2] of work, it is not difficult to see that even you have something to do at hand. You may still feel bored. It is how I felt when I went to the Trade Fair a few weeks ago. When there were few customers we did nothing but talk or go round and round. This let's-sit-here-and-talk-to-kill-the-time pattern bored me a lot and I was tired and uninterested in anything. Boredom is a common disease in the souety [fm1,-], but not an incurable one. The best way to frive [fm1,-] it away is to find something which is really of your interest, do it and enjoy it. This is a funny experience I will never forget. One day, with 20 yuan in my trousers' pocket I went to downtown area with a friend. The No. 36 bus we took was crowded .we got on and stood near the door . a [fm3,-] young man was standing behind me ,one hand taking hold of the iron bar overhead .  as[fm3,-] the bus picked up more passengers along its route, I began worrying about thieves.  luckily[fm3,-] I had never met them, though I often heard about their "good deeds " on buses . so [fm3,-]consciously, but pretending to be carelessly , I touched my pocket. The money was there,  save[fm1,-] and sound .  several [fm3,-]minutes later, I was aware that a woman was looking at me strangely, her face wearing an expression that I couldn't fully explain. Just then, I felt there was a slight touch of my pocket, as if something was moving inside [sn9,-]  I looked down to find the money was somehow drawn out and was about to fall to the floor [sn9,-]  I could hear my heart beat faster than ever, knowing clearly that I had become a bait of a thief. Hurriedly I pushed the money back, turned suddenly back and faced the young man behind me. Obviously he didn't expect that would happen .  [fm3,-] he was quite uncomfortable [fm1,-]  under my staring and hastily looked away.         "well," I said in a low voice, "didn't get it , Eh?" my words took him by surprise. Perhaps he had wanted me to keep silent or abuse him loudly and get beaten. But I was not trapped [sn9,-] [fm3,-] my friendly manner made him [wd4,5-3]  at a loss. "um um, " he made his head move up and down, and squeazed [fm1,-] a smile on his face . "It is really bad luck, isn't it ?" I asked him, nearly jokingly. He was not that nervous , but was still embarrassed to be  [fm1,-] caugh red-handed. " [fm3,-] hope you good luck next time," I said and  [vp6,3-0] smile. " [fm3,-] thank you ."  [fm3,-] he was almost grateful at my words and even friendly patted my shoulder.  [fm3,-] as the bus stopped, I jumped off, and could [wd7,2-8] at wait to tell my friend all about it . " [fm3,-] you must be  [fm1,-] crasy," she said, " aren't you afraid that he would stab you ?"  [fm3,-] no, I was not [sn9,-]   [fm3,-] it was a strange but true experience. I was surprised why my heart was not at my throat when I spoke to the man and I still do not know now.  [fm3,-] perhaps he was not a bad guy at all and perhaps in his eye ,I was still a  [fm1,-] na* ve [fm1,-]but daring little girl. [sn9,-] 

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                          Study Problems      Two years' studing [fm2,-]  in the university tells me that the studying in university is totally different from that in middle school. The study problems take on a new look before us. So finding a way to solve the problems is especially important for us.      When we were in middle school, teachers cared about everything of [pp1,3-1]  us. They not only taught us knowledge [cc3,2-] , but also kept inspiring us and supervised [vp5,4-1]  us as much as possible. From 7 a.m to 8 p.m, we stayed at school, together with our teachers. But now except when it is in class, we practically can't see our teachers.  This is the study in college.  It depends more and more on ourselves. Teachers only teach us knowledge [cc3,2-] .  Therefore, problems of studying come into sight. Firstly, we don't know how to arrange the time. There is a lot of free time in college. We, of course, won't spend all of them [pr1,14-]  on study; Secondly [fm3,-] , we don't know where we can place emphasis on [pr1,8-] ,the compulsory courses or the courses we're interested in; Lastly [fm3,-] , we don't know how to put what we learn in class into practice. Our practical skill is terribly poor.    After two years, we all find our ways. The college life has a very clear[cc4,-] frame. What we should do is to fill up the frame. Problems can't frighten us. The key point is whether we can find the way to solve them.  In university, we, of course, should pay much attention to our study, but at the same time, we'd better do some part-time jobs to make up for what we can't learn in class. And also we should communicate with our teachers actively. Let our teachers help us to solve the study problems. We believe we all have the ability to face the study problems in university.

Many thanks for your prompt attention to my reguest [fm1,-] Yours Sincerely [fm3,-] , Robert Lee  

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>
Patriotism    This is an event nearly every Chinese mailand [fm1,-]  people and Hong Kong people alike have been  awaiting with massive [cc4,-1]  excitement and great expectation -- the reunification of Hong Kong to China.  It is a moment of celebration, proud [wd2,4-1] , anticipation and above all, the most telling moment of patriotism which is deep in our heart [np6,1-] .  And this moment is 1997, arriving in several hours from now, as we are approaching July 1st.     Patriotism, which is something beyond words, is what people of different nationalities share universally, and is also a blessing for every nation.  To people, on numerous occasions, it is a mighty momentom [fm1,-] , spurring us to implement [cc3,-4]  the most formidable tasks which would have been impossible otherwise. In [np7,-2]  Olympic Games, you can not only feel the touching emotion of patriotism, but also come face to face with it: you see how athletes surmount the various "hurdles" with applaudible [fm1,-] stamina and most important, fortitude, whose sourse [fm1,-]  is exactly their love of their country; you see athletes fall from illness but stand up to their task even with a dripping; you see athletes stumble to the ground but climb up and go ahead; you also see champions cry movedly [fm1,-]  when  their national flag rising [vp4,4-1]  proudly.  At such [np7,1-1]  moment, they are no longer themselves, rather, their country and their people who also embrace the same burning patriotism and back them all the time.  Outside the stadium, patriotism draws people to TV, newspaper [np6,5-] , focusing on what's going on in the games; even they would fly to the spot somewhere far far away from their home [np6,12-] .  They care for nothing but their country.  We Chinese always take pride in our patriotism.  With it, not only have we weathered untold defeats, shame, poverty, natural disasters, political strife, financial crisis, but also we are building [vp1,-3]  up our country industriously and hopefully.  The recent years have witnessed the prosperity in our economics [wd3,3-] , advancement in education, improvement in diplomacy ... .  We owe all our delighting and impressive achievements to our leadership, to our people's efforts, to international aids and above all to the profound patriotism in everyone of us.  In this sense, patriotism means a lot to a nation especially to such a big country as China which was burdened with myriad historic wounds and is expecting countless obstacles and challenges to come.  To a country, Patriotism [fm3,-]  means cohesiveness [wd3,2-] .  Cohesiveness [wd3,-2]  means omnipotence,  With it, we are fearless. The story of Hong Kong tells much of this.  People of the same nationality and therefore possessing the same ardent patriotism want to be united together and have to be together.  With this in mind, we have been making [vp2,-2]  our utmost to negotiate and eventually reach an agreement on the issue of Hong Kong territory with [np7,-2]  British governement [fm1,-]  but for [pp1,15-3]  all the barriers.    It is a dream to come true.  This dream has been both long [wd3,5-]  and hard [wd3,7-]  for us, while, in the end, the reality in the wake of the dream is sure to be promising and encouraging.  With the same patriotism in mind, we're to live up to our designated aims ahead -- to embrace HongKong [fm3,-]  and still to come, Macao and Taiwan and to better an integret [fm1,-]  China all the time.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                                   Study Problems     To students, there are many many study problems which are indeed bewildering in the course of their studies.  Some of the troubled students know what their own study problems are, but they don't know in what way they can handle them.    In order to pass examinations, students should remember many datum [np6,1-4] , events, and new words.  Most of the students can remember them only in a few hours.  However, they will forget most things they recite the next day.  This is an ordinary problem in our studies.  In this case, we'd better recite those specific and limited [wd3,6-1]  things not in one day but in many separate days.  We can remember a little each day so that we are able to turn them over in our mind [np6,2-]  and we can remember them clearly afterwards.  Some college students are buffled [fm1,-]  by the question of which optional courses they should take.  There are a lot of optional courses they can take, but they don't know which is the best and most benefitial [fm1,-] . In my opinion, we'd better take the courses which are related to our major, because we can make progress in our major in this way. Of course, we  should consider if it is interesting or enlightening.  If not but we take it [sn2,6-s] , we will not continue the study or study it unwillingly.     What I mentioned above are just the most ordinary problems in students' studies.  There are also many other problems, such as having difficulty in listening English [wd5,4-] , doing experiments with difficuty [fm1,-]  and so on.  However, if we analysis [wd2,2-2]  these problems carefully, we will find the solution and conquer them and we will make much progress during the course of solving these problems.

<ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                                   Study Problems    As a [np7,-3]  English major student [wd5,2-] , the main study problems to me maybe are [vp9,6-4]  different from other majors.  Learning English mostly depends on daily listening, speaking and writing, so I am weak in these aspects.    Listening class is my favourist [fm1,-]  class.  I can always get a good sleep in the class. Not because of the teacher's fault, but because the V.O.A or BBC's tone makes me feel sleepy. The text book [fm2,-]  is acceptable, but sometimes I cannot catch even  a  word if the speaker says [wd3,3-3]  a little quickly.  I like speaking more than listening, but it is still y weakness. When I have [np7,3-3]  oral English class  and have a talk with my foreign teacher, I find it is difficult to have me understood entirely.  With some kind of body language or illusions [wd3,7-] , both [wd4,1-1]  us can understand each other. Writing is our basic skill.  But even as a senior student. I cannot write a satifying [fm1,-]  essay.  In a no-more-than 200-word essay, there are full of either grammar or spelling mistakes and teacher's red crosses. [sn8,s]   Sometimes there is a good idea striking me, but I can't express it out [wd5,4-]  with words.    I am very anxious about my study problems.  I am trying to listen more, speak more and write more.  I should recite more words too.  Without a great amount  of vocabulary, how can I make progress in my study?

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                                           Study Problems   There is an old Chinese saying: "Keep studying until you die." I quite appreciate it. But what troubles me most is also study. Study goes, problem goes.   What I focus on, of course, is my majoy [fm1,-] ---English.  Commonly, English contains three fators [fm1,-] ---Speaking [fm3,-]  , Listening [fm3,-]  and writing. Firstly, I don't have the environment to improve my English. Most of the time, I speak Chinese with my classmates. Only in class or at English corner I just get the chance to speak English. However, it's far from enough.  But if I kept speaking English to everyone, others may [vp8,9-3]  laugh at me and think I'm a queer fish!  Similarly, I speak Chinese all the time and I listen to it all the time. This makes my listening rather weak. Although I train myself through other ways, the reality of my listening is still disappointing me. Comparing [vp5,-6]  with other two factors, writing seems to require less objective elements. Therefore I just read a lot and memorize words, paterns [fm1,-] , [wd4,2-1] expressions. I don't know if forgetting is a natural phenomenon, if it is, I do [wd3,13-]  and I include it as one problem. [sn1,s] I also have problems in my non-English courses. I think some of these subjects are useful and practical---like Chinese, Study of life, etc., however, some are just compulsory and useless. [sn1,s]They sometimes become burdens of my study. In short, some of the problems can be overcome subject to my greater efforts. Some of them need all the students of English and the Institute to settle together. If we are cooperative and build an English World with our two hands, I think all the students will make a great success in English study.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC ><TYP 1>                                                                                           Study Problems   Having been studying for 14 years, I still find that many study problems are hard to solve [vp7,7-] .  The most common ones I've encountered are unable to concentrate in class, having no time practising by myself and hard to communicate with others. [sn8,s]   Class [wd3,-6]  is the original source of knowledge when [np7,1-7]  teacher tells whatever he knows to us. But I find I am unable to focus on  him especially for the most boring part, which is usually the most practical part. I've tried in vain to restrict myself to listen to him to the word [wd5,5-3]  for several times. So sometimes I think it's high time he changed his way of teaching so as to make the class attracting [wd3,3-4]  to most of us. Then the spare time. [sn2, s-]  As a sophomore I have much more spare time now, but in fact, I still cannot find sufficient time to practise what I learn.  There are too many activities and lectures that the school authority required [vp6,11-5]  us to take part in.  I wonder when we can select those activities and lectures by ourselves.  Lastly, the communication. [sn2,s-] As we know, study is a process of communicating [wd3,5-] .  In this process, we exchange what we have for what others don't, and therefore make mutual progress. This is  essential either for our studies or for the teaching of a whole school. But except we communicated privately in small group, I rarely had chances to participate in such activities between colleges during the past two years . [sn8,s]    In short, those problems mentioned do harm to our studies and we should try to overcome them. But we cannot accomplish the task alone. With the help of our teachers and the school authority, I'm sure we can make it and furthermore obtain [cc3, -3]  a mutual improvement.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                                                Study Problems   In mountain-climbing, man has to overcome untold difficulties before he reaches the top. In study, a student has to solve endless problems until he finds the right way to learn. In my opinion the fundemantle [fm1,-]  problems in study are two: lack of interest and lack of persistence.  Some students consider study as a [wd5,3-3]  painstaking work all because they don't care for the things they learn. We can always find a student doing well in maths while being poor at English. But once this student interests [vp1,3-2]  in English, he will [wd4,2-3]  eager to learn. Interest is the best guide. Persistence is also an important factor in study.  No man [wd3,1-8]  in the world can gain all the knowledge over-night.  All we can do is to accumulate it little by little and review it period after period. [np1,2-] Some students are quick at learning but they learn too fast therefore they keep forgetting. So they would complain [vp1,2-4]  the hardship of study and name it a problem. The solutions to the study problems are fights against the brain. [cc3,3-]The brain refuses to take in dull information, and it keeps forgetting things. But the willpower is the fatal weapon to conquer its laziness. Where there is a will, there is a way.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                       Means of Transportation in My City   All kinds of means of transportation are used in my city -- Guangzhou, including bycical [fm1,-] , bus, taxi, train, airplane ect [fm1,-] .  Both natives and travelers have many choices as to means of transportations [np5,2-]  in Guangzhou.   Taking bus is many people's choice. Workers, students, and travelers also like to take [wd4,1-1]  bus, for taking bus is very cheap and convinient [fm1,-] , with substaintal [fm1,-]  [wd3,1-1]  buses available.  But the biggest shortcoming is its slowliness [fm1,-]. Very often, at rash [fm1,-] hour, you may hit traffic jams. The other important means is bycical [fm1,-] .  China is well known as the "kingdom of bycical [fm1,-] ."  So in Guangzhou, everywhere is packed with bycicals [fm1,-] .  People cycle to work, to school, to shopping. [sn8,s] However, bycicals [fm1,-]  are easy to be stolen.  Many people like to take [wd4,1-1]  taxi, the most fast [aj3,3-]  means in the city, but you have to have enough money and be cautions [wd2,1-3]  with the meter, for some drivers are not honest. To travel out of the city, certaily [fm1,-] ,  the best way is by plane. It's a comfortable, luxious [fm1,-]  enjoyment[cc1,-2] of traveling. However, most people travel by train, which is economical, fast, and safe. Trains directing [wd3,1-6]  to every big city of China are available here.  Throughout the year, the railway stations are full of travellers. One warning to travellers is that you have to be careful of your purses and luggiges [fm1,-] , for thieves are in large quantity [wd3,4-3]  at the station.   On the whole, Guangzhong's transportation is rather convinent [fm1,-] , but because of the large number of people and narrow streets, it is still a problem at [pp1,-3]  the government's agenda.  New means, for example undergrounds, is [vp3,5-]  being added and broad roads are being built.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 2>                                                                    Means of transportation [fm3,-]  in My City   In my city Guangzhou there are many means of  transportation, such as bikes, buses, taxies, ships, subway trains [wd5,1-] , trains and planes, so it is quite convenient to go anywhere.  Transportation is one of the important factors in a city.  As our former mayal [fm1,-]  said , "Only when there are excellent means of transportations [np6,2-] , Guangzhou can be developed into a modernized city."    Until now, bicycles are still the major means of transportation in Guangzhou.  Riding a bike is not only saving one's time but also practising [cc3,-2]one's body.  Moreover, bicycles are convenient to go across narrow streets, which other means of transportation can't do.  Next, Buses [fm3,-]  and taxies are also very popular in my city.  They are not expensive and are quite suitable for these [pr2,4-8]   who don't like to walk or ride bicycles.  When we are not in a hurry, and when you [pr3,9-4]  don't want to take in the polluted air filling [wd5,3-3]  in the city, we'd better choose ships as a mean [wd3,1-2]  of transportation.  Standing on the deck, with the breeze stroking your face, won't you feel relaxed and refreshing [vp5,5-] ?  The holiday's coming.  If you want to go to other provinces or even go abroad, trains and aeroplanes are the right choice [np6,6-] .  Nowadays trains and planes have first-class equipment and good services.  Some of the planes even have televisions with different channels for you to choose.  Finally, there is magnificant [fm1,-]  [wd3,-1]  news in recent days.  That is our subway trains [wd5,1-]  being put in use.  That will add to the convenience of Guangzhou's transportation in the future.    When I [wd4,2-2]  walking along the streets or roads, seeing different means of transportation playing a more and more significant role, not matter on the road, in the sky or under our city, I always feel proud of my city.  Furthermore, I am looking forward to the beautiful future.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>           Means of Transportation in China     The condition of trasportation [fm1,-]  in China has been greatly improved in order to meet the demands of the rapid economic progress and the expanding population.  The number of vehicles has sharply increased, and at the same time, more and more roads, railways, airports [sn9,-]  etc. are being built up [wd5,8-] .The means of transportation varies plentifully [wd3,5-] , offering quick and confortable [fm1,-]  transportation to the people.     Amony [fm1,-]  those means of transportation, vehicles are most popular in short distance transportation.  As you can see, there are massive [wd3,2-3]  buses and taxis which can take you to every corner [wd3,6-3]  in our city in a short time.  Meanwhile, more and more cars or other kinds of vehicles are privately owned by many richer people, which adds to the number of the vehicles.  However, bicycles are by no means obsolete while most of the people are not rich or try to avoid traffic jam.  Travelling by train is always adopted [wd3,5-]  when people travel farther [wd3,3-] , so railways develop fastest.  Travelling by train is comparatively cheap, quick and comfortable.  And trains can carry goods  on [np7,1-2]  large scale.  So travelling by train is the major means in long distance transportation.  Nowadays, travelling by plane is no longer a dream to many people whilst our economic [wd5,1-5]  income increases gradually and steadily.  It is the quickest and the most comfortable way of travelling.  And it will be prevalent in the near future.  Of all the means of transportation, travelling by ship is the most slowest [aj3,2-] , but ships can carry a very large number [wd3,3-2]  of goods and cover a very long distance in a long period, so ships are usually used in commercial delivery, especially in  overseas delivery.     In short, transportation has developed greatly and will make more progress.  At present in China, anyone can have a good trip by selecting an appropriate means of transportation and enjoy himself.

<ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1> Means of Transportation in My City     When asked what is my city famous for, I am always blurting [vp6,15-]  out:  Bicycle!  It is true that nowadays in my city many bus routes have been opened up.  But still, people in my city prefer [vp2,4-4]  bicycles rather than buses.     There are several reasons leading people to chose [fm2,-]  bicycles as their main means of transportation.  First, riding bicycles  offers people a great degree of freedom and independence.  With it, they can go anywhere at any time.  Second, to some people, especially to us students, it is an economical alternative to the bus whose fares have kept rising five times running in recent year.  Third, most people just want to stay away from the traffic jam [np6,11-] .  The disturbing situation in my city is that just a few efficient buses have been put into service on the one hand [sn9,-]  the number of broad roads is extremely limited on the other.  Before the bus comes, a lot of people are queuing for it.  When the bus comes, people tend to fight around [wd3,2-]  and get the narrow escape  from the crowd and eventually get on the bus which has always crowded [vp7,4-]  like a satine [fm1,-]  can.  Even though you are lucky enough to board on [wd5,1-2]  the bus, it often takes ages for the bus to arrive at your destination, for the bus are vp3,2-2]  very inefficient and the operation of the road almost come [vp3,6-3]  to a standstill.  It's the serious problem that underlies the people's lack of interest in taking buses.    My city is famous for bicycle, however, I am no [wd3,2-5]  so pround  [fm1,-]  of this fame.  The government of the city has being taken [vp7,7-6]  measures to improve the traffic situation and the constructions of new road are underway.  I really hope that buses and cars will be the new means of transportation in the near future.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>            Means of Transportation in Guangzhou          Since Guangzhou is an over-populated city, its daily transportation has been a great social problem for years.  Nowadays, with  various means of transportation available, this problem appears to be improved.     First, bicycles are the main means of transportation in people's daily life in Guangzhou.  It is estimated that every family in Guangzhou have an average of two or three bicycles.  Because bicycles are inexpensive and take up not much room, they are quite convenient and become the most popular means of transportation among people.  Second, buses are the second widely used means of transportation in Guangzhou.  Some people's homes are too far away from their working places for them to ride a bicycle, so they choose to take buses everyday.  In addition, buses are faster than bicycles and sitting in a bus is more comfortable than riding a bicycle in the changeable weather in Guangzhou. Third, taxis and cars are also one of the means of transportation in Guangzhou, but  are  not so popular as bicycles and buses, mainly because of its expensive costs.  Moreover, to own a car is not practical in Guangzhou, such a over-populated city.  Fourth, the subway is not so popular a means of transportation as in other big cities like Beijing and Shanghai.   But I believe that with its commonization [fm1,-]  in the future, it will be of great convenience for the people in Guangzhou and should be the most effective solution to the heavy traffic problem.      Although our city is over-populated, with the above [wd3,2-3] means of transportation people will still find it convenient to go to their destination [np6,10-]  in daily life.  I hope with the development of economy and technology our problem of the transportation will be completely and perfectly solved in the near future.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                         Means of Transportation in China    With the development of economy, transportation has become a more and more important problem in China.  Transportation is also a big problem which has close relationship with people's life.  In the following I'd like to talk about the five most popular transportaters [fm1,-]  in China, they are bicycles, buses, trains, ships and planes.   Firstly, bicycles.  Most foreigners who come to China were [vp6,6-2]  always shocked at the first sight of so many bicycles in our streets.  To most Chinese people bicycles are the most popular  and useful transportater [fm1,-]  in their daily lives. Wherever [wd3,-6]  go to school, work or do some shopping they always ride a bicycle. [sn8,s]   China has so many bicycles that it is called "the empire of bicycles"; [sn9,-]  Secondly, buses.  Buses are also an important transportater [fm1,-]  Chinese people use in their daily lives. I think the situation of bus-taking has been greatly improved in China, especially in some big cities. And now many small towns also have buses, which is a great convenience to residents there. Thirdly, trains.  Many students who come from other provinces or other cities in our university take trains when they go back home. Trains maybe are the most popular transportater [fm1,-]  in the long-distance trip.  Because it [pr1,12-]  doesn't cost too much and is very convenient to take. [sn2,s-]  Now the speed of all the trains in China has been increased and many short-distance routes have been concealed [wd3,5-6]  in order to attract more train-takers. Fouthly [fm1,-] ,ships. I think not many people in China will choose ships when they have other choices, such as trains or planes.  Except in some particular conditions such as travelling on the Changjiang River. [sn2,s-]   Finally, planes.  Because of the high costs, not many people in China take planes. But I must say now more and more people take planes on their trips.  I believe planes will become the most popular transportater [fm1,-]  in the future, providing [wd3,-8]  people can pay the prices [wd3,2-3]  of the tickets.    Of course there are other transportaters [fm1,-]  which are popular in Chinese people's daily life, such as motobicycles [fm1,-] , cars, etc.  But I think the above-mentioned five transportaters [fm1,-]  are the most important and popular.  People can't live without them. This is the point.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                         Means of Transportation in Guangzhou     Compared with some other modern city [np6,5-2]  in China, Guangzhou is not large.  But the transportation is most busy [aj3,1-] .  As the city develops, various means of transportation appear and benefit us a lot.     Traditionally, bike [np6,-6]  and motorcycle [np6,2-4]  are two main transportators [fm1,-]  to most residents.  Without waiting for buses and rushing, people can ride their "iron horse [np6,5-] " to works [vp5,5-] .  As the scale of the city extents [wd3,6-] , more and more buses are put into running [wd3,5-] .  Besides, many people become rich enough to buy their own cars.  wd4,-6]  Automobile gradually takes the place of "iron horse". Nowadays, we can see people taking clean buses or driving private owned [wd5,1-1]  cars with air condition [wd3,3-]  everywhere.  But pollution and transportion [fm1,-]  order remain two big problems.     However, Guangzhou's underground has been built to serve people this year.  Those who live in Fangchun district [fm3,-]  or Tianhe district [fm3,-]  are no longer worried about transportation.  The future buildings on the ground will be arranged reasonably.  Further more [fm2,-]  the waste gas given off by automobiles will be lessened.  This means of transportation is of great importance in Guangzhou's modernization.   Looking back upon our transportation in the past fifteen years, we can also see the changes of Guangzhou.  I think the abundant means of transportation represent the rapid progress of a modern city.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1> Means of Transportation in China     China is world-wide [fm2,-]  known for her large population and vast land.  Therefore, transportation becomes one of the most important and serious issue [np6,7-]  about which people are concerned a lot.  Generally speaking, there are three means of transportation in China presently: by air, by water or on the land.  All of them have their own advantages and disadvantages [sn9,-]  which offer you a variety of choices.     By air, that is by plane, is the quickest, the most comfortable and convenient way.  You can sit watching TV, reading magazines or enjoying the beautiful view below you and arrive at you [pr4,2-1]  destination fresh and comfortable.  But the only problem is the expense.  It is expensive for  some Chinese.  Travelling on the ships in the river or on the sea is a longer journey.  You can meet interesting people to talk with and enjoy the various entertainments on the ship.  First of all, you must make sure you will not get seasick before you mount [cc3,-2]  the ship.  There are different ways for you to travel on the land.  You can travel by train, bus, taxi, bicycle and even on foot.  It is good for shorter journey and you can stop wherever you want.  There are other interesting and special means of transportation remained [wd5,9-2]  in China.  In my hometown, there is [np7,2-2]  two-horse carriage, [sn9,-] In Chaozhou, there is [np7,2-1]  rickshaw, in which you can travel around the city.  Now in Guangzhou, the first stretch of underground railway has been used [wd3,8-]  recently.    Our country provides [vp1,-5]  us a variety of choices to transport ourselves.  With the development of science and technology, I believe people in China will travel with ease and convenience in the future.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                    Patriotism    Tomorrow, July 1st, 1997 is the day on which our country will restore HongKong [fm3,-]  to herself. Patriotism is Natalie a good feeling.  People all [wd4,2-2]  the world are pround [fm1,-]  of their own countries, whether they're richer than others or not.  As natives, we grew up in our motherland and the care of the people of our country.  What we should do is reward [wd3,5-] . In [np7,1-1]  history we know millions of people, Chinese or foreigners, devoted themselves to their motherlands, [sn9,-]  today, we can see so many people work hard for their countries.  All the ceremonies  and all the celebrations for HongKong's [fm3,-]  coming back in all the days are the best proof.  We should have patriotism without any doubt.    But patriotism doesn't mean keeping all the foreign things out. We have patriotism and we all hope we will have a strong motherland. We should understand our country needs development. So we need advanced equipments [np5,4-]  and experience to help us. Today's world is an "open" world, [sn9,-]  international mmunity [fm1,-]  is common.  If we want to have a strong motherland we can't refuse good foreign things. Our patriotism should be showed [fm3,-]  in a correct direction.   As Chinese, we are proud of our country.  The way we show our patriotism is to welcome everything benefit [wd2,3-]  to make our country strong.

<ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                Modernization in China      Changes taken [vp7,1-6]  place in this big Modernization Time seems  [vp3,8-]  to me as totally amazing.  The Modernization no longer stays [wd3,4-4]  barely on simple objects as industry, agriculture, defence, which originally are [vp6,5-4]  designed by our leaders; it extends to almost every part of our lives.    Modernization of our material world is easily seen: tremendous skyscrapers stand everywhere in big cities, confining our sights in a narrow sky; hundreds of motor-cycle [np6,2-]  block our way, leaving toxic gas all the way round; black rivers flow silently with all kinds of garbage  floating on it [pr1, 11-] , giving off terrible smell which reminds us of dead cats.  Modernization fills our pockets with money; however, it also somewhat ruined our lives.  Actually, these damages caused to our living enviroment [fm1,-]  are not the worst; what surprises e most is the 'bad modernization' of our mind.  Cheating, sex, murder, violence are filled [vp7,4-1]  everywhere, it might easily destroy your weak mind and your innocent children.  The most common thing, also the worst, is the indifference of us: we don't care about anybody; we only love ourselves.  We see people robbed, staged, lying dead on the street -- we just walk on, feeling nothing.    Modernization brings us material richness, changes our old cities into a new modern face [wd3,8-]  and makes our country more and more powerful -- all these are good -- diversely [wd3, 4-5]  it also pollutes our world, corrupts our mind [np6,1-]  and ruins our lives.  It is time for us to face up with the dark side of the Big Modernization.

<ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                              Modernization in China    Modernization is China's only road to progress, which has been proved with the changes of China.  In the past China was  so poor that people couldn't get enough food and the industry was almost broken down.  Now Chinese people all get enough food and various kinds of industrial departments [wd3,12-3]  are set up.  China has been on the road to progress.    Modernization has done great benefits to China.  First, through modernization China put [vp6,3-6]  out better industrial and consumer products.  Second, new roads, trucks and trains has [vp3,5-]  been put up [wd3,7-]  for the [wd5,6-2]  better transportation.  Last, China has provided people with new health care methods.       However, there are some problems caused by modernization.  As more factories have been put up, they send out poisonous gases, garbage, dirty water into the air and the rivers.  So people are faced with serious air pollution and water pollution. With the development of cities, more and more cars appear, and this causes traffic accidents and deaths.  These problems really cause a lot of troubles and misfortunes to our society.  Fortunately, our government has made steps to solve these problems.  The safe traffic regulations, the environment protect laws [wd3,3-]  and educational programs are done [cc3,10-]  to solve them and has [vp3,14-]  been in effect.     Conclusion: Modernization has made today's China more and more powerful and prosperous in spite of the problems which are unavoidable.  Modernization is the future of China -- A road of no return.

<ST 5><SEX 1><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                  Patriotism     Patriotism means the love of one's country, and to do many deeds which can bring benefits to the people. [sn6,s-]   The effect of patriotism is very great  when it is exercised [fm1, -]  by all the people of a country.  It can make a country  strong, and her history glorious.  It can also improves [vp4,3-] a man's character and secure for him a wide spread fame.       If the people of a country are not patriotic, the country must be very weak.  History tells us how some countries of ancient time [np6,4-]  were, owing to a lack of patriotism, conquered by other peoples and how the peoples of the conquered countries were made slaves under the yoke of their victorious masters.  Lessons taught by the history have been well learnt in our country.  Patriotism is strong now because of the efforts of generations of patriots.  Seeing the return of Hongkong, we Chinese with patriotism is [vp3,4-]  feeling very proud.  The more patriotism we have, the stronger the country will be.     In a word, to love our country, to work hard to make her strong, to support her trusted government, to obey her laws, to pay fair taxes into her treasury, to treat our fellow citizens as we wish to be treated ourselves -- this is to be a real Chinese patriot.  We should learn from all patriots and love our country as much as we love ourselves.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 2>                                         Study Problems    As students, we meet with study problems almost everyday, I believe nowadays, study problems not only mean problems appearing in [np7,3-2]  study process but also indicate those in other aspects which even seemly [fm1,-]  have nothing to do with studies, such as the environment about you.     Usually, we think study problems are the problems we can't do [cc3,4-]  or have difficulties [np1,1-2]  to do [cc3,9-] .  n fact, this is one of the problems in our studies.  Relatively wd3,-5] ,it is easier to resolve [wd3,5-] .   What's more important and what we should be clear [aj2,-s]  is that there are many other elements which we easily neglect and which somewhat influence our studies. First, is interest. [sn8,s]   It is said that interest is the best guide to make [wd5,4-1]  success.  It is almost impossible for us to study something very well if we are not interested in it at all. For example, I have no interest in drawing, so I can't draw a simple thing well until now.  Second, is method. [sn8,s]   If we can keep a good method to study.  I belive [fm1,-]  our studies will be efficient. To us, the most important  and difficult thing is how to find a good  method.  This is also a problem.  My advice is to practice many kind [np6,1-]  of methods and to choose one which suit [vp3,3-]  us well.  Third, is aim. [sn8,s]   It is very dangerous if we have no aims.  Aims are like light which is far away from us and which spur [vp3,9-]  us to close [wd3,4-2]  to it. Without aim, [np6,1-3]  we will be like in [wd4,4-2] darkness and will not to know [vp4,3-3]  what to do.  Fourth, is insistence [wd3,2-] . [sn8,s]   Although we have interest, method and aims, if we are lacking in insistence [wd3,5-] , we can't reach our goal.  Insistence [wd3,-4]  is a mental [wd3, 3-1]  problem. It is very abstract. Whether we have insistence [wd3,3-]  or not only depend [vp3,5-2]  on ourselves.  Finally, is environment about us. [sn8,s]   For example, I like to listen to [np7,2-1]  music when I'm working.  Music can't produce negative effect on we, on the contrast, it can help me to finish my work well, But [fm3,-]  many other people do [wd3,4-1]  not. [sn1,s]    Difficult questions are study problems. [sn8,s]  Interest, method, aim, insistence [wd3,3-3]  and invironment [fm1,-]  are also study problems. If we treat all of them accurately [wd3,6-] , we can study well.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 2>                                        Study Problems    Students usually find various problems during their studying. To  the language learning students, for example, some meet the [wd5,2-2]  grammer [fm1,-]  problems; some have difficulty in speaking or listening; some others are not good at writing [np7,1-2]  foreign language. How to overcome these study problems is very important for students' learning.    Students who are not skillful at grammer [fm1,-]  have to practise a lot.  They have to read some grammer [fm1,-]  books, grasp the main regulations [wd3,7-]  and they also need to do quite [np7,-4]  amount of grammer [fm1,-]  exercises.  The students who find difficulty in speaking should always  speak out and find chance to speak with the native speakers so that they can forster [fm1,-]  the sense of language and know the latest use of the language.  Shyness is a bad [wd5,1-1]  enemy to the  students.  When one is always shy to speak loud [wd2,1-] , one's speaking skill will become worse and worse. Also, the students who are bad at listening have to listen to the tapes or radio programmes often.  While listening, one should try one's best to understand its meaning and it is better for them to imitate the speaker.  After practising again and again, one's language will become better and better.  The last group of students who find it hard to write a good essay in foreign language have to read some books about writing skills and always think [vp1,1-3]  the foreign language instead of thinking [vp1,1-3]  their native language.  Before writing an essay, one had better look through some models, in order to learn some good expressions or good structures of an essay.     In short, every student will encounter some study problems during their studying years, and the best way to overcome this [pr1,13-1]  problems is to practise a lot.  By and by, students can learn more skills of studing [fm2,-]  and the problems will become less and less [wd3,6-] .
