I should be great [wd2,3-1]  pleased to receive your prompt answer.                                                                  Yours sincerely,                                                                 Robert Lee  

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 20><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 2>                Study Problems    Although students have been studying all along in their previous time, most of them still meet with some problems in their study [np6,1-] .  To [pp2, -2]  my view, there are four main problems existing in the study.  First, the students lack interests in their study [np6,1-] .  Sometimes the  major courses they chose are not their favourite ones. They chose them, maybe, because of the fashion [wd3,7-]  or the wishes of their parents.  Thus, they study inactively and can't learn well.  If one can be interested in what he learns, he will be more positive and patient.  Second, the students are too shy and coward to ask questions which they have.  They think it's a shame to ask the teachers or classmates questions, especially in class and it indicates that they're stupid in front of the classmates.  But if the questions or problems can not be solved in time, they will accumulate more and more and the students will have more doubts in their study [np6,1-] .  Third, some students can't be engrossed in study. They  cannot concentrate their minds on the lessens [fm1,-]  in class which makes them hard to grasp the meaning of what the teachers say. [sn8,s]   Finally, some students are not painstaking enough. With the hope [np2,2-4]  to take part in the curricular   [wd3,8-8]  activities, they find that studying is very dull and boring.  So they give up studying but to play  [vp4,6-] , which wastes them a lot of time.    Of course, there are some other problems except [wd3,5-3]  these above mentioned [wd1,3-]  existing in students' studying.  In short, students should see and know the problems they meet with in study and then deal with them seriously.  Only in this way can they make some progress.

The third is that I become less interested in studying since some courses are rather boring.  I can hardly concentrate on the textbook while I am bored.  It really does harm to my studies.     I always ask myself: How can I solve these problems?  Never can I get the answer.  In my opinion, they are too common to solve; however, so long as I can arrange time correctly and force myself to study soul and heart [np2,3-] , I could make these problems less harmful to my studies.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 2>                                             Study Problems     Nowadys [fm1,-]  the strange and the new occur dayly [fm1,-] and monthly.  Accordingly, as human beings in the society, we can't stop studying the new knowledge [cc3,4-] , or we will not catch up with others and the society.     First, we should make our aim for studying clear.  Some people study just for [np7,1-2]  entrance examination. Some people study for [wd3,3-1]  study.  Some people study for their parents.  All of these are not good motivations which can spur us to study readily [wd3,6-] .  A good goal in studying is to improve our abilities and to adapt to the rapid-advancing [fm2,-]  society.  We can't study actively until we realize this point. Second, we should study to apply our knowledge but not just study.[sn,s].   There are enough examples which show some high-scored students turn out to be usefuless [fm2,-]  in practice.  On the contrary, some students with low score [np6,4-]  present their abilities in their work.  This fact demonstrates the score is not the only standard that classifies the [wd5,-2]  people's abilities. So we should focus our major energy in [wd3,4-]  learning how to apply our knowledge in stead of getting high mark [np6,9-]  in examination [np6,11-] .    In a word, as long as we study permanently [wd3,2-] , we can be winners in the world.  And if all the Chinese realize it, our country will become strong and rich soon.

Big theme needs more comprehension.      Overall, I prefer the learning way of this term to the way of last term, although it is really not an easy task for me to get over.  

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>               Mama, I Love You     The train bound for Guangzhou is rushing with [pp2,1-3]  a high speed.  Sitting in the train,  I stare at [pp1,1-10]  the window.   The view outside the window changes so fast that it becomes vague.  Vague, all become [vp3,1-1]  vague.  Only mother's figure, short, a little fat, standing alone on the platform and looks so weak from a far [cc4,2-1]  distance, is getting clearer and clearer.      A pop British band called "Spice Girl" has sung a song.  "Mama, I love you".  The song is released around Mother's Day, and many of my fellow students said they'd been moved by this special song.  But I can't see the differences between Spice girl's other pop works and this one.  I can't image how I can speak out these four words, facing my  mother.  Mother has never kissed me on the forehead to say good night, never fondled my head to have a heart-to-heart talk with me in whisper and never given me a hug to show she's unwilling to part with me.  She is only a plain middle-aged woman, fugal [fml1,-], hard-working, sometimes bad-tempered.      My first year in university has fled away with my connivance of [pp1,1-1]  myself, also with a high cost on diversion.  Mother is very anxious with the way I spend my money.    From the beginning of my summer holiday, she began to question me and check me.     "Why did you spend your money so quickly?"     "You must have gone out and hung around every weekend"  "You've never taken my words in, if you go on like this, I won't give you one more penny!"   Good heavens! I have tried my best to save every penny, only sometimes I can't resist the temptation of fashionable dress [np6,4-3]  and delicious food; and most diversion  [wd3,2-7] of my weekends is going to library.   Whereas [cj1,-s] , Mother won't believe in me.  The night at the end of the summer holiday, I slept with Mother.  In the darkness, Mother turned round, facing me.  I expected that she would say something with care and kindness.  Then, Mother spoke in a gentle voice.  "Irene, you should not spend your money...... " I almost screamed.   "Could you say something else?!"  I shouted, covering my head with the quilt.     Returning to school, the awful memory about money has nearly faded away.  At a dusk, I received the phonecall [fml2, -] from Mother.  When I picked up the phone, the first sound was her rough scolding.  "Where have you hung [vp6,3-4]  out all these days?!" "Take care of your money, remember what I have told you! "  Even not a word  mentioning my study, my daily life.  Diving [wd3,-7] from my domitary [fm1,-]  on the third floor, I was exciting [vp5,2-6]  and eager to hear Mother's voice. But now, all have [vp3,1-3]  been cooled [vp7,3-1]  down.  My heart sank to below zero degree in Mother's scolding.  I couldn't say and didn't want to say anything, just listened, then put down the receiver. That night, I wrote a letter to Mother desperately, saying she concerned only money, but not me .     Mid-Autumn [fm3,-]  Festival past  [wd2,2-] without Mother's phonecall [fml2,-]. Following [wd3,-4]  comes the National Day.  I've written to Mother to tell her that I will be back in the vacation.  But until the night before the National Day,  I haven't got the ticket yet.  Cannot [wd3,-10]  decide wheather [fml1,-] to go or to stay, I phoned Mother.   In my anxiety, the wire past [wd2,2-3]   Mother's cheerful voice  onto [pp1,4-2]  my ear. "Irene, where are you? I have cooked a big jar of soup, waiting for you. You've mentioned in your letter that you will be back today, right?  What's going on?"     "It's too bad.  I can't get the ticket.  Do you want me to  back home, Mama?"     "Want you to back [wd2,3-1]  home?  It's up to you.  I've kept many mooncakes, your most [wd5,-2]  favourite ones. If you don't come back, nobody can eat them up."     This is the way that [wd3,4-5]  my mother shows her feelings, using the most casual words to express her deepest hope:[sn9,-]   A warm stream flew into my heart.  Mother wasn't angry with me, although she had received the letter which I'd regretted delivering.  Just at that moment, the desire of going home became so strong that I  thought I must go home, no matter what kind of trouble I might come across.     "Well, Mama, one of my classmates wants to travel in our hometown, perhaps she will go home with me..."      "Oh, that's great! Don't worry, I'll prepare everything for you."     The next day, my friend and I struggled in the crowd at Guangzhou railway [fm3,-]  station [fm3,-] , fought our ways to get on the train, suffered four  hours of standing in the packed train and got off at Lechang  railway [fm3,-]  station [fm3,-]  in the end.  I don't know  how to describe my complex feelings as I saw mother [fm3,-] ,it is a mixture of pride, happiness, relaxation and exhaustion. [sn1,s] In the  following days, Mother cooked all kinds of delicious food for us, instructed us about the travelling route and bought daily necessities for me to bring back to school.  It was in late autumn,  but when I got up one morning, mother [fm3,-]  was carrying a big watermelon back home.  "Very fresh!" she said, with sweat on her forehead.  Mother enjoys singing Karaoka [fm1,-] , it surprised me that she seldom sang when we were in relative's home. She always asked me to sing with my cousin.  Once when I was singing, I happened to turn round and caught sight of my mother, who sat quietly far away from us, narrowing her eyes and staring at the screen because of farsightedness,  her wrinkled face disclosing her tiredness.  Suddenly, tears rushed to my eyes.  Mother is not young any more. The suffering in life has robbed her of health, comfort and happiness.  And I, is [vp3,1-4]  all of her hope and the one she cares most. However, when my vacation is over, mother will  be lonely again.     The train is rushing on, carrying me away from home farther and farther.  I can't control myself  any more.  Burying my head in arms, I let the streams of tears crawl over my cheek [np6,9-] .  Spice Girl's song is aroused [wd3,4-3]  in my heart.  "Mama, I love you. Mama, I care..."  It is such a beatiful [fm1,-]  song.  I know, from now on, my heart will never be apart with Mother's.      

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>                  The Final Words of the Defense Lawyer Your Excellency,    In my conclusive announcement [wd3,3-s] , I'd like to appeal to you to make a verdict [np1,1-6]  that the boy is not guilty.  Following [np7,-9]  is the reasonable doubt which shows the boy innocent.     Let's start with the evidence -- the switch knife, which is stabbed into the boy's father's chest.  According to Juror No. 8's proof, the strange switch knife can be bought in a little junk shop in the boy's neighbourhood.  It is not the only one which is sold in the neighbourhood store.  As to the downward angle of the stab wound, it is not strong enough to prove that the boy has done  it.  As we know, the boy is raised in a slum and he was even picked up for knife fighting, so he is experienced on [pp1,1-2]  using knife [np7,2-] .  However, anyone who's ever used a switch knife will use it underhanded, but not stab downward.      And secondly, there is something out of logic with the old man's testimony.  The old man said he had heard the boy scream out "I'm going to kill you", and the sound of a body falling a second later.  But the EL gives out awful noises [np5,5-]  when it goes by, how can the old man hear the words?  The old man's testimony also conflicts with the woman's testimony, on the point of the time the murder occuring [fm1,-] [sn7,5-]  .  According to the woman's evidence, she saw the murder through the window of the EL's last two cars, that means the EL shall go by the old man's window for at least six seconds  before the body fell, but the old man said he heard the body fall a second after the boy's words -- if he really had heard the boy's words, he shall hear [vp8,10-1]  it before the EL goes [vp6,15-1]  by.  Moreover, there are some doubts on the boy's words "I'm going to kill you", according to the old man's testimony.  Since the boy is not well-educated,  it is impossible for him to shout out a standard English sentence at the emotional time,if a person really wants to kill someone and has prepared a knife for it, he won't prefer to crying [vp5,4-1]out his intention at the top of his lunge [fm1,-]. [sn1,s]        Finally, let's get down to the woman's testimony.  The woman said she saw the murder while she was turning and tossing.  And she was sure what she had seen, because she had worn glasses.  But no people wear glasses to bed.  It is even impossible that the woman wore her glasses after she noticed something happening in the boy's father's room, for the last two cars of the EL passed her windows in two senconds [fm1,-]  and after that [pr3,-2]  two senconds [fm1,-] , nothing can [vp6,20-5]  be seen in the darkness.  So, if the woman did see something, she saw only a blur.   Sorry, I almost forget a detail about the male witness -- the detail seems so unimportant that perhaps you've already forgottn [fm1,-]  it as I do.  Meanwhile, it does provide us with useful information.  That is the old man said he ran to the door to see the boy running downstairs after fifteen seconds as he heard the body falling.  It is evident that the old [wd4, 2-10]  is crippled and confused half the time, how can he walk to the door with two canes [wd3,6-]  in such a short time and be positive about the exact time? Our junors [fm1,-]  have already proved he can not act as he said in fifteen minutes.     The above is my final words on this case.  I appeal to  the judge to anounce [fm1,-]  that the boy is not guilty.     Thank you.  

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH ZHDA> <AGE 19> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>           Our Spring Festival     [np7,-2]  Spring Festival is the most festive time of the year in Chinese calendar.  People celebrate the arrival of [np7,-3]  lunar New Year in various activities.      The spirit of [np7,-2]  Spring Festival arrives usually ten days before the festival itself.  Street lights and store windows are decorated  with the traditional Spring Festival color of red.  Red is a  symbol of happiness and booming to [np7,9-1]  Chinese.  People hang up red lanterns, stick red couplets on gate posts, and stick potraits [fm1,-]  of Chinese Gods on doors, etc. after a thorough cleaning of their houses.     Everything takes on a new look as [np7,-2]  Spring Festival comes.  On New Year's Eve, the Chinese family all get together and have a feast meal [wd5,2-]  -- chicken, fish, dumpling...., then they all stay up to wait for the new year to come.  When the clock strikes twelve, firecrackers and fireworks decorate the sky.  The nation is in great triumph.      On New Year's Day, everyone is wearing new hats, clothes, shoes and stockings.  Young children receive lucky money in red packages from their parents and relatives.  The families  pay new year calls to each other and whoever they meet they wish each other [pr1,7-3]  a good year.  Pleasant new year songs fly out of house and fill the Spring Festival atmosphere.  People sing, dance...they are nice and happy.       [np7,-2]  Spring Festival, actually, lasts until the lunar January 15th.  Though there are variations of traditional customs in different parts of the country, some are most popular, such as visiting relations [wd3,3-3] , keeping lights on all day and all night, eating the food that has a luckily-sound name...    Since [np7,-2]  Spring Festival is considered the real beginning of a new year by most of the Chinese people, it's regarded as the most promising time of a  year.  A good festival is a promise of a good year.  After all kinds of celebrations, Chinese people begin to work hard for the realization of  a more wonderful year.     

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>         Language Study and Science Study      Language and science have many different features as two different subjects.  As we all know, science is the research of nature rules.  It has a close connection with observation, comparison and experiments.  Much of the scientists'  time is spent in laboratories.  However, if you want to learn language, you can never do that, as language is for communication.   You must spend as much time as possible to talk.  Different subjects require different learning methods, so we must have different ways to learn language and science.      People often say that language is not only a science, but an art as well.  This shows another difference between language and science.  Science is exact, accurate, and objective.  Once a true natural law is discovered, it can be applied to in [wd5, 5-2]  many situations without changing.  But language has more social elements and more skills are implied in it as it is used .    Different cultures may have completely different  understandings about a certain sentence.  Therefore, when we are learning language we should not only learn the language itself, but also the cultural background, such as customs, traditions....      Since language is also a science, it has many similarities with science.  Both language and science are an endless world for us to explore, so those who want to learn well in language should be as active and willing as when they study science.  Pessive [fm1,-]  study will certainly lead to failure in both subjects.     As we can see from the learning process of Scudder in our  text, science study needs observation and comparison.  It's also important in learning language. We should learn to find the similarities and differences between two languages, not only the vocabulary, but also the grammar, the cultural background.  Both subjects can't be independent of observation and comparison.    In a word, since both "language study" and "science study" are "study", they have methods in common; and as they belong to different study catogory [fm1,-] , we should find the suitable method for each . 

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>      A Character Sketch of Galileo      Galileo was born in Pisa, Italy, in 1564. As a boy, he showed a scientific talent: observant, curious, and non-conformable [fm2,-] . As he grew up, his desire of probing the mystery of the things  became more and more intense, [sn1,-s] his dissatisfaction with what the authority ordered to obey became stronger and stronger. After he entered the University of Pisa, Galileo became more active to testify his hypothesis with experiments and he was brave enough to  challenge  the great Aristotle.  Although he was considered an idiot and a heretic, he just turned a deaf ear to such "criticism and  dedicated himself to the pursuit of truth.  After he went to Padua, where the intellectual air [wd3,2-6]  was much more freer [aj3,1-2]  than Piza, Galileo reached the height of [wd4,4-1] life.  All his life Galileo invented a lot of things (for example, the compass, the thermometer and the telescope) and discovered many nature laws (such as the Theory of Falling Objects, the isochronism of Pendulum) .  Actually  Galileo was a follower of Copernicans and he dared to declare there are spots in the sun.      In the atmosphere of [np7,-2]  Middle Ages, Galileo was just like a shining star in the dark sky.  His contribution was bejond [fm1,-]  comparison.  Yet just as the sun also has spots, Galileo was not perfect.  From a critical point of view, Galileo should have  achieved more if he hadn't made the deadly decision to return to Pisa, where the power of Inquisition was very strong.  However , with an eagerness to return in triumph to his hometown and to show how injust [fm2,-]  they had treated him, Galileo returned to Pisa brashly.  Soon he suffered the consequence of his decision -- He was oppressed, summoned and deprived of the basic rights by the Inquisition and finally was sentenced to death.  Psychologically speaking, Galileo's mind was not broad enough so that he sacrificed his career for the [np7,5-1] fame.       Yet it was really difficult for Galileo to break through the dense nets made by the authority of his times.  He deserved the respect and memorial [wd3,5-5]  from all over the world.  In my opinion, he is not only a great scientist, but also a brave warrior.
  
<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>                 "I Cannot Keep My Hands Free"    "No, I won't agree." Father said with a determined tone.   "I promise I won't go to work, just go back to have a look at our house and land."  Grandma continued her request.    "Don't argue any more.  I know you, Mum.  Next time, let's go back together."     Often do I hear such a conversation.  At first I think Dad is too authoritative.  Why not let Grandma do what she wants?  But by and by, I understand Dad.  He knows Grandma as well as loves her.    Grandma is over seventy now.  She has spent almost all the time on the land, farming for the whole family.  As our life is improving, Father wants Grandma to stop working and enjoy life in the city.  However, Grandma won't rest and "enjoy".  She is always trying to do as much housework as she could.  "Let me do it."  is her favourite words.     "Grandny [fm1,-] , come here and watch television.  The programme is wonderful."  I called Grandma who was washing the dishes in the kitchen.     "OK, wait until I finish, dear granddaughter."    Ten minutes passed.  "Grandny [fm1,-] , have a rest."  I called again.   "Thank you.  But look at the floor.  It's a little dirty.  I'll mop it first."     Such is Grandma, always finding things to keep herself  busy.   However, as she grows old, she isn't as strong as before.  Three times she met with small accidents while she was at the countryside.   Once she even broke her leg when she tried to climb up a mountain to collect some dry branches, and that's why after that Father would not let Grandma go home alone.   "Grandny [fm1,-] , you've worked hard all your life. Why not rest and enjoy life?"     Grandma stroked me with her wrinkled hands, "dear [fm3,-]  girl, I've been used to using my hands all the time.  I feel so uncomfortable when I rest my hands.  And, "she added, "I like to do things for you."    "But, Grandny [fm1,-] , we hope that you can live a happy and free life."     "I know you are all good children.  Never mind, I'm still strong.  I just cannot keep my hands free."     "cannot [fm3,-]  keep my hands free", that's my Grandmother.

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>                    Is The boy Guilty or Not?      There is an important principle that the criminal court must eliminate any reasonable doubt to confirm the defendant's crime. Among the several proofs listed by the prosecution, reasonable doubts will be found.       The lethal weapon is the knife.  The boy admits going to a neighbourhood store and buy [vp4,9-2]  this knife, but he also says he must have lost it on the way home.  The prosecutor considers it a lie just because the store keeper said that the knife was the only one kind he had.  Actually, it can be easily found.  Look at this one.  I got it last night in a little junk shop around the corner from the boy's house. Therefore, the boy may have not lied.     Now let's come to the first witness's testimony.  The old man said he heard the boy yell, "I'm going to kill you."  A second later he heard the father's body falling.  And he saw the boy running out of the house fifteen seconds after that.  However, the second witness -- the woman across the street -- said that she saw the boy stab his father through the open window of a moving elevated train.  Now let's pay our attention to the time. How long does it take an elevated train going at top speed to pass a given point?    About ten seconds, or two seconds per hour.  Remember the woman saw the killing through the windows of the last two cars, which means that the EL train had been going by the old man's window for at least 6 seconds before the body fell.  Imagine the awful noise made by the passing train.  Do you believe that such an old man could hear the boy's shouting in such a condition?     Suppose the old man did hear it, now let's continue to see [wd3,4-1] his words.  He said he saw the boy running out of the house 15s [fm2,-]  later.  A man who can only walk very slowly with two canes is able to cover forty-three feet within 15s [fm2,-] , can we imagine?  A judicial test will show whether it's possible or not. (Perform  test) As we all see, it's absolutely not true.  Thus I think that the old man only heard someone running down the stairs and assumed it was the boy.  He lied in the court.     The second witness -- the woman seems to have given a more important evidence, because she said she "saw" the murder.  At about 12:10 when she was turning and tossing.  Let me remind you of the facts:  The woman is near-sighted and no one wears glasses in bed, true?  How can a woman with poor eyesight see clearly what's happening in another house across the tracks?     From the  above reasoning, the witnesses'  testimonies can not be used as the evidence of the murder.  Apart from it, there is another point about the stab wound -- the downward angle.  The boy is five feet eight inches tall while his father was six two.  The different [wd2,1-5]  of 6 inches in height makes it very hard to stab into the chest of the taller one.  There must be another person who is taller than the boy's father that had killed him.    The boy is not guilty, though he has been kicked around all his life, though he may hate his father.  The strong facts before us show that the boy didn't commit the crime. 

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 19> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>                     An Old Man      He is the strangest man I've ever seen.     When I was four years old, one day, my mother brought me a picture book after work.  I was attracted to the colourful pictures at once.  My mother told  me that it was Uncle Chen who had given me the book.       From then on, I often received some picture-books and story-books sent by Uncle Chen.  I loved those books.  First, my mother told me the stories on them.  Little by little, I began to learn the characters through the stories.  But I had never seen Uncle Chen for he lived far away from my home.  Only now and hen my mother told me something about him.       Uncle Chen is my mother's workmate.  He is an engineer.  Nearly eighty as he is, he still works in the factory.  He is a learned, warm-hearted but very serious man.  He can't bear a tiniest mistake in his work.  He was very strict with [wd3,4-2]  his disciples, so they are a bit afraid of him but all respect him.  In fact, the work done by his group is always excellent.  On the other hand , people think [vp1,1-4]  him a strange man.     Firstly, he has gone beyond in retiring age, but he  was [vp6,9-4]  still working very hard.  He has said that he won't quit until he can't work any longer.  Secondly, he earns a pretty good salary, but he leads a very simple, maybe we should say, a miserly life. He spends most of his money on books, magazines and newspapers.  Thirdly, he isn't married and    consequently has no children, but he always sends books to his workmates' children freely.  I am one of the lucky children.  From the first picture-book fifteen years ago to the latest English Salon a week before [wd3,14-] , I've read considerable [aj1,2-3]  books and magazines from him.     I remember very well the first time I visited Uncle Chen three years ago.  It is [vp6,8-3]  a small room no longer than twelve square metres.  When I went into it, I found myself enter a world of books.  Three big bookshelves, the desk, the boxes under the bed and even half of the bed were all filled with books.  He recieved [fm1,-]  me warmly.  He inquired how I got on with my study.  When I told him that I was interested in English and was going to do further study of it in University, it seemed to please him.  He himself studied English in Yanjing University  when he was young.  Then, he began to tell his story.     He was born in an influential family.  His father was a superior officer of the Kuomindang government, while he was influenced by the progressive ideas.  When he graduated from university, he left his family and took part in the revolution.  After liberation [fm3,-]  he entered the university a second time and studied mechanics, then became an engineer.  In the Cultural Revolution, his family background brought him persecution.  He was barred in a barn for ten years.  During the years, he read some books that he had hidden secretly.  It was books that helped him go through those hardest days.  Only when he came to my mother's factory in the 80's could he continue his work and study.  He said to me, "Some people think I'm a bit foolish.  They don't understand why I keep on working instead of enjoying the days I have left me [sn8,s-].  And since I am quite old now, it seems unworthy to spend so much money on books.  You know that he Cultural Revolution has [vp6,6-4]  taken me ten years.  I feel lucky that I could go through it, moreover, I still have the ability to work now, so why shouldn't I work harder to make up for the lost ten years[sn1,s]love books and one is never too old to learn.  I give books to children because I hope they will love books and realize the importance of books too.   Remember: You young people is [vp3,3-5]  the future of the country.  It is very important for you to learn as much as possible, then you can serve the country."  Hearing his words, I came to understand him. I saw a noble soul.     He is the man I respect very much.
  
<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 19> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>                     The Defence by the Boy's Lawyer       According to the two witnesses'  testimonies, now we have been informed that an old man living under the boy's house heard the boy say to his father, "I'm going to kill you."  , then the body falling [vp5,3-] , then he saw  the boy running down the stairs and out of the house; at the same time, a woman living across from [wd5,4-3]  the boy's house saw the boy stab his father through the windows of a pass [vp5,1-2]  EL train.  In addition, the boy admits [vp6,2-12]  he bought a knife just like the one stuck into his father.  So my client, the boy is accused of murdering his father.  Since "Guilty beyond a reasonable doubt" is a principle of our American system of criminal court, now I'd like to state some reasonable doubts to  prove that my client is innocent.     First, the old man says he heard the boy say to his father, "I'm going to kill you.", a second later the body falling [vp5,2-] . [sn1,s] According to the woman's testimony, the whole thing happens [vp6,8-]  during [pp1,-5]  the EL train passing through.  People who live near the EL tracks know that when the window is open and the train goes by, the noise is awful.  So it is impossible for the old man to hear what the boy says and the  body falling [vp5,9-]  with the EL  noise. Suppose he did hear it.  I'm sure all of us have said "I'll kill you." for many times.  When we say this, certainly it doesn't mean we're really going to kill someone.  So the phrase cannot mean anything.  Further more [fm2,-] ,the old man says he ran to the door and saw the boy rush out of the house fifteen seconds after the killing.  Let's see the drawing [wd3,3-3]  of the apartment. The old man was in bed.  It's twelve feet from his bed to the bedroom door and the hall is forty-three feet, six inches long, i.e., he had to walk about fifty feet from his bed to the door. Don't forget the old man is over seventy and there is something wrong with his legs, which makes him walk very slowly.  Can such an old man do all of that in fifteen seconds?  Obviously he can't. So I can say that the old man has lied in court and his testimony is unbelievable.      Secondly the woman right across the street says that she saw he boy stick the knife into his father.  It was at night and she was lying in bed, unable to sleep because it was hot.  We have proved that one can look through the windows of a passing EL train at night and see what's happening on the other side, but remind you, the woman has bad eye sight, she has to wear her glasses to see things clearly. [sn1,s] We all know that no one wears glasses to bed.  So without her glasses, the woman couldn't see the boy kill his father.  What she saw was only a blur.     Last, although the boy admits [vp6,2-2]  he bought a same d3,3-5]  knife as the lethal weapon, in fact, no other evidence proves they are one knife. [sn1,s] Since the boy can buy it from a store, someone else also [ad1,2-2]  can buy this kind of knife from other stores.     According to the three doubts above, I should say the boy is innocent.  

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>         The Essence of New Year     Today is December 31th [fm2,-] , the New Year's Eve. There were long queues in front of the selling-windows [fm2,-] .  For I wanted some breads [np5,3-]  for midnight, I went in.  The sellers were all busy.  They did their sellings as quickly as possible.  But the students were so many that they couldn't deal with it.     It occured [fm2,-]  to me suddenly that idea [wd5,6-] : why not come to help them? Then, I  stood behind a window.   When a student stood in front of the selling-window and told me what he wanted, I'd pack [vp6,16-2]  the food with a plastic bag. And then I'd count [vp6,2-2]  [wd3,1-2]  the price and get the payment from his Golden Dragon Card  by pressing the IC card Machine [fm3,-] .  That's all the process.  It's not difficult but mechanizational [fm1,-] .  I did it again and again.  At the beginning I was a little clumsy.  By and by I became skillful.  The long queue was shorter.  The other sellers praised me  with delighting expression [np6,-3]  in their eyes.     Having serived [fm1,-]  one and another customer, I was filled with the satisfaction and happiness occured [fm2,-]  by labour.  I still remembered tonight [wd3,3-5]  was the New ear's Eve. A piece of cake." ok [fm3,-] , just a minute." I packed them into a bag  quickly and handed it to her. After I pressed the key on the I.C. card machine, I said to her: "Wish you a happy New Year.  Have a wonderful  night !"  The girl was surprised and couldn't find [vp2,1-2]  her voice at that moment. I nodded to her and said:   "See you!"  Surprisedly [fm1,-]   and happily she left.   "That is good." I said to myself, "I must go on." Another girl was here. After I pressed the key, I said:" Wish you a happy new year.  Have a wonderful night!"  She grinned." Thank you.  You too. " Again, she left happily and surprisedly [fm1,-] .     Sending my wishes to everyone with my services, I did it again and again delightedly. Having said "Happy New Year to each seller, I went out of the dinning-room [fm1,-]  with cluster [wd3,-2]  of thanks from the sellers.  I was tired but happy.  This Eve was a most instructive Eve, because I understood the essence of new year: sending assistance and wishes to everyone!     I looked up and saw what a starry night it was.  It seemed that the stars were smiling and blinking to me.     "Happy New Year."  I spoke to myself softly.

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>                 The prosecutor testimony    In the following testimony,  I'll prove the boy, the suspect is guilty.     First, let's look at the boy's record.  He lives in a slum.  At fifteen he was in reform school .  He ever [wd5,1-3]  stole a car.  He's been picked up for knife fight.  The suspect's life is filled with bad records.     Secondly, let's go through the first witness, the old man's testimony.  The old man lives on the second floor under the room where the murder took place.  After twelve o'clock [wd5,2-1]  ten, he heard loud noises in the uper [fm1,-]  apartment.  It sounded like a fight.  The [fm1,-]  he heard the boy shouted to his father, "I'm going to kill you ."  A second later, he heard a body falling.  He ran to the door of his apartment and looked out.  He saw the boy running down the stairs and out of the house.  Then he called the police and found the father was knifed dead.     Thirdly, let's go through the second witness, the woman's testimony.  The woman lives across the stree [fm1,-] .  The boy's house-window [fm2,-]  is right across from hers.  There is an [np7,-2]  EL tracks between them.  The woman went to bed at about eleven o'clock that night.  Her bed was next to the open window. She could see right into [pp1,12-2]  the window.  She tossed about her sleep [cc3,3-]  over an hour. Finally she turned to the window at about twelve ten.  As she looked out, there was a train passing. The EL train had five cars.  Through the windows of the last two, the woman saw the boy stab his father.  And we had proven one can see through the window of a passing train and see the thing on [pp1,3-2]  the house across at night.     Finally, let's go to the important evidence. [sn9,-]   The flick knife.  The knife was stabbed into the father's chest.  Also, the boy admits going to the neighborhood store and buying the knife after being beaten by his father that night.  The storekeeper identified the knife and said it is [vp6,3-]  the only one of its kind he had.     So, from all above, we have enough evidence to prove the suspect is guilty.
   
<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>                                   After conducting a thorough cross-examination, please allow me to have a conclusive statement as defense lawyer.     Firstly, this knife is a pretty strong piece of evidence.  The boy admits buying a knife  like this in his neighbourhood after being bit [fm1,-]  by his father.  You may doubt whether this unusual knife is a present for a friend as the slum boy says?   But I easily got it in a little junk shop around the corner from the boy's house.  Since there's no fingerprint on it, it can't prove that this is the exact knife the boy uses to stab his father.    Sencondly [fm1,-] , the testimony of the old man is not so persuable [fm2,-] . As we know from our common sense, you can't hear yourself think because of the awful noise when your window is open and the train goes by.  So it's impossible for the old man to have heard the boy say "I'm going to kill you" while the front of the EL war [fm1,-]  roaring past his nose.     Another important point is time. The old man was positive that he got to his front door from his bed in 15 seconds. The hall of his house is 43 feet, six inches long. He had to get out of bed, get his canes, walked [vp5,10-]  twelve feet, open the bedroom door, walk forty-three feet, and open the front door to see what was happening.  Could anyone of you believe that it's possible for an old man who walks with 2 canes can do [vp5,12-]  all in 15 seconds[sn8,s-]? I think the old man was trying to get to the front door. He heard someone running down the stairs and assumed it was the boy.  He didn't witness it by his eye [wd5,7-] .     Let's go over the women's statement. The murder was taking place as she looked out of the window while tossing and turning in bed. She couldn't have time to put on her glasses in a second to see clearly who was the murderer.      To sum up, there are many contradictions in the evidence and the testimony. I don't think a wise verdict should be [wd5, 7-5]  result from these groundless evidence [np6,2-] . Every bright juriors [fm1,-], [np6,2-]  [fm1,-]  I'm sure you'll vote impatially [fm1,-]  without any prejudice of [pp1,6-3]  the innocent boy from the slum. We believe that law is fair and nobody innocent will be  verdicted [wd2,24-3]  to be [np7,7-1]  criminal.
  
<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>                  Our Spring Festival     The Spring Festival is the most important festival in China.     On the New Year's Eve, people usually prepared [vp6,7-5]  a lot of good dishes besides the fish which means the family has much more things than they need very year.  Everyone of the family even those who are far away from home will try to come back to reunite with the whole family.  They welcome the new year together.     In Guangdong Province, people like to decorate their houses with all kinds of flowers.  Smelling the fragrante [fm1,-] , you can feel the step of spring is coming.         When the clock strikes twelve on new year's eve , people set fireworks everywhere to celebrate the coming of the New Year.  The parents will give their children "lucky money", wishing them to be happy in the new year.     On the first several days of the new year, people go to visit their relatives and friends, greeting one another with "Happy New year" and other lucky sayings.    Children are the most excited persons on [np7,-2]  Spring Festival.  They can visit relatives in new clothes.  They are happy to hear that "You are one years [np6,1-1]  older and going to be an adult." 
 
<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>        The Learning of Science And Language      As a subject, the learning of science and the learning of language are quite different and have some similar characteristics as well. [sn8,s]   First of all, the contents are different.   If you study a subject of science, you should know the exact way in which a certain object move [vp3,8-] , the accurate fomula [fm1,-] , the outside and inside appearance and feature of the object etc.  If you study one language, you have to learn the culture background, the grammar rules and you must master the skills of reading, listening and writing of this language.  The most important thing is to communicate with this  language-speakers [np1,2-] .       Secondly, the ways of learning are different.  Learning a science, you must observe carefully, calculate accurately and do the experiments conscientiously.  To master a language, you should do listening, speaking and writing exercises as much as possible.  The environment is a significant factor to a language learner.  You should take all the opportunities to practise your language. A language learner has to communicate with others to improve himself while a science learner can learn all by himself.      Although the learning of science and language is quite differet [fm1,-] , as a course, they have some resemblances fm1,-].[sn8,s] To master knowledge, no matter it's science or language, you must practise as much as possible. Practice makes perfect.  If you practice more and are familiar with your subject, you can draw parallels from inference and make a rapid progress.    To sum up the resemblances [fm1,-]  and differences of the learning of science and language, we can draw a conclusion that science and language are incompatible, we can learn both of them well. [sn1,s]   

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>                  Character Sketch of Galileo      In Februry [fm1,-] , 1564, the great physicist, Galileo, was born in Pisa , Italy.  His  many achievements include the discovery of the isochronism [fm1,-] of the pendulum and the demonstration that the acceleration of a falling body does not depend on its weight.  He constructed the telescope, discovered Jupiter's satellites, observed sunspots and the mountainous nature of the moon.     Galileo was keen on observation when he was a little boy, and his curiosity about the world always couldn't [vp9,1-2]  be satisfied.  He never regarded [vp2,2-8]  what the [np7,4-6]  great man had said for granted, and he kept experimenting to test whether the theory was true or not.   This  led to his first discovery of the isochronism [fm1,-] of the pendulum when he was 19.     In my opion [fm1,-] , it was his disposition that led to Galileo's achievements and fate of his whole life.  He had 3 main character [np6,2-] . First of all, he was fearless.  It's  regarded as [vp2,2-10]  brash for Galileo, an obscure young prefessor [fm1,-] , to contradict Aristotle at that time.  Undaunted by the sneers of his students and the  wrath of the faculty, he managed to proved his theory of the falling object.  He never accepted what the Master said as authritative [fm1,-] .  Galileo could make so many discoveries.  Most of Galileo's discoveries were owned to his keeping questioning.     Galileo's second character was perseverance.  When his father beg [vp6,3-10]  Galileo to give up and obey his professor, Galileo put [vp2,1-6]  a deaf ears to the plea.  He continued his study although he met with jealousy and hatred, even though he was dismissed [sn6,s-] .  He made great achievements during his 18-year stay in the University of Padua. When he went back to Pisa, he never stopped his study in spite of the cruel persecution.       Galileo's vainity [fm1,-]  led to his tragedy in the rest of his life.  For years, he had longed for the day when he could return in triumph to Pisa.  He wanted to revenged [vp4,3-]  his fellow professors and gain  the respect and approval of his fellow citizens.  Knowing that he wouldn't get away with the persecution of the Inquisition, Galileo made the decision in spite of the warning of his friends.  If he had stayed in Padua, he would have made more achievements.  To go back to Pisa is the fatal mistake he made.    To sum up, it's tortuous [fm1,-]  for Galileo to make so great achievements.  His great  courage and perseverance of pursuing the truth are worth learning from.  No men [np6,1-2]  is infallible.  We will always remember Galileo as a great scientist who had contributed so much to the world.

Why not follow him to see what he does and what kind  of people he makes friends with out of school?  My mother suggested.  She thought that's [vp6,2-3]  a direct way to know something.    "That's not a good way."  Father said seriously, "We should keep in touch with his teachers.  Parents and school should operate."     Then my father made a phone call to my brother's teacher and got some details of brother's performance in [pp2,2-1]  school.    One day, when [np7,-4]  four of our family sat around the table after dinner, Father said "Let's have a family talk.  What happened these days to our family?..."    "My children, you are getting old enough to deal with different situations by yourselves.  I have told you some examples of the complex society. Can you take your new friends home and introduce them to us?" "By the way, we hope you can return home on time because we would worry about you every night when you came back late.  Can you?"  Father said to brother.  After that, my brother would go back to home on time.     That's our respectful [wd3,2-1]  father -- common but great!

<ST 5> <SEX 1> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 23> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>      Differences on [wd3,1-1]  Study Between Language and Science    It's hard to say the difference directly. Let's set to the study of the distinctive features between them.  Language is the systerm [fm1,-]  of human expression by means of words, and science is a knowledge which depends on testing facts and stating general natural laws. So the ways to study  is [vp3,4-1] different.     If we want to study language very well, we'll set about listening, writing,  [wd4,4-1] speaking simultaneously. It is very important for us to practise these three kinds of abilities.  But studing [fm2,-]  science isn't as easy as language. Above all, people should have several qualities, such as patience, dedication, earnestness, enthusiasm, etc, because the research and the experiment is [vp3,5-2]  too dull and complicated. For example, after repeated experiments, radium was found.  After struggling against Aristotle's wrong idea, Galileo found the theory of "falling object".     By making a comparative study, we could see that language needs imitation, while science needs creation. If we create language, we'll be easy [wd3,2-3]  to make mistakes. Identically [sn9,-]  if we imitate science, we couldn't get progress [cc3,1-] . So science student [np6,1-3]  should have encouragement [wd3,5-]  to break down old ideas.     From the question professor [fm3,-]  Chang gave, I'm reminded again that it is easier to study language than science. I sure do learn it well. [sn8,s]   
 
<ST 5> <SEX 1> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 23> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>                     The Character of Galileo     Galileo is a great scientist of Italy. The achievement that Galileo made can't be separated from his distinctive character.     First, he is observant and studious. When he was young, his insatiable curiosity made him experiment and devise tests constantly to probe the mystery of the world. Once, he listened to the persistent rattle of a chain unconsciously; [sn9,-]  and then he discovered an important principle through the regular swinging of an old lamp. Just such spirits led to his discovery.[sn8,s]    Second, Galileo is brave and defiant. In order to persuade wd3,-2]  scientific truths, he didn't care about the sneers of his students and the wrath of his fellow professors, even the threat of christian [fm3,-]  persecution. At the same time, he wasn't ready to confess [wd3,-1]  theories just because Aristotal [fm1,-]  said so. He dared to contradict Aristotal's [fm1,-]  wrong theory. Eventually he even risked his life publishing an astronomical book to support Copernicus'  theory. What he did demaged [fm1,-]  christian [fm3,-]  interest and the penalty that he got is [vp6,5-]  serious. Obviously, he dedicated himself to science. Therefore, without these characters, he can't [vp6,4-4]  stuggle [fm1,-]  against wrong idea [np6,1-]  and [np7,-2]  heartless pope [fm3,-]  fearlessly.    Evidently, Galileo's characters are very important factors for his success and great achievement. Before his death, he repeated his words. The persuit [fm1,-]  of science needs special bravery.      This is his real portrait.

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>      Spring-festival [fm2,-]  is a traditional Chinese festival to celebrate the coming new year.  It is in some way like the Christmas day [fm3,-]  in Europe.  For example, people also have new year's eve on which they eat a delicious meal.  Then the family get together happily waiting for the new year to come.  Like the turkey for Christmas, the Chinese dumpling is one of the traditional food for Spring-festival [fm2,-] .     The Spring-festival [fm2,-]  usually lasts for 20 days.  Besides celebration, people also make good plans for the new year.  It is said that "A good Spring-festival [fm2,-]  can bring you luck throughout the year."  Thus, [np7,-2]  spring festival  [fm2,-]  becomes the most important holiday for every Chinese.  

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>       A Misunderstanding in Science and Language Study      The study of science and the study of language seem to be quite different.  When the students of language talk about the study of science, they feel [wd4,2-1]  headache.  Why does this happen?     To look into the problem, we have to go back to our high school.  It is the training method of our high school that brings this result.  When you decide to study [np7,5-1]  language, a subject  involved [wd3,2-2]  in arts, you devote most of your time to remembering things, Chinese, history, politics, etc.  You try to remember everything in the text book [fm2,-] . Gradually, you will lose the ability [np1,4-3]  of thinking logically which is very common in the study of science. You will slowly form a habit of learning things passively, and just recite what you've learnt.    After you enter the [np7,3-1]  college and become a major of language, you take it for granted that since language is involved [wd3,2-2]  in arts, the way of studying it should  be passive--rememberance [wd7,-] .  In fact, this is quite [np7, 3-1]  misunderstanding.    First of all, study is not a passive work.  No matter which subject you learn, your eagerness is the precondition of your study.     Secondly, logical thinking is also important in language study.  I believe some of you have [vp6,5-3]  such experience that sometimes you want to say something, but you just can't get [wd4,7-1]  across.  This is because you are lack of logical thinking.  On this occasion, you always try to put the words you are going to speak in [np7,1-2]  right order.  And  You [fm3,-]  do this just as the students of science use logical thinking to solve their science problems.   Thirdly and lastly, since you are not a native-speaker [sn9,-] you certainly have to remember something.  But just notice that the aim of your rememberance [wd3,4-6]  is to use the language for communication and the more you practise it, the more you are familiar with it.     From the above, we can see that the study [wd4,2-1]  language is really a hard task.  Not only have [vp9,2-3]  you [np7,2-2]  good memory, but also a logical mind.  The differences between the study of language and science is disappeared [vp7,10-] .  As an English major [np6,4-3] , we really have a long way to go. 

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>           The sketch of Galileo's character     Like all other great scientists, Galileo had both an observant mind and a great soul.    When he was in his childhood, he was curious  about the world and was forever experimenting and devising tests to probe the mystery of things.  The observant mind made him brash enough to challenge a theory of the great Aristotle .  Because of this, he had earned [cc3,-5]  himself the jealousy and hatred of his colleagues. He was unaware of all this persecution.  To him, scientific truth is [vp6,11-1]  everything.     The determination to pursue scientific truth as well as the patriotism for his hometown, Pisa, delivered him into the torture chamber of the Inquisition.  He fought against it, but it was a pity that he did not keep on.  Finally he was compelled to renounce his belief.  But if we take the hard situation into consideration, we shall [vp9,10-]  say Galileo is still a great person.  At his times [pp2,2-] , the Inquisition was too strong that [cj1,5-5]  no one could defied [vp4,3-1]  it.  It is said that after his renouncement, Galileo remarked under his breath that, "But the earth does move!"  This showed that his belief did not change.  The scientific truth was still in his heart.   From this, we can see that it is difficult to become a scientist.  It is even more difficult to become a true scientist.    And Gelileo [fm1,-]  is just one of them [pr1,16-] . 

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 2>    Mother's dream     I took out the application form during the meal.  "Mum," I said, "We are asked to fill in this form."   Mother took the form. "Well, which college are you determined to go [vp1,6-] ?" She asked.    "Mum, I don't want to go to college.  I'm..."  Her face turned cloudy [wd3,3-] .  It was the expected result.  I waited for her bursting out, but she just put down her chopsticks and went to the living-room without any words.    "You should not do that."  my father said to me as he patted my shoulder.    "Dad, I don't mean to defend [wd3,4-1]  mum [fm3,-] .  I just can't bare [fm1,-]  the competition of entering the [np7,8-1]  college.  I am tired."   "I know, my dear!  But do you know it is your mother's greatest hope that you can enter the [np7,3-1]  college?"   I opened my eyes wide when my father began my mother's story.     When my mother was young, she was the top student of her class.  Just after she had entered the key middle school, the Cultural Revolution began.  She had to quilt [fm1,-]  her study and went to work on the farm.  She was only 14, and was determined to go to college afterwards.  During the campaign, she caught ever [fm1,-]  chance to learn.  She was a person with strong perseverance.  At the end of the campaign, she became a worker and married my father.      After marriage, my mother thought of taking part in the entrance exams of college.  Just then, she was pregnant.  She faced a [np7,-12]  choice whether to give birth to me or to go on study.  She chose me because she was maternal [wd3,6-] .  Her dream, however, became foam [wd3,4-]  this time and it faded away completely.  As a wife and a mother, she had to take on such heavy and time-consuming housework that she had no time to think of her dream.  She devoted herself to her family.     "After your birth, your mother found her dream again.  It's you!  You are her new hope!  Just think of it, what you do will break her dream a third time!" [sn1,s] Father finished [wd4,2-1]  story and left me alone in the dining-room.    In front of me was the application form.  I never knew my mother's dream and how cruel life had treated her dream [wd5, 6-] .  I suddenly understood the saying "Every mother is a great person."                                                     I took out the [np7,3-1]  pen and filled in the form "Zhongshan University."  I knew thoroughly that it was me to fulfill my mother's dream! [sn8,s]

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 8> <SCH Zhongda> <AGE 20> <WAY 3> <DIC 1> <TYP 1>             Final words of the defense lawyer    Your honour,     We have listened to all the witnesses and conducted thorough cross-examinations.  It's time we concluded that the boy is innocent, because there are a number of reasonable doubts in the evidence  the prosecutor gave.     Let's start with the switch knife.  The prosecutor said that the knife is [vp6,6-1]  unusual. The shop keeper identified it and said it was the only one of its kind he had.  Everyone connected with the case identified this knife.  But my assistant got a same [wd3,4-1]  knife in a little junk shop around the corner from the boy's house.  This shows that it is chance [wd3,2-1]  that others get a similar knife.     Then the downward angle of the wound in the dead body.  The boy is five feet eight inches tall.  His father was six  feet two inches.  It's very hard to stab down into the chest of someone who's taller than you.  And if we take the boy's background into consideration, he would not stab it that way.  He got used to knife fight and anyone who has ever used a switch knife would use it underhanded.     Secondly, let's look at the woman's  testimony.  She was lying in bed and couldn't sleep.  Right across the street she saw the boy stick the knife into his father.  That's all what [wd5,2-2]  she said but the woman is near sighted.  Surely she would not wear her glasses in bed.  How could she see clearly without her glasses. [sn9,-]   She saw only a blur.     Thirdly, there are several doubt [np6,3-]  about the times [np5,1-5]  in the old man's testimony.  It takes an elevated train 10 seconds to pass a given point.  That is 2 seconds per car.  According to the woman, that EL had been going by the old man's window for at least six seconds before the body fell.  And in such awful noise, the old man could not hear the boy say "I'm going to kill you."  That's one point.  Then in his testimony, he said when he heard a body falling, he ran to the door of his apartment and looked out and saw the kid beat it downstairs fifteen seconds after the killing.  We conducted an experiment in court that for an old man like him it would take him at least thirty-nine seconds to do all this.  So his testimony is unbelievable.    For the above mentioned reasons, we say that the boy is innocent.  And we appeal [vp1,1-2]  the jury to vote for innocent for the boy.[sn,s].   

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                    Comparation [fm1,-]  between Christmas and the Spring Festival      Christmas and the Spring Festival are both the most important Festivals [fm3,-] . They have a lot of the same things.     First, people in different places all make a lot of preparation [np6,4-]  to celebrate them. In [wd4,1-3]  east [fm3,-]  and   [wd4,3-1] west [fm3,-] , the street light and store windows are decorated with the traditional colours of red and green before the festivals.     Secondly, On [fm3,-]  Christmas and the Spring Festival people in different places  all send cards to each other.     However, because the geography [wd3,2-17]  and the culture are different, there are a lot of differences between Christmas and the Spring Festival, too.     First  [sn9,-] they have different meanings. People celebrate Christmas to memorize [wd3,4-1]   Jesus, while people celebrate the Spring Festival to welcome a new year.     Secondly; [sn9,-]  on Christmas Eve in the west [fm3,-]  many families go to church and on the Spring Festival in the east [fm3,-]  many families stay at home to watch TV programme [wd5,3-] .     Thirdly, on Christmas people buy Christmas trees to symbolise [fm1,-]  eternal life while on the Spring Festival people are used to playing firecrackers [cc3,2-]  to express their happiness.    Fourthly, people eat different foods.  On Christmas people will enjoy a traditional Christmas dinner -- turkey or ham, sweet  potatoes, vegetables, mince pies and so on.  On [wd4,1-2] Spring Festival people like to eat fish and ravioli.     Last, on Christmas the children in the  west [fm3,-]  will hang stockings near the chimneys, hoping that Santa Claus will fill them with peasants [wd3,6-] .  On the  Spring Festival the children will visit relatives and get money from them.  They think that will bless [vp1,-4]  them safety and luck in the new year.     

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                    Language Study and Science Study     There are a lot of subjects in the world.  All of them can be divided into two branches -- language study and science study.    They are a lot of differences between them.    Language study is mainly depended [vp7,4-4]  on people's concrete thoughts.  Language is connected with morpheme, words, phrases, clauses and sentences.  You must remember words, use phrases and make up sentences.  Language has its rules called grammar, telling something about sentence structure and tenses.  If you write  something, you must obey the rules.    Further [wd3,-4] , writing is not enough.  To master a foreign language, listening and speaking is also very important. If you can't listen [wd3,3-7] , you'll not know what other people say and if you don't speak, other people can never know our ideas.  To learn listening and speaking well, you must practise a lot, knowing the cluster readings, acquainting [vp1, -4]  the pronunciations and intonations, and enlarging your vocabularies.    If you want your foreign language improved, you should learn some more things, such as idioms, foreign culture and so on.  Thus you can express yourself and translate better, and use words more properly.    As a student of language study [wd5,5-] , I have the experiences above. In one word, you must remember a lot to learn languages well.     On the contrary, science study is mainly depended [vp7,4-4]  on people's abstract thoughts.  It is connected with lines, numbers and shapes.  The essence of studying it is thinking and imaging. Whether people can learn it well depends on people's abstract [wd3,1-1]  abilities.  Science also has its own rules called theorems, but it is different from the grammars.  You must not only remember it but also use it freely.  With the the you will look out not a problem, but a sort of problems. [sn8,s]   You must imagine what will happen if you change the conditions or states and do a lot of experiments to examine your imaginations.[sn8,s]       Though language study and science study are so different, if you want to learn it [pr1,14-]  well, you must use your head and work hard.   

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 2>                                                                              The Character of Gelileo[fm1,-]      As we all know, Galileo is a great scientist, discovering the important principle which is applied today in the measurement of time, the eclipse of the sun and the movements of the stars.  However, he proved another important fact that two different weights drop [vp4,3-14]  simultaneously from the same height, [sn9,-]  would fall to the ground at the same time.  In order to prove the Falling Theory, he tasted a lot of bitter things, and all of these can show his character to us.     First, he was extraordinary [wd2,2-1]  observant and liked thinking   very much.  He observed every detail in the lives [wd3,6-] .  Some of the phenomena are so common that we all take them for granted, but Gelileo [fm1,-]  asked why and tried to find the answers.  Just because of this, he found out a lot of truth.  As we all know [sn9,-]  millions of people have seen apples fall to the ground, but only Newton found out the gravitation of the earth.     Secondly, he had a dedicating spirit of examining the nature and pursuing the scientific truth.  He could not accept the answers of the authority unless he himself did experiments to prove them.  For pursuing the truth, he even contradict [vp6, 2-1]  Aristotle.     Thirdly, also the most importantly, he was very brave and undeunted [fm1,-] .  He dared to have differently [wd2,2-1]  thoughts and proved theory that different from Aristotle. [sn8, s]   He even dared to do anything for seeking the truth.  Though the authority had warned him many times, never did he stop working.  He even published a book to disclose the results of his work to the world because he was undounted [fm1,-]  and could not suppress his ideas. Even if the students were scornful, even if the proffessors [fm1,-]  were very angry, and even if he knew what would happen if he proved his theory, he did it at last.    Galileo had devoted himself to the [wd5,3-1]  science.  He was so great a scientist that we will admire him for ever [fm2, -] .  

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 2>                                                                                                           MY PARENTS    My parents have lived together for over 20 years, so they know each other very well and love each other very deeply. It was on October 1, 1988, when I was only a child of 10 years old. On the morning of October 1, when I told my father the idea, to my surprise, he refused me.  He was preparing for passing a very important examination which can [vp6,10-3]  help his work a lot.    I was very disappointed and my mother comforted me again and again.  She told me that my father was very busy and the examination was very important for him, [wd4,s-]  she would take me to the zoo.  That year, I was ten years old and was so capricious and stubborn that I insisted on my father taking me there as usual.         I began to cry, begging them.  I didn't understand them at all.  Hearing my cry, my father had to give up.  He stood up from the chair, put on his cat [wd3,3-]  and took me to the zoo. That day, I was so happy that we didn't go home until the sun had fallen [wd3,3-3]  behind the mountain.  After dinner, I watched TV for a moment, [wd4,6-4]  then went to bed.  I fell asleep with a smile quickly. Waked [fm2,-]  up by a nightmare in [pp1,-2]  the mid-night, I saw the light in my  parents' room was still lighting [wd3,10-] .  I walked there with [pp1,-2]  my tiptoe ,to my surprise, my father was still sitting beside the desk to study [vp5,8-] , concentrating all of his attention.  It was 12 o'clock already.  My mother didn't sleep either, lying on the bed and reading some newspaper. After a moment, I heard their [pr4,2-1]  talking:   "You should not take her to the zoo.  If you studyed [fm2,-]  n the daytime, you can go to sleep now."  my mother said.    "No, I can refuse her words, but I can not refuse her tears.  I can not bear [cc3,3-2]  her disappointment. "  said my father,.    "You spoil [vp6,1-3]  her so much."    "So do you! We all love her, don't we?"    Hearing these words, my tears fell down along my cheek [np6,6-]  without controlling.[sn,s]   My heart can not be quiet for a long time.     "I love you, too"  I said to my parents in my heart.

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                    After hearing the old man and the woman's words you will think that the boy may be guilty.[sn,s].   But let us see the acts from surface to essence and think more deeply,   I think all of you will agree with me that the boy is innocent.    First, the boy is only 19 years old.  Because of some bad deeds, we may have a bad impression on [pp1,6-1]  him.  But let us see the truth that he lives in a slum and has been kicked around all his life.  His mother died since he was nine and his father beat him up regularly.  What can we require [wd3,3-8]  for [pp1,4-3] such a boy in a broken home?  I think we should show more our [wd5,2-1]  mercy, not prejudice.     Secondly, let us think about the old man's testimony.  according [pp2,-2]  his words, at 10 minutes after 12, he heard he loud  noice [fm1,-]  in [wd5,3-1]  upstairs.  Then he heard the kid say to his father "I am going to kill you."  A second later, he heard a body falling. Running to the door of his apartment, he saw the kid running down the stairs and out of the house.  But  let us use our heads and think [vp1,-2]  it further. He says he got up from the bed in his room and went down the hall to the front door.  He opened it and looked out in time to see the boy racing down the stairs.  According  to the research, e know that his bed was by the window, which is 12 feet to [pp1,10-3]  the bedroom door.  The hall is 43 feet, 6 inches long.  He had to get out of bed, get his canes, walk 12 feet, open the bedroom door, walk 43 feet, and open the front door -- all in 15 seconds.  Do you think this was possible? According to the experiment, we can quickly answer  "of course not."  Furthermore; [sn9,-] he had to be helped to sit into the witness chair.  Maybe some people think that the old man is too old to remember things well. Thus how can we believe an old man's words who can not be positive with things? [sn8,s]    Thirdly, the woman's testimony is also doubtful.  She sees the kid stick [wd3,2-2]  his father right across the street, across  The [fm3,-]  EL track at 11 o'clock that night.  As we all know that the first thing we do when we wake up at night and want to know the time is wearing glasses. [sn2,s-]   Because nobody wears glasses to bed and the woman had no time to put them on, I say she saw only a blur.    Fouthy [fm1,-] , there are a lot of the same things in the world.   I have show [vp6,1-2]  a knife which is the same as the boy's.  So it has great possibility that someone else killed his father with a same knife as the boy's.[sn8,s].       Last, the boy is 5 feet 8 inches tall.  His father was six two.  It's very hard to stab down into the chest of someone who's taller than you are.  Furthermore, anyone who's ever used a switch knife would never have stabbed downward.  Then the boy wouldn't have made the kind of wound that killed his father.     In conclution [fm1,-] , from the reasons above, I think and believe the boy is innocent. 

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 19><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                                 Christmas and Spring festival [fm3,-]      Christmas and Spring Festival are happy days . In these time [wd3,9-]  all people feel very happy and give up plenty of vexeds [fm1,-] [wd3,4-]   which are in working and living. [sn8,s]   But there are a lot of differences. <ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                               The Difference Between Two Festivals     As we all know, Christmas Day is the biggest and the most beloved holiday in the United States.  The  Spring Festival is the biggest festival in China.  It's the time to celebrate the end of the year, the reuniting [wd3,-4]  of families and friends, and the looking forward to a brand new year. [sn8,s]   However, they also have different aspects in celebration.    Firstly, the time is different.  Christmas day is being celebrated [vp6,4-3]  on December 25th, while the Spring Festival is being celebrated [vp6,5-]  on December, [sn9,-]  31st of [wd4,2-2]  lunar calendar.     Secondly, the activities of celebration are various.  In the United States  people have a big dinner on the eve of Christmas Day.  The food includes golden butter cookee [fm1,-] , coffee  squares, gingerbread, chocolate fudge, candy and so forth.  The [wd5,-s]  parents put their gifts on their children's stockings, decorate the Christmas tree  with candles and presents; [wd4, 8-7]  send cards to their relatives and friends.  All these activities color the air of celebration.     In China we also have a big dinner on the eve of Spring Festival.  Especially in the [wd5,1-2]  North China, people eat special food: Jiaozi and noodle.  Besides, parents will give children the [wd5,4-2]  Lucky money, which implies blessings and hopes.  During this festival, people will visit and send gifts to their friends and relatives.  Children fire the crackers and fireworks, which makes them very excited.     Finally, the decorations are also different.  In the United States the poinsettia plant, evergreens and the holly are most common decorations.  The gay poinsettia row is most highly cherished.  Its rich red and green make this plant most appropriate for Christmas.  The evergreens are used to decorate the house, which bring in blessings and good luck.  The holly berries are used to dot the green branches.     In China we put the gatepost couplet and the door god on the door.  The former expresses the [wd5,3-3]  hope and blessing, the latter is regarded as the talisman, who protect [vp3,8-]  the family against danger. This tradition has lasted for more than a thousand years.      In a word, these two festivals have similarities and differences and we do hope [wd3,-2]their comings.

Owing to these important elements, we'll study in an [np7,-4]  positive and active state.     As to differences, the learning skills are different most. [sn8,s]      Science is an accurate subject.  Therefore, we are patient and objective, and apply persistent and logic thought to the observation we makes [vp3,1-] .  We have to do the experiments in the laboratory, calculating and analysing, and make hypotheses of how [wd4,1-2]  process works and how events take place.     Studying language isn't seem as same as learning science. [sn8,s]   In order to master it well, we should pay attention to four elements: writing, reading, listening and speaking.  Neither [pr1,10-5]  of them should be neglected.  On writing and reading, we master the knowledge [cc3,3-]  on books; on listening and speaking, we utilize language in our daily life. <ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 3><DIC 1><TYP 2>                                                               	The Skatch [fm1,-]  of Galileo      Galileo is an Italian scientist, physicist and stargarer [fm1,-].  He founded the modern mechanics and experiment [wd2,3-1]  physics.  Though he suffered many persecutions, he still achieved quite a few achievements.  What makes [wd3,1-3]  him to success ?  If you have learned something about him, you'll get an explicit answer.     To begin with, he is full of curiosity.  He wants to find out how and why the world is.  He usually directs his attention towards problem [np6,4-7]  which he notices have no satisfactory explanation, and his curiosity makes him look for the accurate answer.  Because of his observance, he found the isochronism [fm1,-] of pendiculum [fm1,-].  To a scientist, it is the basic element.     Secondly, he is skeptical [fm1,-].  He doesn't accept the statements which aren't based on the most complete evidence available, and makes experiments carefully and objectively to verify them.  He isn't take the authority for granted.[sn,s].   As we all know, Galileo restated the heliocebtric [fm1,-] theory after Copernicus.  During that times [np5,2-] , it was thought as heresay [fm1,-]. Nevertheless, his theory has been proved to be true to this day.     Thirdly, he is persistent.  He was sure that his viewpoint was true [wd3,3-] .  Although the professor threatened him; [sn9,-]  the students sneered at him; [sn9,-]  even the cardinal persecuted him, he didn't take these into consideration.  In fact, he would not bow to the religious power.     As a scientist, he achieved many achievements; as a man, he had the excellent characters.  His name -- Galileo like a star shining in the sky. [sn2,s-]   We will remember him forever.
