What a brilliant scene and what a beautiful sky at twilight!  

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 21><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>
I'm against the verdict that the boy was not guilty. First, I believe that what the old man said was true.  It's possible for him to hear the boy say  "I'm going to kill you"  though the train was roaring over and it's also possible for him to walk to the front door from his bed within 15 seconds.  Nowadays, scientists have proven that in some special situation [np6,2-] , we can show the potential of our physical ability and do something we can not do in usual time [pp2,2-] .  Suppose   the boy was about to kill his father, the words "I am going to kill you" should sound more hoarse and terroble [fm1,-] , different from the words "I'll kill you"  we said in our daily life.  If the old man did hear the words and then hear the sound of the falling of a body, think of it, it's not a wonder for the old man to get to the front door as quickly as possible   to see what had happened. Secondly, I am still not sure whether the woman weared [fm2,-]  her glasses or not when she was tossing and turning. It's true that people usually don't wear glasses to bed.  But that does not mean there is no exception.  One of my friends often goes to bed, forgetting to put off [vp2,3-2]  her glasses, and she often finds that the  [np7,13-2] next morning.  What's more, the woman's eyesight has not been examined, and in fact, we have no idea about her exact eyesight situation.  How can we draw the conclusion that she could not see the murderer even if she didn't wear her glasses. Finally, let's turn to the downward angle of the knife.  They said if the boy had ever used a switch knife, he would never stabbed downward.  But how can we know the boy was experienced with switch knives?  And even if the boy was, since the stabbing probably happen after a struggle, the knife was not necessarily used underhanded.  We can not exclude the possibility that the boy killed his father accidentally in the struggle.  In that case, the angle can be downward. So, all comes to this: the boy was guilty.  

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 18><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                           
Christmas and the Spring Festival         The Spring Festival in China and the Christmas in USA are both the most [wd4,2-1]  festival of the year.  In those days, the people [np6,-4]  in the two countries have vacation to celebrate the new year.  And the [np7,-1]  Christmas also has a fairy tale to celebrate the birth of Christ.     Chinese  and Americans have different cultures.  The Spring Festival and the [np7,-1]  Christmas are also different.     In China, the Spring Festival is from December 24 to January 15 next year in lunar calendar.  In those days, people decorated [vp6,19-]  the gate with the traditional color of red, especially the red lantern and the couplet with blessing words.  And you will see many kinds of colorful balloons and firecrackers everywhere.  In the United States, the spirit of Christmas arrives about a month before the holiday itself, December 25. ate in November, street lights and store windows are decorated with the traditional Christmas color [np6,-4]  of   red and green.  Snowmen, Santa Claus, shepherds, angels, and Nativity scenes appear in countless shop windows.  Fir tree [np6,1-2] , holly wreaths, and mistletoe are familiar sights.  Families decorate their homes, inside and out, with colored lights and evergreens.     In [pp1,-2]  [np7,-2]  Spring  Festival, most of the Chinese will go home from other places to have a family reunion.  The whole family will enjoy a big happy dinner which we call a reunion dinner.  It's the most important and happy [aj3,3-]  thing to all the Chinese, because we have a most deep [aj3,2-]  love to [pp1,1-2]  the relatives.  On Christmas, many American families go to church and enjoy a traditional Christmas dinner just like [np7,1-1]  Chinese, but I don't think it's [pr1,19-]  as important as to the Chinese.  And now more and more people going to church is only for fun.[sn,s].      Both in the Spring Festival and on Christmas, are children [wd1,10-]  the happiest because they can get a lot of gifts.  In American [wd3,1-] , children could receive toys from Santa Claus in their stockings and they exchange gifts with their parents under the Christmas tree.  In China, on the New Year's Day, the children should get up earlier than their parents and kowtow to them, then they can get their lucky money. [sn1,s] Now of course they needn't kowtow.  Besides they can also get money from their grandparents, aunts, [wd4,2-1]  uncles.  So in the new year the children are very rich.  They can buy everything they like.     Although the Spring Festival in China is different from the Christmas in US, they are of the same importance to people.  I like the days of [np7,-2]  Spring Festival, for I can relax to my heart's content.  Perhaps the Americans have the same feeling with me.  

<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 18><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1> 
Do you think the art [wd3,-1]  course and the science course should be completely separated?  In fact, I don't think so.  The art [wd3,-1]  and the science are two different courses, but they connect [vp7,2-3]  to each other very much.  The art [wd3,-1]  trains people's understanding  skill, and the science trains people's logical skill.  However, the understanding and the logical skills are both very important in the art [wd3,2-4]  and the science.  In China, from senior [wd4,1-1]  school we separate [np7,2-4]  art [wd3,2-3]  from [np7,3-2]  science completely.  I think it's a serious problem.      How to study the art [wd3,4-]  and the science, here I have some opion [fm1,-]  of my own.  In studying the two different courses, there are resemblances and differences.  The resemblances are such as carefulness, memory, and observation. [sn8,s]   Carefulness is the most important in doing everything. With care, you can distinguish two similar things easily and can find something other people can't see.  So carefulness can improve your memory and observant skill.  Actually good studying methods are all good to the art [wd3,-3]  and the science. [sn8,s]   However, the art [wd3,1-3]  and the science lay particular stress on them [pr1,s-] .  For example the art [wd3, 1-]   needs more memory and the science requires more observation; the art [wd3,1-1]  students should have more understanding efforts [wd3,1-]  and the science students with more logical efforts [wd3,1-]  are better.  In studying art [wd3,2-] , you should have more patience because there are a lot of things for you to memorize and most of the things are very similar to each other.  You will confuse them easily unless you rememorize them frequently. In studying science, there are only some main formulas you should memorize.  Then you should learn to use them to deduct the others.  So if you have a good head for logic, that's very good. Studying is very flexible.  It's hard to say which method is the best.  Different people study in different ways.     The art [wd3,1-3]  and the science are of the same importance to our society.  I believe if we were good at both of them, the society would develope [fm1,-]  more quickly, I hope the day is not far away. 
  
<ST 5><SEX 2><Y 8><SCH Zhongda><AGE 18><WAY 1><DIC 1><TYP 1>                                                                    Galileo      As we all know, Galileo was one of the most famous scientists in the world.  He had discovered the isochronism of pendulum and invented the compass, the thermometer and above all, the telescope.  All of these  benefited the whole world inestimably.  However, how about Galileo's character?  How can he did such things as other people couldn't do? [sn8,s]      The truth is always first grasped by a few people.  We call them scientist [np6,3-] .  The most important reason that they found out other people can't see is that they have intense interest and extraordinary observations [sn8,s]  Galileo was was just such a person.  He had entered the University  of Pisa to study medicine.  But his real interest was in mathematics and his experiments.  He dedicated his life to it despite a lot of difficulties.  And his discovery and inventions were surely oming [vp6,6-]  from his extraordinary observation in the ordinary life.    Besides, Galileo was used to challenge [vp5,4-]  and probe [vp5,6-]  the mystery of things.  He never took anything for granted.  In  his days, everyone in his hometown believed Aristotle's theories very much except Galileo.  He could not accept as authoritative the answers which the adults about him offered in response to his questions.  After his own examination, he challenged the theory of Aristotle in spite of he sneers of his students and the wrath of his professors.  His daring to do so obviously reflected his great courage and self-confidence.  There is none other than him.    In fact, in order to pursue the scientific truth he suffered a lot .  All the people in his hometown laughed at him, hated him, even then [wd5,10-2]   persecuted him because he didn't stop his "non sense" .  Finally he had to leave his hometown for Padua, where the pursuit of scientific studies would not be interfered by the Inquisition.  Although he got great success and became famous there, he was not happy.  Then he came back and there came his great tragedy.  In spite of the cruel persecution, he still persisted in the truth until he died.   Galileo was a great scientist.  For the truth he devoted all his time and even his valuable life, but his spirit would last for ever.

So in my childish heart Father was very far away from me.  In fact, I was a little afraid of him.  However, an unforgettable thing make [vp6,11-]  everything changed.[sn,s]. As for me, my parents are the best in the world, and I love them the most all  my life.

My View on Cigarette Smoking When you walk in the street you'll find many people are doing the some [fm1,-]  thing: smoking. Not only in public place [fm2,-] , [wd5,-]  in the street, or [wd5,-]  shops [sn9,-]  restaurants, post offices ect[fm1,-], but  also at home, man or woman, young or old seem to enjoy smoking. In my opinion, there is nothing more hateful than cigarette smoking. Why I hate cigarette smoking? Because I think smoking either wastes money or pulluts [fm1,-] the environment. Most important of all, it will do harm  to people's health. The smoking people will have such experience: Once you begin smoking, you'll [vp9,5-5]  never give it up easily. Many people have been a smoker [np3,5-0]  for several years, or even longer. Sometimes, they don't stop smoking until they die. So they must [vp9,0-5]  spend much money from [vp2,3-1]  smoking. On the contrary, [cj1,6-7]  smoking just does harm to people's [fm1,-]  health. According to the scientist's research, there are a lot of piosonous [fm1,-] substances in the cigarette. Among these substance [np3,1-0] , Nicotin[fm1,-] is the most poisonous thing. A [np7,0-1]  experiment proved that just a drop of Nicotin [fm1,-] will kill three strong horses. Just imagine  how many [np8,1-1]  Nicotin  [fm1,-] there is in the cigarette and how many Piosonous [fm1,-] substances the smoker breath [fm1,-]  into their lungs when they smoke! Scientists believe that smoking will cause lung cancer. They find people who smoke will have much more chances to gave [fm1,-]  lung cancer than those who don't smoke. In a word, cigarette smoking is the most hateful thing in the world. It either waste your money or does harm to your health. I hope there is no any one who smokes in this world, I don't like smoking very much, to be exact, I hate smoking. Smoking will do harm to the [np7,0-1]  people. It will cause all kinds f disease [np3,3-0] , the [np7,0-1]  cancer is most typical [aj3,1-] , which will lead to the death of people at last. In spite of it , it can also pollute air and do bad to the other people except for [wd5,-]  the smoker. It [pr2,0-4]  is no doubt, every smoker knows the damages that smoking will do, because there is [vp3,0-4]  "stop smoking" mark everywhere in public place [np3,3-0] . But to my surprise, they don't stop smoking  in spite of the other's health. Please stop smoking! But I think that studying abroad is not so easy and it needs the students' courage and determination to overcome all the difficulties. The Use of Computers As is known, computers are useful and important in modern life. Computer can do many things for modern people. With a computer, people can manage work [cc3,1-0]  easily and conveniently. Now most the factories, companies are equipped with computers. The computers deal with the cases and store the information to [pp1,3-2]  the manager [np6,1-0] . This makes work easy. And now computers have been more advanced than before. A computer can do many things. For example, you can send or recieve [fm1,-] an E-mail with the help of the multi-media. You can get the information you want very soon. This saves muck time for you. So, computers are of great use, they have made so much work easy, people may be surprised at the strength of science and skills. The Use of Computers The development of computers is very fast. Most of companies have used computers to help their work. Even any families have owned their computers. n fact, computer is a useful tool to human being. In order to protect our bicycles from being stolen again, we should do something to prevent theft. Almost every student who used [vp6,5-1]  bicycle has the experience of losing bicycles. almost [fm3,-]  every student who has lost his bicycles [np3,8-0]  would refer[wd3,-] to buy a second-hand bicycle which is much cheaper than a new one. However,  most of the second-hand bicycles are stolen from other students. The thieves continue to steal bicycles because they know whenever they succeed in getting one, they can easily  sell it on campus for [wd3,4-4]   a much lower price, say, sixty yuan, then [wd3,s-] a new one in the shop is more than three hundred yuan. Therefore , the more  bicycles are stolen, the ore people want to buy second-hand bicycles, and the more bicycles are stolen. This is a very bad circle. To solve the problem, we must work along two lines [wd3,4-] . First, we must strengthen the safeguard [vp2,3-] . Don't let the thieves to [vp2,4-4]  get bicycles so easily. Secondly, we should try to ban the second-hand bicycles because it may be stolen from one of our schoolmate [np3,4-] . If nobody want to buy the stolen bicycles, the thieves will not have their market [np3,3-] . All in all, bicycle theft has become more and more rampant [fm1,-]   [sn8,s] owing to the prosperity of the second-hand marker. We should secure the campus [vp2,3-2]  from thefts. besides [fm3,-] , we should not buy the stolen  bicycles. S government use [vp3,4-]  to encourage tax evaders to pay up their tax by promising no penalty. Although it helped the government [vp2,3-3]  raise tax revenues after  it was carried out, it still cannot [vp6, 2-] prove  [vp7,4-2]  to be  entire success [np2,2-] . it [fm3,-]  left problems. If it was carried out in China , it will take [wd3,1-2]effect. Amnesty means no punishment if you do according to the government. However, why do those truants evade tax [np3,1-] [sn2,s-]  . [sn9,-]  Do they save the money only to pay when a tax amnesty comes? f course not. Many of the tax heaters do not pay for their tax [np3,3-]  because they think they can free themselves from axes by not paying the money without being discovered. If the government cannot discover them, it [pr1,S-S]  still cannot do it against an amnesty. The tax amnesty cannot get all the tax evaders to pay up. Only a small part [wd3,2-2]  of them, who feel guilty, will pay up. If the government cannot find out and punish the other big part [wd3,3-] after the amnesty, the converts [wd7, 1-]  will feel unfair. And then they will evade tax again. Finally [cj1, -S] , the amnesty will become meaningless. Beside  [fm1,-] , in hope of another amnesty in the future tax collection [sn2, s-s]  ore difficult. Some people suggest that China can also offer [wd3,-] a tax-amnesty program to raise the tax revenues. The government, however, will not do that. Because the tax system in China is different from the U. S tax system [sn6,S-] . Take the personal income tax for example, in China, the income tax that an employee should pay is deducted from his salary before the company give [vp3,3-]  the rest to him. In this case, the chance for the employee to evade the income tax is very small. Then  a tax amnesty may mean nothing to them. In short, tax-amnesty can work for raising tax revenues, but it is not a perfect program. And it is not so suitable for China. Having a TV [vp2,3-]  gives you a lot. Its status in the society can not be replaced by any other things. Christmas is a big holiday in many countries. Although some people  may argue that Christmas should be a National Holiday in China too, it is impossible to become reality. Because different country [np3,1-1]  has different culture [np3,1-1] . China has its own customs and traditions including traditional holidays. Christmas is not an international holiday for the whole world to celebrate. It is originally a religious holiday, a yearly celebration of the birth of Jesus Christ. It became a national holiday in many western countries because a large part of their populations were Christian to whom Christmas was the biggest celebration in a year. They celebrated Christmas in their traditional way. By and by the Christmas celebration became part of the countries [np2, 1-1]  culture. Other people who are not Christian also enjoy the day. Therefore it became a big holiday of [pp1,1-3]  the whole country. However, inChina people who believe in the Christian religion are only a very small group, compared with the great [wd3,4-1]  population. Many people, especially the olders   [fm1,-], even don't know what Christian [fm1,-]  is. How can Christian [fm1,-] be a national holiday without many natives knowing it? Choristers [fm1,-]  has a long history in the West, but in China e know it just as a part of foreign culture which came into our country not long ago. It makes no sense to most of the Chinese people. China is a country with a history of thousands of years. From generation to generation, the Chinese nation has formed its own culture with distinctive feature  [np3,3-] . We also have our own holidays to celebrate. For example, the Spring Festival, the biggest traditional holiday to [wd3,-] Chinese people [sn9,-]  which [pr1,-]reflects [vp3,-]the Chinese feature [np3,3-]  and is also a part of our own culture. Christmas [sn9,-]  as a world famous day and an important day to the Christian, can be celebrated in China by the common people if they like, but it won't be a national holiday in China just as the Spring Festival won't be a national holiday in U. S. A. To sum up, there are different customs and traditions in different places. It is ot acceptable to put a typical culture of one country to another, ignoring the regional contrast. In conclusion, Christmas should not be a national holiday in China. Some people may think it convenient to let cars run in the campus. Campus is a place for students to study, but not a place for transportation. What we need is a clean and quiet environment which is suitable for our study. cars running in the campus will bring toxic gas and noise as well as a large amount of dust. The noise made by the running cars and the sudden  brakes spoil the tranquil [fm1,-]  environment. It's also a kind of pollution. In China, thousands of students rush to study abroad each year. Studying abroad has both advantages and disadvantages. Electricity provides power for them. Without it, these machines, as fish lives without water, could not work. And the productive [np2,2-1]  activities would be forced to stop. Electricity is also essential to our life [np3,2-] . Our electric appliances such as TV, radio, refrigerator and air-conditioner would become waste [wd2,1-2]  to us if there were [vp3,2-2]  no electricity. Owing to electricity, people can get light [vp2,23-]  in the evening, warmth in the cold winter and coolness in the hot summer. Without it, we could not live [vp1,-3]  a normal life. 	It is not exaggerated to say that electricity is as importance [wd2,3-4]  as water and air. We must save as much electricity as we can.  		Detergent is a chemical produce [wd2,3-4]  used for cleaning things, especially for cleaning clothing [wd3,2-]  and dishes. To keep our clothing [wd3,2-]  and dishes clean is so important in our everyday life that our world would not do without the invention of detergent. 	Just imagine [vp7,1-5]  what would happen to us if there is [vp8,2-2]  no detergent? Dirty clothing [wd3,1-]  and dishes would pile up. And the dirty mess would not only make us feel sick but also cause some illness [wd3,2-] . And our world would surely be at sixes and sevens. Some people may say that we can use some kind of tree [np3,3-]  as well as people in actient  [fm1,-] time [np2,3-] . But in morden  [fm1,-] society, how can the poor productivity of that kind of trees meet our great need?	To keep our things clean is important for us to survive on the planet. And detergent does the most important role in cleaning. It's really an invention our world could [wd4,s-2]  do without.  	If the human being does not invent the electric power, the world could not do [wd3,4-] . 	I  am sure I do not exaggerate what I say. In fact, every day we need and use electric power. When we watch the TV [vp2,3-] , we need [wd4,1-1]  power. When we enjoy the air-condition, we as well need [wd1,3-2]  the power. In other words, if we use electric machine, we must use the electric power. Besides the need of our daily lives, the social development also need [vp3,4-1]  power . Without power, the factories can't work, the schools can't open normally, the shops an't open and the lifts can't work. At night, without power, the world will be dark everywhere, people not only can't work but also can't entertain [vp1,1-] . The world will become depressing [ad2,2-1]  dark. Above all, we know the importance of the power. It is necessary and useful. We can't do without it. The world could not do without it.  	An invention the world could not do without [sn8,s]  is clothes. 	Clothes are one of the primitive element [np3,4-3]  for human life. We cover our body with clothes. It's polite to do that. Wearing clothes prevent the sunlight from burning our skins. The most importance [wd2,2-2]  of all, we use clothes to keep warm. In primitive society, the primitive used animal skins as clothes. It assured [vp7,1-1]  that they wouldn't die of cold [wd2,2-]  easily. Fancy one day we would haven't [vp2,2-2]  any clothes. Even if we wouldn't be shy to face each other, we would die of cold [wd2,2-] . Especially to the weak and the old, they haven't enough energy to keep warm. Clothes are their necessities. 	In a word, clothes are our daily necessities. They protect us in a hot and cold weather.

<ST 5> <SEX 2> <Y 10> <SCH WSD> <AGE 20> <WAY 1> <DIC 2> <TYP 1> 	Reading extensively is a good habit, it's necessary for us to form this habit. [sn1,s]Reading extensively is good to increase your [fm1,-]  word power, you can also get more background knowledge from the book you read extensively. [sn1,s]	 [sn7,0-4] Learning a foreign language, vocabulary is  [fm1,-] veer importance[wd2,-]. If you don't master enough words, you will have difficulty in progressing.  [fm3,-] however, to keep new words in mind is difficult to most of us. Reading extensively can help you save[wd3,-] this hard problem. In our daily life, we are familiar with the things we often see. It's the same in  [wd3,-] remembering new words , you can't remember a new word when you meet it first time, but you'll sure[wd2,-] remember it after you meet it several times. [sn1,s]Reading extensively offers the chance to you to meet the new words again and again, that means reading extensively is helpful in mastering new words. [sn1,s]Reading extensively will also help you get more background knowledge [sn9,-] During extensive reading, you will come across all kinds of subjects, and different subject[fm1,-]offers you different knowledge.  [fm3,-] as time goes by, you will get different kinds of knowledge. As a result,  [np7,-] the reading comprehension is just a piece of cake to you. My view [fm3,-]  on one-child [fm3,-]  [fm3,-]  policy	The population of 1. 2 billion has been a great burden on China. In this situation, the government's one-child policy is necessary. With the big cardinal figure, Chinese population grows by leaps and bounds, bringing a lot of trouble. Food is the first thing's firs [fm1,-] . With [wd3,3-]  the large population, the country's food supply proves inadequate. Over-population would cause mass starvation. In addition, the country would be overcrowded and ecology would be out of balance. Eating in a neighbourhood canteen is [fm1,-]  disadvantageous	To avoid the trouble of cooking and doing wash-up, some people prefer to eat in a neighbourhood canteen. Yet, more trouble can be found there. As you stand in the long queue for the meal, a lot of time is wasted, not to say someone might carelessly drop some soup on your white shirt. [sn8,s] There're so many people there that grabing [fm1,-] a seat is not an easy job. Sitting in the stuffy and nosy [fm1,-]  air, fussed by some flies, you can't help losing appetite. The food is supposed to be delicious, but many a time you're disappointed to find the dishes unpotable [fm1,-]. They turn out to be too rare or burnt, with too much or no salt. If you can't get to the canteen in time because of the raining [wd3,-1]  day or working late, no meals are available. The worst may be that infectious disease are easily caught there because the plates and bowls are not cleaned thoroughly. It sounds nice to take some pains to cook a favorite meal and then sit comfortably enjoying it in your pleasant dinning-room, doesn't it?
